And at last</div><div class='line' id='LC5370'>they sent for thee, Sir Boss, to try magic and enchantment; and</div><div class='line' id='LC5371'>if you could not come, then was the messenger to fetch Merlin,</div><div class='line' id='LC5372'>and he is there these three days now, and saith he will fetch that</div><div class='line' id='LC5373'>water though he burst the globe and wreck its kingdoms to accomplish</div><div class='line' id='LC5374'>it; and right bravely doth he work his magic and call upon his</div><div class='line' id='LC5375'>hellions to hie them hither and help, but not a whiff of moisture</div><div class='line' id='LC5376'>hath he started yet, even so much as might qualify as mist upon</div><div class='line' id='LC5377'>a copper mirror an ye count not the barrel of sweat he sweateth</div><div class='line' id='LC5378'>betwixt sun and sun over the dire labors of his task; and if ye--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5379'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5380'>Breakfast was ready.  As soon as it was over I showed to Sir Ozana</div><div class='line' id='LC5381'>these words which I had written on the inside of his hat: &quot;Chemical</div><div class='line' id='LC5382'>Department, Laboratory extension, Section G. Pxxp.  Send two of</div><div class='line' id='LC5383'>first size, two of No. 3, and six of No. 4, together with the proper</div><div class='line' id='LC5384'>complementary details--and two of my trained assistants.&quot;  And I said:</div><div class='line' id='LC5385'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5386'>&quot;Now get you to Camelot as fast as you can fly, brave knight, and</div><div class='line' id='LC5387'>show the writing to Clarence, and tell him to have these required</div><div class='line' id='LC5388'>matters in the Valley of Holiness with all possible dispatch.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5389'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5390'>&quot;I will well, Sir Boss,&quot; and he was off.</div><div class='line' id='LC5391'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5392'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5393'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5394'>CHAPTER XXII</div><div class='line' id='LC5395'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5396'>THE HOLY FOUNTAIN</div><div class='line' id='LC5397'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5398'>The pilgrims were human beings.  Otherwise they would have acted</div><div class='line' id='LC5399'>differently.  They had come a long and difficult journey, and now</div><div class='line' id='LC5400'>when the journey was nearly finished, and they learned that the main</div><div class='line' id='LC5401'>thing they had come for had ceased to exist, they didn&#39;t do as</div><div class='line' id='LC5402'>horses or cats or angle-worms would probably have done--turn back</div><div class='line' id='LC5403'>and get at something profitable--no, anxious as they had before</div><div class='line' id='LC5404'>been to see the miraculous fountain, they were as much as forty</div><div class='line' id='LC5405'>times as anxious now to see the place where it had used to be.</div><div class='line' id='LC5406'>There is no accounting for human beings.</div><div class='line' id='LC5407'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5408'>We made good time; and a couple of hours before sunset we stood</div><div class='line' id='LC5409'>upon the high confines of the Valley of Holiness, and our eyes</div><div class='line' id='LC5410'>swept it from end to end and noted its features.  That is, its</div><div class='line' id='LC5411'>large features.  These were the three masses of buildings.  They</div><div class='line' id='LC5412'>were distant and isolated temporalities shrunken to toy constructions</div><div class='line' id='LC5413'>in the lonely waste of what seemed a desert--and was.  Such a scene</div><div class='line' id='LC5414'>is always mournful, it is so impressively still, and looks so</div><div class='line' id='LC5415'>steeped in death.  But there was a sound here which interrupted</div><div class='line' id='LC5416'>the stillness only to add to its mournfulness; this was the faint</div><div class='line' id='LC5417'>far sound of tolling bells which floated fitfully to us on the</div><div class='line' id='LC5418'>passing breeze, and so faintly, so softly, that we hardly knew</div><div class='line' id='LC5419'>whether we heard it with our ears or with our spirits.</div><div class='line' id='LC5420'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5421'>We reached the monastery before dark, and there the males were</div><div class='line' id='LC5422'>given lodging, but the women were sent over to the nunnery.  The</div><div class='line' id='LC5423'>bells were close at hand now, and their solemn booming smote</div><div class='line' id='LC5424'>upon the ear like a message of doom.  A superstitious despair</div><div class='line' id='LC5425'>possessed the heart of every monk and published itself in his</div><div class='line' id='LC5426'>ghastly face.  Everywhere, these black-robed, soft-sandaled,</div><div class='line' id='LC5427'>tallow-visaged specters appeared, flitted about and disappeared,</div><div class='line' id='LC5428'>noiseless as the creatures of a troubled dream, and as uncanny.</div><div class='line' id='LC5429'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5430'>The old abbot&#39;s joy to see me was pathetic.  Even to tears; but</div><div class='line' id='LC5431'>he did the shedding himself.  He said:</div><div class='line' id='LC5432'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5433'>&quot;Delay not, son, but get to thy saving work.  An we bring not</div><div class='line' id='LC5434'>the water back again, and soon, we are ruined, and the good work</div><div class='line' id='LC5435'>of two hundred years must end.  And see thou do it with enchantments</div><div class='line' id='LC5436'>that be holy, for the Church will not endure that work in her cause</div><div class='line' id='LC5437'>be done by devil&#39;s magic.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5438'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5439'>&quot;When I work, Father, be sure there will be no devil&#39;s work</div><div class='line' id='LC5440'>connected with it.  I shall use no arts that come of the devil,</div><div class='line' id='LC5441'>and no elements not created by the hand of God.  But is Merlin</div><div class='line' id='LC5442'>working strictly on pious lines?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5443'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5444'>&quot;Ah, he said he would, my son, he said he would, and took oath</div><div class='line' id='LC5445'>to make his promise good.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5446'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5447'>&quot;Well, in that case, let him proceed.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5448'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5449'>&quot;But surely you will not sit idle by, but help?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5450'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5451'>&quot;It will not answer to mix methods, Father; neither would it be</div><div class='line' id='LC5452'>professional courtesy.  Two of a trade must not underbid each</div><div class='line' id='LC5453'>other.  We might as well cut rates and be done with it; it would</div><div class='line' id='LC5454'>arrive at that in the end.  Merlin has the contract; no other</div><div class='line' id='LC5455'>magician can touch it till he throws it up.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5456'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5457'>&quot;But I will take it from him; it is a terrible emergency and the</div><div class='line' id='LC5458'>act is thereby justified.  And if it were not so, who will give</div><div class='line' id='LC5459'>law to the Church?  The Church giveth law to all; and what she</div><div class='line' id='LC5460'>wills to do, that she may do, hurt whom it may.  I will take it</div><div class='line' id='LC5461'>from him; you shall begin upon the moment.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5462'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5463'>&quot;It may not be, Father.  No doubt, as you say, where power is</div><div class='line' id='LC5464'>supreme, one can do as one likes and suffer no injury; but we poor</div><div class='line' id='LC5465'>magicians are not so situated.  Merlin is a very good magician</div><div class='line' id='LC5466'>in a small way, and has quite a neat provincial reputation.  He</div><div class='line' id='LC5467'>is struggling along, doing the best he can, and it would not be</div><div class='line' id='LC5468'>etiquette for me to take his job until he himself abandons it.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5469'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5470'>The abbot&#39;s face lighted.</div><div class='line' id='LC5471'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5472'>&quot;Ah, that is simple.  There are ways to persuade him to abandon it.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5473'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5474'>&quot;No-no, Father, it skills not, as these people say.  If he were</div><div class='line' id='LC5475'>persuaded against his will, he would load that well with a malicious</div><div class='line' id='LC5476'>enchantment which would balk me until I found out its secret.</div><div class='line' id='LC5477'>It might take a month.  I could set up a little enchantment of</div><div class='line' id='LC5478'>mine which I call the telephone, and he could not find out its</div><div class='line' id='LC5479'>secret in a hundred years.  Yes, you perceive, he might block me</div><div class='line' id='LC5480'>for a month.  Would you like to risk a month in a dry time like this?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5481'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5482'>&quot;A month!  The mere thought of it maketh me to shudder.  Have it</div><div class='line' id='LC5483'>thy way, my son.  But my heart is heavy with this disappointment.</div><div class='line' id='LC5484'>Leave me, and let me wear my spirit with weariness and waiting,</div><div class='line' id='LC5485'>even as I have done these ten long days, counterfeiting thus</div><div class='line' id='LC5486'>the thing that is called rest, the prone body making outward sign</div><div class='line' id='LC5487'>of repose where inwardly is none.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5488'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5489'>Of course, it would have been best, all round, for Merlin to waive</div><div class='line' id='LC5490'>etiquette and quit and call it half a day, since he would never be</div><div class='line' id='LC5491'>able to start that water, for he was a true magician of the time;</div><div class='line' id='LC5492'>which is to say, the big miracles, the ones that gave him his</div><div class='line' id='LC5493'>reputation, always had the luck to be performed when nobody but</div><div class='line' id='LC5494'>Merlin was present; he couldn&#39;t start this well with all this crowd</div><div class='line' id='LC5495'>around to see; a crowd was as bad for a magician&#39;s miracle in</div><div class='line' id='LC5496'>that day as it was for a spiritualist&#39;s miracle in mine; there was</div><div class='line' id='LC5497'>sure to be some skeptic on hand to turn up the gas at the crucial</div><div class='line' id='LC5498'>moment and spoil everything.  But I did not want Merlin to retire</div><div class='line' id='LC5499'>from the job until I was ready to take hold of it effectively</div><div class='line' id='LC5500'>myself; and I could not do that until I got my things from Camelot,</div><div class='line' id='LC5501'>and that would take two or three days.</div><div class='line' id='LC5502'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5503'>My presence gave the monks hope, and cheered them up a good deal;</div><div class='line' id='LC5504'>insomuch that they ate a square meal that night for the first time</div><div class='line' id='LC5505'>in ten days.  As soon as their stomachs had been properly reinforced</div><div class='line' id='LC5506'>with food, their spirits began to rise fast; when the mead began to</div><div class='line' id='LC5507'>go round they rose faster.  By the time everybody was half-seas over,</div><div class='line' id='LC5508'>the holy community was in good shape to make a night of it; so we</div><div class='line' id='LC5509'>stayed by the board and put it through on that line.  Matters got</div><div class='line' id='LC5510'>to be very jolly.  Good old questionable stories were told that made</div><div class='line' id='LC5511'>the tears run down and cavernous mouths stand wide and the round</div><div class='line' id='LC5512'>bellies shake with laughter; and questionable songs were bellowed out</div><div class='line' id='LC5513'>in a mighty chorus that drowned the boom of the tolling bells.</div><div class='line' id='LC5514'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5515'>At last I ventured a story myself; and vast was the success of it.</div><div class='line' id='LC5516'>Not right off, of course, for the native of those islands does</div><div class='line' id='LC5517'>not, as a rule, dissolve upon the early applications of a humorous</div><div class='line' id='LC5518'>thing; but the fifth time I told it, they began to crack in places;</div><div class='line' id='LC5519'>the eight time I told it, they began to crumble; at the twelfth</div><div class='line' id='LC5520'>repetition they fell apart in chunks; and at the fifteenth they</div><div class='line' id='LC5521'>disintegrated, and I got a broom and swept them up.  This language</div><div class='line' id='LC5522'>is figurative.  Those islanders--well, they are slow pay at first,</div><div class='line' id='LC5523'>in the matter of return for your investment of effort, but in the end</div><div class='line' id='LC5524'>they make the pay of all other nations poor and small by contrast.</div><div class='line' id='LC5525'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5526'>I was at the well next day betimes.  Merlin was there, enchanting</div><div class='line' id='LC5527'>away like a beaver, but not raising the moisture.  He was not in</div><div class='line' id='LC5528'>a pleasant humor; and every time I hinted that perhaps this contract</div><div class='line' id='LC5529'>was a shade too hefty for a novice he unlimbered his tongue and</div><div class='line' id='LC5530'>cursed like a bishop--French bishop of the Regency days, I mean.</div><div class='line' id='LC5531'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5532'>Matters were about as I expected to find them.  The &quot;fountain&quot; was</div><div class='line' id='LC5533'>an ordinary well, it had been dug in the ordinary way, and stoned up</div><div class='line' id='LC5534'>in the ordinary way.  There was no miracle about it.  Even the lie</div><div class='line' id='LC5535'>that had created its reputation was not miraculous; I could have</div><div class='line' id='LC5536'>told it myself, with one hand tied behind me.  The well was in a</div><div class='line' id='LC5537'>dark chamber which stood in the center of a cut-stone chapel, whose</div><div class='line' id='LC5538'>walls were hung with pious pictures of a workmanship that would</div><div class='line' id='LC5539'>have made a chromo feel good; pictures historically commemorative</div><div class='line' id='LC5540'>of curative miracles which had been achieved by the waters when</div><div class='line' id='LC5541'>nobody was looking.  That is, nobody but angels; they are always</div><div class='line' id='LC5542'>on deck when there is a miracle to the fore--so as to get put in</div><div class='line' id='LC5543'>the picture, perhaps.  Angels are as fond of that as a fire company;</div><div class='line' id='LC5544'>look at the old masters.</div><div class='line' id='LC5545'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5546'>The well-chamber was dimly lighted by lamps; the water was drawn</div><div class='line' id='LC5547'>with a windlass and chain by monks, and poured into troughs which</div><div class='line' id='LC5548'>delivered it into stone reservoirs outside in the chapel--when</div><div class='line' id='LC5549'>there was water to draw, I mean--and none but monks could enter</div><div class='line' id='LC5550'>the well-chamber.  I entered it, for I had temporary authority</div><div class='line' id='LC5551'>to do so, by courtesy of my professional brother and subordinate.</div><div class='line' id='LC5552'>But he hadn&#39;t entered it himself.  He did everything by incantations;</div><div class='line' id='LC5553'>he never worked his intellect.  If he had stepped in there and used</div><div class='line' id='LC5554'>his eyes, instead of his disordered mind, he could have cured</div><div class='line' id='LC5555'>the well by natural means, and then turned it into a miracle in</div><div class='line' id='LC5556'>the customary way; but no, he was an old numskull, a magician who</div><div class='line' id='LC5557'>believed in his own magic; and no magician can thrive who is</div><div class='line' id='LC5558'>handicapped with a superstition like that.</div><div class='line' id='LC5559'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5560'>I had an idea that the well had sprung a leak; that some of the</div><div class='line' id='LC5561'>wall stones near the bottom had fallen and exposed fissures that</div><div class='line' id='LC5562'>allowed the water to escape.  I measured the chain--98 feet.  Then</div><div class='line' id='LC5563'>I called in a couple of monks, locked the door, took a candle, and</div><div class='line' id='LC5564'>made them lower me in the bucket.  When the chain was all paid out,</div><div class='line' id='LC5565'>the candle confirmed my suspicion; a considerable section of the</div><div class='line' id='LC5566'>wall was gone, exposing a good big fissure.</div><div class='line' id='LC5567'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5568'>I almost regretted that my theory about the well&#39;s trouble was</div><div class='line' id='LC5569'>correct, because I had another one that had a showy point or two</div><div class='line' id='LC5570'>about it for a miracle.  I remembered that in America, many</div><div class='line' id='LC5571'>centuries later, when an oil well ceased to flow, they used to</div><div class='line' id='LC5572'>blast it out with a dynamite torpedo.  If I should find this well</div><div class='line' id='LC5573'>dry and no explanation of it, I could astonish these people most</div><div class='line' id='LC5574'>nobly by having a person of no especial value drop a dynamite</div><div class='line' id='LC5575'>bomb into it.  It was my idea to appoint Merlin.  However, it was</div><div class='line' id='LC5576'>plain that there was no occasion for the bomb.  One cannot have</div><div class='line' id='LC5577'>everything the way he would like it.  A man has no business to</div><div class='line' id='LC5578'>be depressed by a disappointment, anyway; he ought to make up his</div><div class='line' id='LC5579'>mind to get even.  That is what I did.  I said to myself, I am in no</div><div class='line' id='LC5580'>hurry, I can wait; that bomb will come good yet.  And it did, too.</div><div class='line' id='LC5581'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5582'>When I was above ground again, I turned out the monks, and let down</div><div class='line' id='LC5583'>a fish-line; the well was a hundred and fifty feet deep, and there</div><div class='line' id='LC5584'>was forty-one feet of water in it.  I called in a monk and asked:</div><div class='line' id='LC5585'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5586'>&quot;How deep is the well?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5587'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5588'>&quot;That, sir, I wit not, having never been told.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5589'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5590'>&quot;How does the water usually stand in it?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5591'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5592'>&quot;Near to the top, these two centuries, as the testimony goeth,</div><div class='line' id='LC5593'>brought down to us through our predecessors.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5594'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5595'>It was true--as to recent times at least--for there was witness</div><div class='line' id='LC5596'>to it, and better witness than a monk; only about twenty or thirty</div><div class='line' id='LC5597'>feet of the chain showed wear and use, the rest of it was unworn</div><div class='line' id='LC5598'>and rusty.  What had happened when the well gave out that other</div><div class='line' id='LC5599'>time?  Without doubt some practical person had come along and</div><div class='line' id='LC5600'>mended the leak, and then had come up and told the abbot he had</div><div class='line' id='LC5601'>discovered by divination that if the sinful bath were destroyed</div><div class='line' id='LC5602'>the well would flow again.  The leak had befallen again now, and</div><div class='line' id='LC5603'>these children would have prayed, and processioned, and tolled</div><div class='line' id='LC5604'>their bells for heavenly succor till they all dried up and blew</div><div class='line' id='LC5605'>away, and no innocent of them all would ever have thought to drop</div><div class='line' id='LC5606'>a fish-line into the well or go down in it and find out what was</div><div class='line' id='LC5607'>really the matter.  Old habit of mind is one of the toughest things</div><div class='line' id='LC5608'>to get away from in the world.  It transmits itself like physical</div><div class='line' id='LC5609'>form and feature; and for a man, in those days, to have had an idea</div><div class='line' id='LC5610'>that his ancestors hadn&#39;t had, would have brought him under suspicion</div><div class='line' id='LC5611'>of being illegitimate.  I said to the monk:</div><div class='line' id='LC5612'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5613'>&quot;It is a difficult miracle to restore water in a dry well, but we</div><div class='line' id='LC5614'>will try, if my brother Merlin fails.  Brother Merlin is a very</div><div class='line' id='LC5615'>passable artist, but only in the parlor-magic line, and he may</div><div class='line' id='LC5616'>not succeed; in fact, is not likely to succeed.  But that should</div><div class='line' id='LC5617'>be nothing to his discredit; the man that can do _this_ kind of</div><div class='line' id='LC5618'>miracle knows enough to keep hotel.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5619'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5620'>&quot;Hotel?  I mind not to have heard--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5621'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5622'>&quot;Of hotel?  It&#39;s what you call hostel.  The man that can do this</div><div class='line' id='LC5623'>miracle can keep hostel.  I can do this miracle; I shall do this</div><div class='line' id='LC5624'>miracle; yet I do not try to conceal from you that it is a miracle</div><div class='line' id='LC5625'>to tax the occult powers to the last strain.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5626'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5627'>&quot;None knoweth that truth better than the brotherhood, indeed; for</div><div class='line' id='LC5628'>it is of record that aforetime it was parlous difficult and took</div><div class='line' id='LC5629'>a year.  Natheless, God send you good success, and to that end</div><div class='line' id='LC5630'>will we pray.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5631'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5632'>As a matter of business it was a good idea to get the notion around</div><div class='line' id='LC5633'>that the thing was difficult.  Many a small thing has been made</div><div class='line' id='LC5634'>large by the right kind of advertising.  That monk was filled up</div><div class='line' id='LC5635'>with the difficulty of this enterprise; he would fill up the others.</div><div class='line' id='LC5636'>In two days the solicitude would be booming.</div><div class='line' id='LC5637'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5638'>On my way home at noon, I met Sandy.  She had been sampling the</div><div class='line' id='LC5639'>hermits.  I said:</div><div class='line' id='LC5640'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5641'>&quot;I would like to do that myself.  This is Wednesday.  Is there</div><div class='line' id='LC5642'>a matinee?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5643'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5644'>&quot;A which, please you, sir?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5645'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5646'>&quot;Matinee.  Do they keep open afternoons?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5647'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5648'>&quot;Who?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5649'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5650'>&quot;The hermits, of course.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5651'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5652'>&quot;Keep open?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5653'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5654'>&quot;Yes, keep open.  Isn&#39;t that plain enough?  Do they knock off at noon?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5655'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5656'>&quot;Knock off?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5657'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5658'>&quot;Knock off?--yes, knock off.  What is the matter with knock off?</div><div class='line' id='LC5659'>I never saw such a dunderhead; can&#39;t you understand anything at all?</div><div class='line' id='LC5660'>In plain terms, do they shut up shop, draw the game, bank the fires--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5661'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5662'>&quot;Shut up shop, draw--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5663'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5664'>&quot;There, never mind, let it go; you make me tired.  You can&#39;t seem</div><div class='line' id='LC5665'>to understand the simplest thing.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5666'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5667'>&quot;I would I might please thee, sir, and it is to me dole and sorrow</div><div class='line' id='LC5668'>that I fail, albeit sith I am but a simple damsel and taught of</div><div class='line' id='LC5669'>none, being from the cradle unbaptized in those deep waters of</div><div class='line' id='LC5670'>learning that do anoint with a sovereignty him that partaketh of</div><div class='line' id='LC5671'>that most noble sacrament, investing him with reverend state to</div><div class='line' id='LC5672'>the mental eye of the humble mortal who, by bar and lack of that</div><div class='line' id='LC5673'>great consecration seeth in his own unlearned estate but a symbol</div><div class='line' id='LC5674'>of that other sort of lack and loss which men do publish to the</div><div class='line' id='LC5675'>pitying eye with sackcloth trappings whereon the ashes of grief</div><div class='line' id='LC5676'>do lie bepowdered and bestrewn, and so, when such shall in the</div><div class='line' id='LC5677'>darkness of his mind encounter these golden phrases of high mystery,</div><div class='line' id='LC5678'>these shut-up-shops, and draw-the-game, and bank-the-fires, it is</div><div class='line' id='LC5679'>but by the grace of God that he burst not for envy of the mind that</div><div class='line' id='LC5680'>can beget, and tongue that can deliver so great and mellow-sounding</div><div class='line' id='LC5681'>miracles of speech, and if there do ensue confusion in that humbler</div><div class='line' id='LC5682'>mind, and failure to divine the meanings of these wonders, then</div><div class='line' id='LC5683'>if so be this miscomprehension is not vain but sooth and true,</div><div class='line' id='LC5684'>wit ye well it is the very substance of worshipful dear homage and</div><div class='line' id='LC5685'>may not lightly be misprized, nor had been, an ye had noted this</div><div class='line' id='LC5686'>complexion of mood and mind and understood that that I would</div><div class='line' id='LC5687'>I could not, and that I could not I might not, nor yet nor might</div><div class='line' id='LC5688'>_nor_ could, nor might-not nor could-not, might be by advantage</div><div class='line' id='LC5689'>turned to the desired _would_, and so I pray you mercy of my fault,</div><div class='line' id='LC5690'>and that ye will of your kindness and your charity forgive it, good</div><div class='line' id='LC5691'>my master and most dear lord.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5692'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5693'>I couldn&#39;t make it all out--that is, the details--but I got the</div><div class='line' id='LC5694'>general idea; and enough of it, too, to be ashamed.  It was not</div><div class='line' id='LC5695'>fair to spring those nineteenth century technicalities upon the</div><div class='line' id='LC5696'>untutored infant of the sixth and then rail at her because she</div><div class='line' id='LC5697'>couldn&#39;t get their drift; and when she was making the honest best</div><div class='line' id='LC5698'>drive at it she could, too, and no fault of hers that she couldn&#39;t</div><div class='line' id='LC5699'>fetch the home plate; and so I apologized.  Then we meandered</div><div class='line' id='LC5700'>pleasantly away toward the hermit holes in sociable converse</div><div class='line' id='LC5701'>together, and better friends than ever.</div><div class='line' id='LC5702'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5703'>I was gradually coming to have a mysterious and shuddery reverence</div><div class='line' id='LC5704'>for this girl; nowadays whenever she pulled out from the station</div><div class='line' id='LC5705'>and got her train fairly started on one of those horizonless</div><div class='line' id='LC5706'>transcontinental sentences of hers, it was borne in upon me that</div><div class='line' id='LC5707'>I was standing in the awful presence of the Mother of the German</div><div class='line' id='LC5708'>Language.  I was so impressed with this, that sometimes when she</div><div class='line' id='LC5709'>began to empty one of these sentences on me I unconsciously took</div><div class='line' id='LC5710'>the very attitude of reverence, and stood uncovered; and if words</div><div class='line' id='LC5711'>had been water, I had been drowned, sure.  She had exactly the</div><div class='line' id='LC5712'>German way; whatever was in her mind to be delivered, whether a</div><div class='line' id='LC5713'>mere remark, or a sermon, or a cyclopedia, or the history of a war,</div><div class='line' id='LC5714'>she would get it into a single sentence or die.  Whenever the literary</div><div class='line' id='LC5715'>German dives into a sentence, that is the last you are going to see</div><div class='line' id='LC5716'>of him till he emerges on the other side of his Atlantic with his</div><div class='line' id='LC5717'>verb in his mouth.</div><div class='line' id='LC5718'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5719'>We drifted from hermit to hermit all the afternoon.  It was a most</div><div class='line' id='LC5720'>strange menagerie.  The chief emulation among them seemed to be,</div><div class='line' id='LC5721'>to see which could manage to be the uncleanest and most prosperous</div><div class='line' id='LC5722'>with vermin.  Their manner and attitudes were the last expression</div><div class='line' id='LC5723'>of complacent self-righteousness.  It was one anchorite&#39;s pride</div><div class='line' id='LC5724'>to lie naked in the mud and let the insects bite him and blister</div><div class='line' id='LC5725'>him unmolested; it was another&#39;s to lean against a rock, all day</div><div class='line' id='LC5726'>long, conspicuous to the admiration of the throng of pilgrims</div><div class='line' id='LC5727'>and pray; it was another&#39;s to go naked and crawl around on all fours;</div><div class='line' id='LC5728'>it was another&#39;s to drag about with him, year in and year out,</div><div class='line' id='LC5729'>eighty pounds of iron; it was another&#39;s to never lie down when</div><div class='line' id='LC5730'>he slept, but to stand among the thorn-bushes and snore when there</div><div class='line' id='LC5731'>were pilgrims around to look; a woman, who had the white hair of</div><div class='line' id='LC5732'>age, and no other apparel, was black from crown to heel with</div><div class='line' id='LC5733'>forty-seven years of holy abstinence from water.  Groups of gazing</div><div class='line' id='LC5734'>pilgrims stood around all and every of these strange objects, lost</div><div class='line' id='LC5735'>in reverent wonder, and envious of the fleckless sanctity which</div><div class='line' id='LC5736'>these pious austerities had won for them from an exacting heaven.</div><div class='line' id='LC5737'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5738'>By and by we went to see one of the supremely great ones.  He was</div><div class='line' id='LC5739'>a mighty celebrity; his fame had penetrated all Christendom; the</div><div class='line' id='LC5740'>noble and the renowned journeyed from the remotest lands on the globe</div><div class='line' id='LC5741'>to pay him reverence.  His stand was in the center of the widest part</div><div class='line' id='LC5742'>of the valley; and it took all that space to hold his crowds.</div><div class='line' id='LC5743'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5744'>His stand was a pillar sixty feet high, with a broad platform on</div><div class='line' id='LC5745'>the top of it.  He was now doing what he had been doing every day</div><div class='line' id='LC5746'>for twenty years up there--bowing his body ceaselessly and rapidly</div><div class='line' id='LC5747'>almost to his feet.  It was his way of praying.  I timed him with a</div><div class='line' id='LC5748'>stop watch, and he made 1,244 revolutions in 24 minutes and</div><div class='line' id='LC5749'>46 seconds.  It seemed a pity to have all this power going to waste.</div><div class='line' id='LC5750'>It was one of the most useful motions in mechanics, the pedal</div><div class='line' id='LC5751'>movement; so I made a note in my memorandum book, purposing some</div><div class='line' id='LC5752'>day to apply a system of elastic cords to him and run a sewing</div><div class='line' id='LC5753'>machine with it.  I afterward carried out that scheme, and got</div><div class='line' id='LC5754'>five years&#39; good service out of him; in which time he turned out</div><div class='line' id='LC5755'>upward of eighteen thousand first-rate tow-linen shirts, which</div><div class='line' id='LC5756'>was ten a day.  I worked him Sundays and all; he was going, Sundays,</div><div class='line' id='LC5757'>the same as week days, and it was no use to waste the power.</div><div class='line' id='LC5758'>These shirts cost me nothing but just the mere trifle for the</div><div class='line' id='LC5759'>materials--I furnished those myself, it would not have been right</div><div class='line' id='LC5760'>to make him do that--and they sold like smoke to pilgrims at a</div><div class='line' id='LC5761'>dollar and a half apiece, which was the price of fifty cows or</div><div class='line' id='LC5762'>a blooded race horse in Arthurdom.  They were regarded as a perfect</div><div class='line' id='LC5763'>protection against sin, and advertised as such by my knights</div><div class='line' id='LC5764'>everywhere, with the paint-pot and stencil-plate; insomuch that</div><div class='line' id='LC5765'>there was not a cliff or a bowlder or a dead wall in England but</div><div class='line' id='LC5766'>you could read on it at a mile distance:</div><div class='line' id='LC5767'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5768'>&quot;Buy the only genuine St. Stylite; patronized by the Nobility.</div><div class='line' id='LC5769'>Patent applied for.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5770'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5771'>There was more money in the business than one knew what to do with.</div><div class='line' id='LC5772'>As it extended, I brought out a line of goods suitable for kings,</div><div class='line' id='LC5773'>and a nobby thing for duchesses and that sort, with ruffles down</div><div class='line' id='LC5774'>the forehatch and the running-gear clewed up with a featherstitch</div><div class='line' id='LC5775'>to leeward and then hauled aft with a back-stay and triced up with</div><div class='line' id='LC5776'>a half-turn in the standing rigging forward of the weather-gaskets.</div><div class='line' id='LC5777'>Yes, it was a daisy.</div><div class='line' id='LC5778'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5779'>But about that time I noticed that the motive power had taken to</div><div class='line' id='LC5780'>standing on one leg, and I found that there was something the matter</div><div class='line' id='LC5781'>with the other one; so I stocked the business and unloaded, taking</div><div class='line' id='LC5782'>Sir Bors de Ganis into camp financially along with certain of his</div><div class='line' id='LC5783'>friends; for the works stopped within a year, and the good saint</div><div class='line' id='LC5784'>got him to his rest.  But he had earned it.  I can say that for him.</div><div class='line' id='LC5785'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5786'>When I saw him that first time--however, his personal condition</div><div class='line' id='LC5787'>will not quite bear description here.  You can read it in the</div><div class='line' id='LC5788'>Lives of the Saints.*</div><div class='line' id='LC5789'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5790'>[*All the details concerning the hermits, in this chapter, are from</div><div class='line' id='LC5791'>Lecky--but greatly modified.  This book not being a history but</div><div class='line' id='LC5792'>only a tale, the majority of the historian&#39;s frank details were too</div><div class='line' id='LC5793'>strong for reproduction in it.--_Editor_]</div><div class='line' id='LC5794'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5795'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5796'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5797'>CHAPTER XXIII</div><div class='line' id='LC5798'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5799'>RESTORATION OF THE FOUNTAIN</div><div class='line' id='LC5800'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5801'>Saturday noon I went to the well and looked on a while.  Merlin</div><div class='line' id='LC5802'>was still burning smoke-powders, and pawing the air, and muttering</div><div class='line' id='LC5803'>gibberish as hard as ever, but looking pretty down-hearted, for</div><div class='line' id='LC5804'>of course he had not started even a perspiration in that well yet.</div><div class='line' id='LC5805'>Finally I said:</div><div class='line' id='LC5806'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5807'>&quot;How does the thing promise by this time, partner?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5808'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5809'>&quot;Behold, I am even now busied with trial of the powerfulest</div><div class='line' id='LC5810'>enchantment known to the princes of the occult arts in the lands</div><div class='line' id='LC5811'>of the East; an it fail me, naught can avail.  Peace, until I finish.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5812'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5813'>He raised a smoke this time that darkened all the region, and must</div><div class='line' id='LC5814'>have made matters uncomfortable for the hermits, for the wind</div><div class='line' id='LC5815'>was their way, and it rolled down over their dens in a dense and</div><div class='line' id='LC5816'>billowy fog.  He poured out volumes of speech to match, and contorted</div><div class='line' id='LC5817'>his body and sawed the air with his hands in a most extraordinary</div><div class='line' id='LC5818'>way.  At the end of twenty minutes he dropped down panting, and</div><div class='line' id='LC5819'>about exhausted.  Now arrived the abbot and several hundred monks</div><div class='line' id='LC5820'>and nuns, and behind them a multitude of pilgrims and a couple of</div><div class='line' id='LC5821'>acres of foundlings, all drawn by the prodigious smoke, and all</div><div class='line' id='LC5822'>in a grand state of excitement.  The abbot inquired anxiously for</div><div class='line' id='LC5823'>results.  Merlin said:</div><div class='line' id='LC5824'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5825'>&quot;If any labor of mortal might break the spell that binds these</div><div class='line' id='LC5826'>waters, this which I have but just essayed had done it.  It has</div><div class='line' id='LC5827'>failed; whereby I do now know that that which I had feared is</div><div class='line' id='LC5828'>a truth established; the sign of this failure is, that the most</div><div class='line' id='LC5829'>potent spirit known to the magicians of the East, and whose name</div><div class='line' id='LC5830'>none may utter and live, has laid his spell upon this well.  The</div><div class='line' id='LC5831'>mortal does not breathe, nor ever will, who can penetrate the secret</div><div class='line' id='LC5832'>of that spell, and without that secret none can break it.  The</div><div class='line' id='LC5833'>water will flow no more forever, good Father.  I have done what</div><div class='line' id='LC5834'>man could.  Suffer me to go.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5835'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5836'>Of course this threw the abbot into a good deal of a consternation.</div><div class='line' id='LC5837'>He turned to me with the signs of it in his face, and said:</div><div class='line' id='LC5838'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5839'>&quot;Ye have heard him. Is it true?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5840'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5841'>&quot;Part of it is.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5842'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5843'>&quot;Not all, then, not all!  What part is true?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5844'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5845'>&quot;That that spirit with the Russian name has put his spell</div><div class='line' id='LC5846'>upon the well.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5847'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5848'>&quot;God&#39;s wounds, then are we ruined!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5849'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5850'>&quot;Possibly.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5851'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5852'>&quot;But not certainly?  Ye mean, not certainly?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5853'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5854'>&quot;That is it.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5855'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5856'>&quot;Wherefore, ye also mean that when he saith none can break the spell--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5857'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5858'>&quot;Yes, when he says that, he says what isn&#39;t necessarily true.</div><div class='line' id='LC5859'>There are conditions under which an effort to break it may have</div><div class='line' id='LC5860'>some chance--that is, some small, some trifling chance--of success.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5861'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5862'>&quot;The conditions--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5863'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5864'>&quot;Oh, they are nothing difficult.  Only these: I want the well</div><div class='line' id='LC5865'>and the surroundings for the space of half a mile, entirely to</div><div class='line' id='LC5866'>myself from sunset to-day until I remove the ban--and nobody</div><div class='line' id='LC5867'>allowed to cross the ground but by my authority.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5868'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5869'>&quot;Are these all?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5870'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5871'>&quot;Yes.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5872'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5873'>&quot;And you have no fear to try?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5874'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5875'>&quot;Oh, none.  One may fail, of course; and one may also succeed.</div><div class='line' id='LC5876'>One can try, and I am ready to chance it.  I have my conditions?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5877'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5878'>&quot;These and all others ye may name.  I will issue commandment</div><div class='line' id='LC5879'>to that effect.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5880'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5881'>&quot;Wait,&quot; said Merlin, with an evil smile.  &quot;Ye wit that he that</div><div class='line' id='LC5882'>would break this spell must know that spirit&#39;s name?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5883'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5884'>&quot;Yes, I know his name.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5885'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5886'>&quot;And wit you also that to know it skills not of itself, but ye</div><div class='line' id='LC5887'>must likewise pronounce it?  Ha-ha!  Knew ye that?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5888'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5889'>&quot;Yes, I knew that, too.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5890'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5891'>&quot;You had that knowledge!  Art a fool?  Are ye minded to utter</div><div class='line' id='LC5892'>that name and die?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5893'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5894'>&quot;Utter it?  Why certainly.  I would utter it if it was Welsh.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5895'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5896'>&quot;Ye are even a dead man, then; and I go to tell Arthur.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5897'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5898'>&quot;That&#39;s all right.  Take your gripsack and get along.  The thing</div><div class='line' id='LC5899'>for _you_ to do is to go home and work the weather, John W. Merlin.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC5900'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5901'>It was a home shot, and it made him wince; for he was the worst</div><div class='line' id='LC5902'>weather-failure in the kingdom.  Whenever he ordered up the</div><div class='line' id='LC5903'>danger-signals along the coast there was a week&#39;s dead calm, sure,</div><div class='line' id='LC5904'>and every time he prophesied fair weather it rained brickbats.</div><div class='line' id='LC5905'>But I kept him in the weather bureau right along, to undermine</div><div class='line' id='LC5906'>his reputation.  However, that shot raised his bile, and instead</div><div class='line' id='LC5907'>of starting home to report my death, he said he would remain</div><div class='line' id='LC5908'>and enjoy it.</div><div class='line' id='LC5909'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5910'>My two experts arrived in the evening, and pretty well fagged,</div><div class='line' id='LC5911'>for they had traveled double tides.  They had pack-mules along,</div><div class='line' id='LC5912'>and had brought everything I needed--tools, pump, lead pipe,</div><div class='line' id='LC5913'>Greek fire, sheaves of big rockets, roman candles, colored fire</div><div class='line' id='LC5914'>sprays, electric apparatus, and a lot of sundries--everything</div><div class='line' id='LC5915'>necessary for the stateliest kind of a miracle.  They got their</div><div class='line' id='LC5916'>supper and a nap, and about midnight we sallied out through a</div><div class='line' id='LC5917'>solitude so wholly vacant and complete that it quite overpassed</div><div class='line' id='LC5918'>the required conditions.  We took possession of the well and its</div><div class='line' id='LC5919'>surroundings.  My boys were experts in all sorts of things, from</div><div class='line' id='LC5920'>the stoning up of a well to the constructing of a mathematical</div><div class='line' id='LC5921'>instrument.  An hour before sunrise we had that leak mended in</div><div class='line' id='LC5922'>ship-shape fashion, and the water began to rise.  Then we stowed our</div><div class='line' id='LC5923'>fireworks in the chapel, locked up the place, and went home to bed.</div><div class='line' id='LC5924'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5925'>Before the noon mass was over, we were at the well again; for there</div><div class='line' id='LC5926'>was a deal to do yet, and I was determined to spring the miracle</div><div class='line' id='LC5927'>before midnight, for business reasons: for whereas a miracle</div><div class='line' id='LC5928'>worked for the Church on a week-day is worth a good deal, it is</div><div class='line' id='LC5929'>worth six times as much if you get it in on a Sunday.  In nine hours</div><div class='line' id='LC5930'>the water had risen to its customary level--that is to say, it was</div><div class='line' id='LC5931'>within twenty-three feet of the top.  We put in a little iron pump,</div><div class='line' id='LC5932'>one of the first turned out by my works near the capital; we bored</div><div class='line' id='LC5933'>into a stone reservoir which stood against the outer wall of the</div><div class='line' id='LC5934'>well-chamber and inserted a section of lead pipe that was long</div><div class='line' id='LC5935'>enough to reach to the door of the chapel and project beyond</div><div class='line' id='LC5936'>the threshold, where the gushing water would be visible to the</div><div class='line' id='LC5937'>two hundred and fifty acres of people I was intending should be</div><div class='line' id='LC5938'>present on the flat plain in front of this little holy hillock at</div><div class='line' id='LC5939'>the proper time.</div><div class='line' id='LC5940'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5941'>We knocked the head out of an empty hogshead and hoisted this</div><div class='line' id='LC5942'>hogshead to the flat roof of the chapel, where we clamped it down</div><div class='line' id='LC5943'>fast, poured in gunpowder till it lay loosely an inch deep on the</div><div class='line' id='LC5944'>bottom, then we stood up rockets in the hogshead as thick as they</div><div class='line' id='LC5945'>could loosely stand, all the different breeds of rockets there are;</div><div class='line' id='LC5946'>and they made a portly and imposing sheaf, I can tell you.  We</div><div class='line' id='LC5947'>grounded the wire of a pocket electrical battery in that powder,</div><div class='line' id='LC5948'>we placed a whole magazine of Greek fire on each corner of the</div><div class='line' id='LC5949'>roof--blue on one corner, green on another, red on another, and</div><div class='line' id='LC5950'>purple on the last--and grounded a wire in each.</div><div class='line' id='LC5951'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5952'>About two hundred yards off, in the flat, we built a pen of</div><div class='line' id='LC5953'>scantlings, about four feet high, and laid planks on it, and so</div><div class='line' id='LC5954'>made a platform.  We covered it with swell tapestries borrowed</div><div class='line' id='LC5955'>for the occasion, and topped it off with the abbot&#39;s own throne.</div><div class='line' id='LC5956'>When you are going to do a miracle for an ignorant race, you want</div><div class='line' id='LC5957'>to get in every detail that will count; you want to make all the</div><div class='line' id='LC5958'>properties impressive to the public eye; you want to make matters</div><div class='line' id='LC5959'>comfortable for your head guest; then you can turn yourself loose</div><div class='line' id='LC5960'>and play your effects for all they are worth.  I know the value of</div><div class='line' id='LC5961'>these things, for I know human nature.  You can&#39;t throw too much</div><div class='line' id='LC5962'>style into a miracle.  It costs trouble, and work, and sometimes</div><div class='line' id='LC5963'>money; but it pays in the end.  Well, we brought the wires to</div><div class='line' id='LC5964'>the ground at the chapel, and then brought them under the ground</div><div class='line' id='LC5965'>to the platform, and hid the batteries there.  We put a rope fence</div><div class='line' id='LC5966'>a hundred feet square around the platform to keep off the common</div><div class='line' id='LC5967'>multitude, and that finished the work.  My idea was, doors open</div><div class='line' id='LC5968'>at 10:30, performance to begin at 11:25 sharp.  I wished I could</div><div class='line' id='LC5969'>charge admission, but of course that wouldn&#39;t answer.  I instructed</div><div class='line' id='LC5970'>my boys to be in the chapel as early as 10, before anybody was</div><div class='line' id='LC5971'>around, and be ready to man the pumps at the proper time, and</div><div class='line' id='LC5972'>make the fur fly.  Then we went home to supper.</div><div class='line' id='LC5973'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5974'>The news of the disaster to the well had traveled far by this time;</div><div class='line' id='LC5975'>and now for two or three days a steady avalanche of people had</div><div class='line' id='LC5976'>been pouring into the valley.  The lower end of the valley was</div><div class='line' id='LC5977'>become one huge camp; we should have a good house, no question</div><div class='line' id='LC5978'>about that.  Criers went the rounds early in the evening and</div><div class='line' id='LC5979'>announced the coming attempt, which put every pulse up to fever</div><div class='line' id='LC5980'>heat.  They gave notice that the abbot and his official suite would</div><div class='line' id='LC5981'>move in state and occupy the platform at 10:30, up to which time</div><div class='line' id='LC5982'>all the region which was under my ban must be clear; the bells</div><div class='line' id='LC5983'>would then cease from tolling, and this sign should be permission</div><div class='line' id='LC5984'>to the multitudes to close in and take their places.</div><div class='line' id='LC5985'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5986'>I was at the platform and all ready to do the honors when the</div><div class='line' id='LC5987'>abbot&#39;s solemn procession hove in sight--which it did not do till</div><div class='line' id='LC5988'>it was nearly to the rope fence, because it was a starless black</div><div class='line' id='LC5989'>night and no torches permitted.  With it came Merlin, and took</div><div class='line' id='LC5990'>a front seat on the platform; he was as good as his word for once.</div><div class='line' id='LC5991'>One could not see the multitudes banked together beyond the ban,</div><div class='line' id='LC5992'>but they were there, just the same.  The moment the bells stopped,</div><div class='line' id='LC5993'>those banked masses broke and poured over the line like a vast</div><div class='line' id='LC5994'>black wave, and for as much as a half hour it continued to flow,</div><div class='line' id='LC5995'>and then it solidified itself, and you could have walked upon</div><div class='line' id='LC5996'>a pavement of human heads to--well, miles.</div><div class='line' id='LC5997'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5998'>We had a solemn stage-wait, now, for about twenty minutes--a thing</div><div class='line' id='LC5999'>I had counted on for effect; it is always good to let your audience</div><div class='line' id='LC6000'>have a chance to work up its expectancy.  At length, out of the</div><div class='line' id='LC6001'>silence a noble Latin chant--men&#39;s voices--broke and swelled up</div><div class='line' id='LC6002'>and rolled away into the night, a majestic tide of melody.  I had</div><div class='line' id='LC6003'>put that up, too, and it was one of the best effects I ever invented.</div><div class='line' id='LC6004'>When it was finished I stood up on the platform and extended my</div><div class='line' id='LC6005'>hands abroad, for two minutes, with my face uplifted--that always</div><div class='line' id='LC6006'>produces a dead hush--and then slowly pronounced this ghastly word</div><div class='line' id='LC6007'>with a kind of awfulness which caused hundreds to tremble, and</div><div class='line' id='LC6008'>many women to faint:</div><div class='line' id='LC6009'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6010'>&quot;Constantinopolitanischerdudelsackspfeifenmachersgesellschafft!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6011'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6012'>Just as I was moaning out the closing hunks of that word, I touched</div><div class='line' id='LC6013'>off one of my electric connections and all that murky world of</div><div class='line' id='LC6014'>people stood revealed in a hideous blue glare!  It was immense</div><div class='line' id='LC6015'>--that effect!  Lots of people shrieked, women curled up and quit</div><div class='line' id='LC6016'>in every direction, foundlings collapsed by platoons.  The abbot</div><div class='line' id='LC6017'>and the monks crossed themselves nimbly and their lips fluttered</div><div class='line' id='LC6018'>with agitated prayers.  Merlin held his grip, but he was astonished</div><div class='line' id='LC6019'>clear down to his corns; he had never seen anything to begin</div><div class='line' id='LC6020'>with that, before.  Now was the time to pile in the effects.  I lifted</div><div class='line' id='LC6021'>my hands and groaned out this word--as it were in agony:</div><div class='line' id='LC6022'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6023'>&quot;Nihilistendynamittheaterkaestchenssprengungsattentaetsversuchungen!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6024'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6025'>--and turned on the red fire!  You should have heard that Atlantic</div><div class='line' id='LC6026'>of people moan and howl when that crimson hell joined the blue!</div><div class='line' id='LC6027'>After sixty seconds I shouted:</div><div class='line' id='LC6028'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6029'>&quot;Transvaaltruppentropentransporttrampelthiertreibertrauungsthraenen-</div><div class='line' id='LC6030'>tragoedie!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6031'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6032'>--and lit up the green fire!  After waiting only forty seconds this</div><div class='line' id='LC6033'>time, I spread my arms abroad and thundered out the devastating</div><div class='line' id='LC6034'>syllables of this word of words:</div><div class='line' id='LC6035'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6036'>&quot;Mekkamuselmannenmassenmenchenmoerdermohrenmuttermarmormonumentenmacher!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6037'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6038'>--and whirled on the purple glare!  There they were, all going</div><div class='line' id='LC6039'>at once, red, blue, green, purple!--four furious volcanoes pouring</div><div class='line' id='LC6040'>vast clouds of radiant smoke aloft, and spreading a blinding</div><div class='line' id='LC6041'>rainbowed noonday to the furthest confines of that valley.  In</div><div class='line' id='LC6042'>the distance one could see that fellow on the pillar standing rigid</div><div class='line' id='LC6043'>against the background of sky, his seesaw stopped for the first</div><div class='line' id='LC6044'>time in twenty years.  I knew the boys were at the pump now and</div><div class='line' id='LC6045'>ready.  So I said to the abbot:</div><div class='line' id='LC6046'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6047'>&quot;The time is come, Father.  I am about to pronounce the dread name</div><div class='line' id='LC6048'>and command the spell to dissolve.  You want to brace up, and take</div><div class='line' id='LC6049'>hold of something.&quot;  Then I shouted to the people: &quot;Behold, in</div><div class='line' id='LC6050'>another minute the spell will be broken, or no mortal can break it.</div><div class='line' id='LC6051'>If it break, all will know it, for you will see the sacred water</div><div class='line' id='LC6052'>gush from the chapel door!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6053'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6054'>I stood a few moments, to let the hearers have a chance to spread</div><div class='line' id='LC6055'>my announcement to those who couldn&#39;t hear, and so convey it</div><div class='line' id='LC6056'>to the furthest ranks, then I made a grand exhibition of extra</div><div class='line' id='LC6057'>posturing and gesturing, and shouted:</div><div class='line' id='LC6058'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6059'>&quot;Lo, I command the fell spirit that possesses the holy fountain</div><div class='line' id='LC6060'>to now disgorge into the skies all the infernal fires that still</div><div class='line' id='LC6061'>remain in him, and straightway dissolve his spell and flee hence</div><div class='line' id='LC6062'>to the pit, there to lie bound a thousand years.  By his own dread</div><div class='line' id='LC6063'>name I command it--BGWJJILLIGKKK!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6064'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6065'>Then I touched off the hogshead of rockets, and a vast fountain of</div><div class='line' id='LC6066'>dazzling lances of fire vomited itself toward the zenith with a</div><div class='line' id='LC6067'>hissing rush, and burst in mid-sky into a storm of flashing jewels!</div><div class='line' id='LC6068'>One mighty groan of terror started up from the massed people</div><div class='line' id='LC6069'>--then suddenly broke into a wild hosannah of joy--for there, fair</div><div class='line' id='LC6070'>and plain in the uncanny glare, they saw the freed water leaping</div><div class='line' id='LC6071'>forth!  The old abbot could not speak a word, for tears and the</div><div class='line' id='LC6072'>chokings in his throat; without utterance of any sort, he folded me</div><div class='line' id='LC6073'>in his arms and mashed me.  It was more eloquent than speech.</div><div class='line' id='LC6074'>And harder to get over, too, in a country where there were really</div><div class='line' id='LC6075'>no doctors that were worth a damaged nickel.</div><div class='line' id='LC6076'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6077'>You should have seen those acres of people throw themselves down</div><div class='line' id='LC6078'>in that water and kiss it; kiss it, and pet it, and fondle it, and</div><div class='line' id='LC6079'>talk to it as if it were alive, and welcome it back with the dear</div><div class='line' id='LC6080'>names they gave their darlings, just as if it had been a friend who</div><div class='line' id='LC6081'>was long gone away and lost, and was come home again.  Yes, it was</div><div class='line' id='LC6082'>pretty to see, and made me think more of them than I had done before.</div><div class='line' id='LC6083'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6084'>I sent Merlin home on a shutter.  He had caved in and gone down</div><div class='line' id='LC6085'>like a landslide when I pronounced that fearful name, and had</div><div class='line' id='LC6086'>never come to since.  He never had heard that name before,--neither</div><div class='line' id='LC6087'>had I--but to him it was the right one.  Any jumble would have</div><div class='line' id='LC6088'>been the right one.  He admitted, afterward, that that spirit&#39;s own</div><div class='line' id='LC6089'>mother could not have pronounced that name better than I did.</div><div class='line' id='LC6090'>He never could understand how I survived it, and I didn&#39;t tell</div><div class='line' id='LC6091'>him.  It is only young magicians that give away a secret like that.</div><div class='line' id='LC6092'>Merlin spent three months working enchantments to try to find out</div><div class='line' id='LC6093'>the deep trick of how to pronounce that name and outlive it.</div><div class='line' id='LC6094'>But he didn&#39;t arrive.</div><div class='line' id='LC6095'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6096'>When I started to the chapel, the populace uncovered and fell back</div><div class='line' id='LC6097'>reverently to make a wide way for me, as if I had been some kind</div><div class='line' id='LC6098'>of a superior being--and I was.  I was aware of that.  I took along</div><div class='line' id='LC6099'>a night shift of monks, and taught them the mystery of the pump,</div><div class='line' id='LC6100'>and set them to work, for it was plain that a good part of the</div><div class='line' id='LC6101'>people out there were going to sit up with the water all night,</div><div class='line' id='LC6102'>consequently it was but right that they should have all they wanted</div><div class='line' id='LC6103'>of it.  To those monks that pump was a good deal of a miracle</div><div class='line' id='LC6104'>itself, and they were full of wonder over it; and of admiration,</div><div class='line' id='LC6105'>too, of the exceeding effectiveness of its performance.</div><div class='line' id='LC6106'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6107'>It was a great night, an immense night.  There was reputation in it.</div><div class='line' id='LC6108'>I could hardly get to sleep for glorying over it.</div><div class='line' id='LC6109'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6110'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6111'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6112'>CHAPTER XXIV</div><div class='line' id='LC6113'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6114'>A RIVAL MAGICIAN</div><div class='line' id='LC6115'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6116'>My influence in the Valley of Holiness was something prodigious</div><div class='line' id='LC6117'>now.  It seemed worth while to try to turn it to some valuable</div><div class='line' id='LC6118'>account.  The thought came to me the next morning, and was suggested</div><div class='line' id='LC6119'>by my seeing one of my knights who was in the soap line come</div><div class='line' id='LC6120'>riding in.  According to history, the monks of this place two</div><div class='line' id='LC6121'>centuries before had been worldly minded enough to want to wash.</div><div class='line' id='LC6122'>It might be that there was a leaven of this unrighteousness still</div><div class='line' id='LC6123'>remaining.  So I sounded a Brother:</div><div class='line' id='LC6124'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6125'>&quot;Wouldn&#39;t you like a bath?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6126'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6127'>He shuddered at the thought--the thought of the peril of it to</div><div class='line' id='LC6128'>the well--but he said with feeling:</div><div class='line' id='LC6129'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6130'>&quot;One needs not to ask that of a poor body who has not known that</div><div class='line' id='LC6131'>blessed refreshment sith that he was a boy.  Would God I might</div><div class='line' id='LC6132'>wash me! but it may not be, fair sir, tempt me not; it is forbidden.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6133'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6134'>And then he sighed in such a sorrowful way that I was resolved</div><div class='line' id='LC6135'>he should have at least one layer of his real estate removed,</div><div class='line' id='LC6136'>if it sized up my whole influence and bankrupted the pile.  So I</div><div class='line' id='LC6137'>went to the abbot and asked for a permit for this Brother.  He</div><div class='line' id='LC6138'>blenched at the idea--I don&#39;t mean that you could see him blench,</div><div class='line' id='LC6139'>for of course you couldn&#39;t see it without you scraped him, and</div><div class='line' id='LC6140'>I didn&#39;t care enough about it to scrape him, but I knew the blench</div><div class='line' id='LC6141'>was there, just the same, and within a book-cover&#39;s thickness of</div><div class='line' id='LC6142'>the surface, too--blenched, and trembled.  He said:</div><div class='line' id='LC6143'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6144'>&quot;Ah, son, ask aught else thou wilt, and it is thine, and freely</div><div class='line' id='LC6145'>granted out of a grateful heart--but this, oh, this!  Would you</div><div class='line' id='LC6146'>drive away the blessed water again?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6147'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6148'>&quot;No, Father, I will not drive it away.  I have mysterious knowledge</div><div class='line' id='LC6149'>which teaches me that there was an error that other time when</div><div class='line' id='LC6150'>it was thought the institution of the bath banished the fountain.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6151'>A large interest began to show up in the old man&#39;s face.  &quot;My</div><div class='line' id='LC6152'>knowledge informs me that the bath was innocent of that misfortune,</div><div class='line' id='LC6153'>which was caused by quite another sort of sin.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6154'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6155'>&quot;These are brave words--but--but right welcome, if they be true.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6156'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6157'>&quot;They are true, indeed.  Let me build the bath again, Father.</div><div class='line' id='LC6158'>Let me build it again, and the fountain shall flow forever.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6159'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6160'>&quot;You promise this?--you promise it?  Say the word--say you promise it!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6161'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6162'>&quot;I do promise it.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6163'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6164'>&quot;Then will I have the first bath myself!  Go--get ye to your work.</div><div class='line' id='LC6165'>Tarry not, tarry not, but go.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6166'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6167'>I and my boys were at work, straight off.  The ruins of the old</div><div class='line' id='LC6168'>bath were there yet in the basement of the monastery, not a stone</div><div class='line' id='LC6169'>missing.  They had been left just so, all these lifetimes, and</div><div class='line' id='LC6170'>avoided with a pious fear, as things accursed.  In two days we</div><div class='line' id='LC6171'>had it all done and the water in--a spacious pool of clear pure</div><div class='line' id='LC6172'>water that a body could swim in.  It was running water, too.</div><div class='line' id='LC6173'>It came in, and went out, through the ancient pipes.  The old abbot</div><div class='line' id='LC6174'>kept his word, and was the first to try it.  He went down black</div><div class='line' id='LC6175'>and shaky, leaving the whole black community above troubled and</div><div class='line' id='LC6176'>worried and full of bodings; but he came back white and joyful,</div><div class='line' id='LC6177'>and the game was made! another triumph scored.</div><div class='line' id='LC6178'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6179'>It was a good campaign that we made in that Valley of Holiness,</div><div class='line' id='LC6180'>and I was very well satisfied, and ready to move on now, but</div><div class='line' id='LC6181'>I struck a disappointment.  I caught a heavy cold, and it started</div><div class='line' id='LC6182'>up an old lurking rheumatism of mine.  Of course the rheumatism</div><div class='line' id='LC6183'>hunted up my weakest place and located itself there.  This was</div><div class='line' id='LC6184'>the place where the abbot put his arms about me and mashed me, what</div><div class='line' id='LC6185'>time he was moved to testify his gratitude to me with an embrace.</div><div class='line' id='LC6186'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6187'>When at last I got out, I was a shadow.  But everybody was full</div><div class='line' id='LC6188'>of attentions and kindnesses, and these brought cheer back into</div><div class='line' id='LC6189'>my life, and were the right medicine to help a convalescent swiftly</div><div class='line' id='LC6190'>up toward health and strength again; so I gained fast.</div><div class='line' id='LC6191'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6192'>Sandy was worn out with nursing; so I made up my mind to turn out</div><div class='line' id='LC6193'>and go a cruise alone, leaving her at the nunnery to rest up.</div><div class='line' id='LC6194'>My idea was to disguise myself as a freeman of peasant degree</div><div class='line' id='LC6195'>and wander through the country a week or two on foot.  This would</div><div class='line' id='LC6196'>give me a chance to eat and lodge with the lowliest and poorest</div><div class='line' id='LC6197'>class of free citizens on equal terms.  There was no other way</div><div class='line' id='LC6198'>to inform myself perfectly of their everyday life and the operation</div><div class='line' id='LC6199'>of the laws upon it.  If I went among them as a gentleman, there</div><div class='line' id='LC6200'>would be restraints and conventionalities which would shut me out</div><div class='line' id='LC6201'>from their private joys and troubles, and I should get no further</div><div class='line' id='LC6202'>than the outside shell.</div><div class='line' id='LC6203'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6204'>One morning I was out on a long walk to get up muscle for my trip,</div><div class='line' id='LC6205'>and had climbed the ridge which bordered the northern extremity</div><div class='line' id='LC6206'>of the valley, when I came upon an artificial opening in the face</div><div class='line' id='LC6207'>of a low precipice, and recognized it by its location as a hermitage</div><div class='line' id='LC6208'>which had often been pointed out to me from a distance as the den</div><div class='line' id='LC6209'>of a hermit of high renown for dirt and austerity.  I knew he had</div><div class='line' id='LC6210'>lately been offered a situation in the Great Sahara, where lions</div><div class='line' id='LC6211'>and sandflies made the hermit-life peculiarly attractive and</div><div class='line' id='LC6212'>difficult, and had gone to Africa to take possession, so I thought</div><div class='line' id='LC6213'>I would look in and see how the atmosphere of this den agreed</div><div class='line' id='LC6214'>with its reputation.</div><div class='line' id='LC6215'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6216'>My surprise was great: the place was newly swept and scoured.</div><div class='line' id='LC6217'>Then there was another surprise.  Back in the gloom of the cavern</div><div class='line' id='LC6218'>I heard the clink of a little bell, and then this exclamation:</div><div class='line' id='LC6219'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6220'>&quot;Hello Central!  Is this you, Camelot?--Behold, thou mayst glad</div><div class='line' id='LC6221'>thy heart an thou hast faith to believe the wonderful when that</div><div class='line' id='LC6222'>it cometh in unexpected guise and maketh itself manifest in</div><div class='line' id='LC6223'>impossible places--here standeth in the flesh his mightiness</div><div class='line' id='LC6224'>The Boss, and with thine own ears shall ye hear him speak!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6225'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6226'>Now what a radical reversal of things this was; what a jumbling</div><div class='line' id='LC6227'>together of extravagant incongruities; what a fantastic conjunction</div><div class='line' id='LC6228'>of opposites and irreconcilables--the home of the bogus miracle</div><div class='line' id='LC6229'>become the home of a real one, the den of a mediaeval hermit turned</div><div class='line' id='LC6230'>into a telephone office!</div><div class='line' id='LC6231'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6232'>The telephone clerk stepped into the light, and I recognized one</div><div class='line' id='LC6233'>of my young fellows.  I said:</div><div class='line' id='LC6234'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6235'>&quot;How long has this office been established here, Ulfius?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6236'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6237'>&quot;But since midnight, fair Sir Boss, an it please you.  We saw many</div><div class='line' id='LC6238'>lights in the valley, and so judged it well to make a station,</div><div class='line' id='LC6239'>for that where so many lights be needs must they indicate a town</div><div class='line' id='LC6240'>of goodly size.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6241'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6242'>&quot;Quite right.  It isn&#39;t a town in the customary sense, but it&#39;s</div><div class='line' id='LC6243'>a good stand, anyway.  Do you know where you are?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6244'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6245'>&quot;Of that I have had no time to make inquiry; for whenas my</div><div class='line' id='LC6246'>comradeship moved hence upon their labors, leaving me in charge,</div><div class='line' id='LC6247'>I got me to needed rest, purposing to inquire when I waked, and</div><div class='line' id='LC6248'>report the place&#39;s name to Camelot for record.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6249'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6250'>&quot;Well, this is the Valley of Holiness.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6251'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6252'>It didn&#39;t take; I mean, he didn&#39;t start at the name, as I had</div><div class='line' id='LC6253'>supposed he would.  He merely said:</div><div class='line' id='LC6254'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6255'>&quot;I will so report it.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6256'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6257'>&quot;Why, the surrounding regions are filled with the noise of late</div><div class='line' id='LC6258'>wonders that have happened here!  You didn&#39;t hear of them?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6259'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6260'>&quot;Ah, ye will remember we move by night, and avoid speech with all.</div><div class='line' id='LC6261'>We learn naught but that we get by the telephone from Camelot.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6262'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6263'>&quot;Why _they_ know all about this thing.  Haven&#39;t they told you anything</div><div class='line' id='LC6264'>about the great miracle of the restoration of a holy fountain?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6265'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6266'>&quot;Oh, _that_?  Indeed yes.  But the name of _this_ valley doth woundily</div><div class='line' id='LC6267'>differ from the name of _that_ one; indeed to differ wider were not pos--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6268'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6269'>&quot;What was that name, then?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6270'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6271'>&quot;The Valley of Hellishness.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6272'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6273'>&quot;_That_ explains it.  Confound a telephone, anyway.  It is the very</div><div class='line' id='LC6274'>demon for conveying similarities of sound that are miracles of</div><div class='line' id='LC6275'>divergence from similarity of sense.  But no matter, you know</div><div class='line' id='LC6276'>the name of the place now.  Call up Camelot.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6277'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6278'>He did it, and had Clarence sent for.  It was good to hear my boy&#39;s</div><div class='line' id='LC6279'>voice again.  It was like being home.  After some affectionate</div><div class='line' id='LC6280'>interchanges, and some account of my late illness, I said:</div><div class='line' id='LC6281'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6282'>&quot;What is new?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6283'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6284'>&quot;The king and queen and many of the court do start even in this</div><div class='line' id='LC6285'>hour, to go to your valley to pay pious homage to the waters ye</div><div class='line' id='LC6286'>have restored, and cleanse themselves of sin, and see the place</div><div class='line' id='LC6287'>where the infernal spirit spouted true hell-flames to the clouds</div><div class='line' id='LC6288'>--an ye listen sharply ye may hear me wink and hear me likewise</div><div class='line' id='LC6289'>smile a smile, sith &#39;twas I that made selection of those flames</div><div class='line' id='LC6290'>from out our stock and sent them by your order.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6291'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6292'>&quot;Does the king know the way to this place?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC6293'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC6294'>&quot;The king?--no, nor to any other in his realms, mayhap;
