But I was the only person</div><div class='line' id='LC7210'>in all that throng who knew the meaning of this mighty birth, and</div><div class='line' id='LC7211'>what this imperial magician was come into the world to do.</div><div class='line' id='LC7212'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7213'>I dropped a nickel out of the window and got my paper; the</div><div class='line' id='LC7214'>Adam-newsboy of the world went around the corner to get my change;</div><div class='line' id='LC7215'>is around the corner yet.  It was delicious to see a newspaper</div><div class='line' id='LC7216'>again, yet I was conscious of a secret shock when my eye fell upon</div><div class='line' id='LC7217'>the first batch of display head-lines.  I had lived in a clammy</div><div class='line' id='LC7218'>atmosphere of reverence, respect, deference, so long that they</div><div class='line' id='LC7219'>sent a quivery little cold wave through me:</div><div class='line' id='LC7220'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7221'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7222'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;HIGH TIMES IN THE VALLEY</div><div class='line' id='LC7223'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7224'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;OF HOLINESS!</div><div class='line' id='LC7225'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7226'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;----</div><div class='line' id='LC7227'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7228'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THE WATER-WORKS CORKED!</div><div class='line' id='LC7229'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7230'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;----</div><div class='line' id='LC7231'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7232'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;BRER MERLIN WORKS HIS ARTS, BUT GETS</div><div class='line' id='LC7233'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;LEFT?</div><div class='line' id='LC7234'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7235'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;----</div><div class='line' id='LC7236'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7237'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;But the Boss scores on his first Innings!</div><div class='line' id='LC7238'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7239'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;----</div><div class='line' id='LC7240'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7241'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Miraculous Well Uncorked amid</div><div class='line' id='LC7242'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;awful outbursts of</div><div class='line' id='LC7243'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7244'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;INFERNAL FIRE AND SMOKE</div><div class='line' id='LC7245'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ATHUNDER!</div><div class='line' id='LC7246'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7247'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;----</div><div class='line' id='LC7248'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7249'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THE BUZZARD-ROOST ASTONISHED!</div><div class='line' id='LC7250'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7251'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;----</div><div class='line' id='LC7252'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7253'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;UNPARALLELED REJOIBINGS!</div><div class='line' id='LC7254'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7255'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7256'>--and so on, and so on.  Yes, it was too loud.  Once I could have</div><div class='line' id='LC7257'>enjoyed it and seen nothing out of the way about it, but now its</div><div class='line' id='LC7258'>note was discordant.  It was good Arkansas journalism, but this</div><div class='line' id='LC7259'>was not Arkansas.  Moreover, the next to the last line was calculated</div><div class='line' id='LC7260'>to give offense to the hermits, and perhaps lose us their advertising.</div><div class='line' id='LC7261'>Indeed, there was too lightsome a tone of flippancy all through</div><div class='line' id='LC7262'>the paper.  It was plain I had undergone a considerable change</div><div class='line' id='LC7263'>without noticing it.  I found myself unpleasantly affected by</div><div class='line' id='LC7264'>pert little irreverencies which would have seemed but proper and</div><div class='line' id='LC7265'>airy graces of speech at an earlier period of my life.  There was an</div><div class='line' id='LC7266'>abundance of the following breed of items, and they discomforted me:</div><div class='line' id='LC7267'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7268'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;LOCAL SMOKE AND CINDERS.</div><div class='line' id='LC7269'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7270'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sir Launcelot met up with old King</div><div class='line' id='LC7271'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Agrivance of Ireland unexpectedly last</div><div class='line' id='LC7272'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;weok over on the moor south of Sir</div><div class='line' id='LC7273'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Balmoral le Merveilleuse&#39;s hog dasture.</div><div class='line' id='LC7274'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The widow has been notified.</div><div class='line' id='LC7275'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7276'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Expedition No. 3 will start adout the</div><div class='line' id='LC7277'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;first of mext month on a search f8r Sir</div><div class='line' id='LC7278'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sagramour le Desirous. It is in com-</div><div class='line' id='LC7279'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and of the renowned Knight of the Red</div><div class='line' id='LC7280'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Lawns, assissted by Sir Persant of Inde,</div><div class='line' id='LC7281'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;who is compete9t. intelligent, courte-</div><div class='line' id='LC7282'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ous, and in every way a brick, and fur-</div><div class='line' id='LC7283'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;tHer assisted by Sir Palamides the Sara-</div><div class='line' id='LC7284'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;cen, who is no huckleberry hinself.</div><div class='line' id='LC7285'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This is no pic-nic, these boys mean</div><div class='line' id='LC7286'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;busine&amp;s.</div><div class='line' id='LC7287'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7288'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The readers of the Hosannah will re-</div><div class='line' id='LC7289'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;gret to learn that the hadndsome and</div><div class='line' id='LC7290'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;popular Sir Charolais of Gaul, who dur-</div><div class='line' id='LC7291'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ing his four weeks&#39; stay at the Bull and</div><div class='line' id='LC7292'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Halibut, this city, has won every heart</div><div class='line' id='LC7293'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;by his polished manners and elegant</div><div class='line' id='LC7294'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;cPnversation, will pUll out to-day for</div><div class='line' id='LC7295'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;home. Give us another call, Charley!</div><div class='line' id='LC7296'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7297'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The bdsiness end of the funeral of</div><div class='line' id='LC7298'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the late Sir Dalliance the duke&#39;s son of</div><div class='line' id='LC7299'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cornwall, killed in an encounter with</div><div class='line' id='LC7300'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the Giant of the Knotted Bludgeon last</div><div class='line' id='LC7301'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Tuesday on the borders of the Plain of</div><div class='line' id='LC7302'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Enchantment was in the hands of the</div><div class='line' id='LC7303'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ever affable and efficient Mumble,</div><div class='line' id='LC7304'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;prince of un3ertakers, then whom there</div><div class='line' id='LC7305'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;exists none by whom it were a more</div><div class='line' id='LC7306'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;satisfying pleasure to have the last sad</div><div class='line' id='LC7307'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;offices performed. Give him a trial.</div><div class='line' id='LC7308'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7309'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The cordial thanks of the Hosannah</div><div class='line' id='LC7310'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;office are due, from editor down to</div><div class='line' id='LC7311'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;devil, to the ever courteous and thought-</div><div class='line' id='LC7312'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ful Lord High Stew d of the Palace&#39;s</div><div class='line' id='LC7313'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Third Assistant V  t for several sau-</div><div class='line' id='LC7314'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ceTs of ice crEam a quality calculated</div><div class='line' id='LC7315'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to make the ey of the recipients hu-</div><div class='line' id='LC7316'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;mid with grt  ude; and it done it.</div><div class='line' id='LC7317'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;When this  administration wants to</div><div class='line' id='LC7318'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;chalk up a desirable name for early</div><div class='line' id='LC7319'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;promotion, the Hosannah would like a</div><div class='line' id='LC7320'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;chance to sudgest.</div><div class='line' id='LC7321'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7322'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Demoiselle Irene Dewlap, of</div><div class='line' id='LC7323'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;South Astolat, is visiting her uncle, the</div><div class='line' id='LC7324'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;popular host of the Cattlemen&#39;s Board-</div><div class='line' id='LC7325'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ing Ho&amp;se, Liver Lane, this city.</div><div class='line' id='LC7326'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7327'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Young Barker the bellows-mender is</div><div class='line' id='LC7328'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;hoMe again, and looks much improved</div><div class='line' id='LC7329'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;by his vacation round-up among the out-</div><div class='line' id='LC7330'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;lying smithies. See his ad.</div><div class='line' id='LC7331'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7332'>Of course it was good enough journalism for a beginning; I knew</div><div class='line' id='LC7333'>that quite well, and yet it was somehow disappointing.  The</div><div class='line' id='LC7334'>&quot;Court Circular&quot; pleased me better; indeed, its simple and dignified</div><div class='line' id='LC7335'>respectfulness was a distinct refreshment to me after all those</div><div class='line' id='LC7336'>disgraceful familiarities.  But even it could have been improved.</div><div class='line' id='LC7337'>Do what one may, there is no getting an air of variety into a court</div><div class='line' id='LC7338'>circular, I acknowledge that.  There is a profound monotonousness</div><div class='line' id='LC7339'>about its facts that baffles and defeats one&#39;s sincerest efforts</div><div class='line' id='LC7340'>to make them sparkle and enthuse.  The best way to manage--in fact,</div><div class='line' id='LC7341'>the only sensible way--is to disguise repetitiousness of fact under</div><div class='line' id='LC7342'>variety of form: skin your fact each time and lay on a new cuticle</div><div class='line' id='LC7343'>of words.  It deceives the eye; you think it is a new fact; it</div><div class='line' id='LC7344'>gives you the idea that the court is carrying on like everything;</div><div class='line' id='LC7345'>this excites you, and you drain the whole column, with a good</div><div class='line' id='LC7346'>appetite, and perhaps never notice that it&#39;s a barrel of soup made</div><div class='line' id='LC7347'>out of a single bean.  Clarence&#39;s way was good, it was simple,</div><div class='line' id='LC7348'>it was dignified, it was direct and business-like; all I say is,</div><div class='line' id='LC7349'>it was not the best way:</div><div class='line' id='LC7350'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7351'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;COURT CIRCULAR.</div><div class='line' id='LC7352'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7353'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On Monday, the king rode in the park.</div><div class='line' id='LC7354'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&quot;  Tuesday,      &quot;      &quot;        &quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7355'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&quot;  Wendesday     &quot;      &quot;        &quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7356'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&quot;  Thursday      &quot;      &quot;        &quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7357'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&quot;  Friday,       &quot;      &quot;        &quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7358'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&quot;  Saturday      &quot;      &quot;        &quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7359'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&quot;  Sunday,       &quot;      &quot;        &quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7360'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7361'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7362'>However, take the paper by and large, I was vastly pleased with it.</div><div class='line' id='LC7363'>Little crudities of a mechanical sort were observable here and</div><div class='line' id='LC7364'>there, but there were not enough of them to amount to anything,</div><div class='line' id='LC7365'>and it was good enough Arkansas proof-reading, anyhow, and better</div><div class='line' id='LC7366'>than was needed in Arthur&#39;s day and realm.  As a rule, the grammar</div><div class='line' id='LC7367'>was leaky and the construction more or less lame; but I did not</div><div class='line' id='LC7368'>much mind these things.  They are common defects of my own, and</div><div class='line' id='LC7369'>one mustn&#39;t criticise other people on grounds where he can&#39;t stand</div><div class='line' id='LC7370'>perpendicular himself.</div><div class='line' id='LC7371'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7372'>I was hungry enough for literature to want to take down the whole</div><div class='line' id='LC7373'>paper at this one meal, but I got only a few bites, and then had</div><div class='line' id='LC7374'>to postpone, because the monks around me besieged me so with eager</div><div class='line' id='LC7375'>questions: What is this curious thing?  What is it for?  Is it a</div><div class='line' id='LC7376'>handkerchief?--saddle blanket?--part of a shirt?  What is it made of?</div><div class='line' id='LC7377'>How thin it is, and how dainty and frail; and how it rattles.</div><div class='line' id='LC7378'>Will it wear, do you think, and won&#39;t the rain injure it?  Is it</div><div class='line' id='LC7379'>writing that appears on it, or is it only ornamentation?  They</div><div class='line' id='LC7380'>suspected it was writing, because those among them who knew how</div><div class='line' id='LC7381'>to read Latin and had a smattering of Greek, recognized some of</div><div class='line' id='LC7382'>the letters, but they could make nothing out of the result as a</div><div class='line' id='LC7383'>whole.  I put my information in the simplest form I could:</div><div class='line' id='LC7384'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7385'>&quot;It is a public journal; I will explain what that is, another time.</div><div class='line' id='LC7386'>It is not cloth, it is made of paper; some time I will explain</div><div class='line' id='LC7387'>what paper is.  The lines on it are reading matter; and not written</div><div class='line' id='LC7388'>by hand, but printed; by and by I will explain what printing is.</div><div class='line' id='LC7389'>A thousand of these sheets have been made, all exactly like this,</div><div class='line' id='LC7390'>in every minute detail--they can&#39;t be told apart.&quot;  Then they all</div><div class='line' id='LC7391'>broke out with exclamations of surprise and admiration:</div><div class='line' id='LC7392'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7393'>&quot;A thousand!  Verily a mighty work--a year&#39;s work for many men.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7394'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7395'>&quot;No--merely a day&#39;s work for a man and a boy.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7396'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7397'>They crossed themselves, and whiffed out a protective prayer or two.</div><div class='line' id='LC7398'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7399'>&quot;Ah-h--a miracle, a wonder!  Dark work of enchantment.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7400'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7401'>I let it go at that.  Then I read in a low voice, to as many as</div><div class='line' id='LC7402'>could crowd their shaven heads within hearing distance, part of</div><div class='line' id='LC7403'>the account of the miracle of the restoration of the well, and</div><div class='line' id='LC7404'>was accompanied by astonished and reverent ejaculations all through:</div><div class='line' id='LC7405'>&quot;Ah-h-h!&quot;  &quot;How true!&quot;  &quot;Amazing, amazing!&quot;  &quot;These be the very</div><div class='line' id='LC7406'>haps as they happened, in marvelous exactness!&quot;  And might they</div><div class='line' id='LC7407'>take this strange thing in their hands, and feel of it and examine</div><div class='line' id='LC7408'>it?--they would be very careful.  Yes.  So they took it, handling</div><div class='line' id='LC7409'>it as cautiously and devoutly as if it had been some holy thing</div><div class='line' id='LC7410'>come from some supernatural region; and gently felt of its texture,</div><div class='line' id='LC7411'>caressed its pleasant smooth surface with lingering touch, and</div><div class='line' id='LC7412'>scanned the mysterious characters with fascinated eyes.  These</div><div class='line' id='LC7413'>grouped bent heads, these charmed faces, these speaking eyes</div><div class='line' id='LC7414'>--how beautiful to me!  For was not this my darling, and was not</div><div class='line' id='LC7415'>all this mute wonder and interest and homage a most eloquent</div><div class='line' id='LC7416'>tribute and unforced compliment to it?  I knew, then, how a mother</div><div class='line' id='LC7417'>feels when women, whether strangers or friends, take her new baby,</div><div class='line' id='LC7418'>and close themselves about it with one eager impulse, and bend</div><div class='line' id='LC7419'>their heads over it in a tranced adoration that makes all the rest</div><div class='line' id='LC7420'>of the universe vanish out of their consciousness and be as if it</div><div class='line' id='LC7421'>were not, for that time.  I knew how she feels, and that there is</div><div class='line' id='LC7422'>no other satisfied ambition, whether of king, conqueror, or poet,</div><div class='line' id='LC7423'>that ever reaches half-way to that serene far summit or yields half</div><div class='line' id='LC7424'>so divine a contentment.</div><div class='line' id='LC7425'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7426'>During all the rest of the seance my paper traveled from group to</div><div class='line' id='LC7427'>group all up and down and about that huge hall, and my happy eye</div><div class='line' id='LC7428'>was upon it always, and I sat motionless, steeped in satisfaction,</div><div class='line' id='LC7429'>drunk with enjoyment.  Yes, this was heaven; I was tasting it once,</div><div class='line' id='LC7430'>if I might never taste it more.</div><div class='line' id='LC7431'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7432'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7433'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7434'>CHAPTER XXVII</div><div class='line' id='LC7435'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7436'>THE YANKEE AND THE KING TRAVEL INCOGNITO</div><div class='line' id='LC7437'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7438'>About bedtime I took the king to my private quarters to cut his</div><div class='line' id='LC7439'>hair and help him get the hang of the lowly raiment he was to wear.</div><div class='line' id='LC7440'>The high classes wore their hair banged across the forehead but</div><div class='line' id='LC7441'>hanging to the shoulders the rest of the way around, whereas the</div><div class='line' id='LC7442'>lowest ranks of commoners were banged fore and aft both; the slaves</div><div class='line' id='LC7443'>were bangless, and allowed their hair free growth.  So I inverted</div><div class='line' id='LC7444'>a bowl over his head and cut away all the locks that hung below it.</div><div class='line' id='LC7445'>I also trimmed his whiskers and mustache until they were only</div><div class='line' id='LC7446'>about a half-inch long; and tried to do it inartistically, and</div><div class='line' id='LC7447'>succeeded.  It was a villainous disfigurement.  When he got his</div><div class='line' id='LC7448'>lubberly sandals on, and his long robe of coarse brown linen cloth,</div><div class='line' id='LC7449'>which hung straight from his neck to his ankle-bones, he was no</div><div class='line' id='LC7450'>longer the comeliest man in his kingdom, but one of the unhandsomest</div><div class='line' id='LC7451'>and most commonplace and unattractive.  We were dressed and barbered</div><div class='line' id='LC7452'>alike, and could pass for small farmers, or farm bailiffs, or</div><div class='line' id='LC7453'>shepherds, or carters; yes, or for village artisans, if we chose,</div><div class='line' id='LC7454'>our costume being in effect universal among the poor, because of</div><div class='line' id='LC7455'>its strength and cheapness.  I don&#39;t mean that it was really cheap</div><div class='line' id='LC7456'>to a very poor person, but I do mean that it was the cheapest</div><div class='line' id='LC7457'>material there was for male attire--manufactured material, you</div><div class='line' id='LC7458'>understand.</div><div class='line' id='LC7459'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7460'>We slipped away an hour before dawn, and by broad sun-up had made</div><div class='line' id='LC7461'>eight or ten miles, and were in the midst of a sparsely settled</div><div class='line' id='LC7462'>country.  I had a pretty heavy knapsack; it was laden with</div><div class='line' id='LC7463'>provisions--provisions for the king to taper down on, till he</div><div class='line' id='LC7464'>could take to the coarse fare of the country without damage.</div><div class='line' id='LC7465'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7466'>I found a comfortable seat for the king by the roadside, and then</div><div class='line' id='LC7467'>gave him a morsel or two to stay his stomach with.  Then I said</div><div class='line' id='LC7468'>I would find some water for him, and strolled away.  Part of my</div><div class='line' id='LC7469'>project was to get out of sight and sit down and rest a little</div><div class='line' id='LC7470'>myself.  It had always been my custom to stand when in his presence;</div><div class='line' id='LC7471'>even at the council board, except upon those rare occasions when</div><div class='line' id='LC7472'>the sitting was a very long one, extending over hours; then I had</div><div class='line' id='LC7473'>a trifling little backless thing which was like a reversed culvert</div><div class='line' id='LC7474'>and was as comfortable as the toothache.  I didn&#39;t want to break</div><div class='line' id='LC7475'>him in suddenly, but do it by degrees.  We should have to sit</div><div class='line' id='LC7476'>together now when in company, or people would notice; but it would</div><div class='line' id='LC7477'>not be good politics for me to be playing equality with him when</div><div class='line' id='LC7478'>there was no necessity for it.</div><div class='line' id='LC7479'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7480'>I found the water some three hundred yards away, and had been</div><div class='line' id='LC7481'>resting about twenty minutes, when I heard voices.  That is all</div><div class='line' id='LC7482'>right, I thought--peasants going to work; nobody else likely to be</div><div class='line' id='LC7483'>stirring this early.  But the next moment these comers jingled into</div><div class='line' id='LC7484'>sight around a turn of the road--smartly clad people of quality,</div><div class='line' id='LC7485'>with luggage-mules and servants in their train!  I was off like</div><div class='line' id='LC7486'>a shot, through the bushes, by the shortest cut.  For a while it</div><div class='line' id='LC7487'>did seem that these people would pass the king before I could</div><div class='line' id='LC7488'>get to him; but desperation gives you wings, you know, and I canted</div><div class='line' id='LC7489'>my body forward, inflated my breast, and held my breath and flew.</div><div class='line' id='LC7490'>I arrived.  And in plenty good enough time, too.</div><div class='line' id='LC7491'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7492'>&quot;Pardon, my king, but it&#39;s no time for ceremony--jump!  Jump to</div><div class='line' id='LC7493'>your feet--some quality are coming!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7494'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7495'>&quot;Is that a marvel?  Let them come.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7496'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7497'>&quot;But my liege!  You must not be seen sitting.  Rise!--and stand in</div><div class='line' id='LC7498'>humble posture while they pass.  You are a peasant, you know.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7499'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7500'>&quot;True--I had forgot it, so lost was I in planning of a huge war</div><div class='line' id='LC7501'>with Gaul&quot;--he was up by this time, but a farm could have got up</div><div class='line' id='LC7502'>quicker, if there was any kind of a boom in real estate--&quot;and</div><div class='line' id='LC7503'>right-so a thought came randoming overthwart this majestic dream</div><div class='line' id='LC7504'>the which--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7505'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7506'>&quot;A humbler attitude, my lord the king--and quick!  Duck your head!</div><div class='line' id='LC7507'>--more!--still more!--droop it!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7508'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7509'>He did his honest best, but lord, it was no great things.  He looked</div><div class='line' id='LC7510'>as humble as the leaning tower at Pisa.  It is the most you could</div><div class='line' id='LC7511'>say of it.  Indeed, it was such a thundering poor success that</div><div class='line' id='LC7512'>it raised wondering scowls all along the line, and a gorgeous</div><div class='line' id='LC7513'>flunkey at the tail end of it raised his whip; but I jumped in</div><div class='line' id='LC7514'>time and was under it when it fell; and under cover of the volley</div><div class='line' id='LC7515'>of coarse laughter which followed, I spoke up sharply and warned</div><div class='line' id='LC7516'>the king to take no notice.  He mastered himself for the moment,</div><div class='line' id='LC7517'>but it was a sore tax; he wanted to eat up the procession.  I said:</div><div class='line' id='LC7518'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7519'>&quot;It would end our adventures at the very start; and we, being</div><div class='line' id='LC7520'>without weapons, could do nothing with that armed gang.  If we</div><div class='line' id='LC7521'>are going to succeed in our emprise, we must not only look the</div><div class='line' id='LC7522'>peasant but act the peasant.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7523'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7524'>&quot;It is wisdom; none can gainsay it.  Let us go on, Sir Boss.</div><div class='line' id='LC7525'>I will take note and learn, and do the best I may.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7526'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7527'>He kept his word.  He did the best he could, but I&#39;ve seen better.</div><div class='line' id='LC7528'>If you have ever seen an active, heedless, enterprising child</div><div class='line' id='LC7529'>going diligently out of one mischief and into another all day</div><div class='line' id='LC7530'>long, and an anxious mother at its heels all the while, and just</div><div class='line' id='LC7531'>saving it by a hair from drowning itself or breaking its neck with</div><div class='line' id='LC7532'>each new experiment, you&#39;ve seen the king and me.</div><div class='line' id='LC7533'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7534'>If I could have foreseen what the thing was going to be like,</div><div class='line' id='LC7535'>I should have said, No, if anybody wants to make his living</div><div class='line' id='LC7536'>exhibiting a king as a peasant, let him take the layout; I can</div><div class='line' id='LC7537'>do better with a menagerie, and last longer.  And yet, during</div><div class='line' id='LC7538'>the first three days I never allowed him to enter a hut or other</div><div class='line' id='LC7539'>dwelling.  If he could pass muster anywhere during his early</div><div class='line' id='LC7540'>novitiate it would be in small inns and on the road; so to these</div><div class='line' id='LC7541'>places we confined ourselves.  Yes, he certainly did the best he</div><div class='line' id='LC7542'>could, but what of that?  He didn&#39;t improve a bit that I could see.</div><div class='line' id='LC7543'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7544'>He was always frightening me, always breaking out with fresh</div><div class='line' id='LC7545'>astonishers, in new and unexpected places.  Toward evening on</div><div class='line' id='LC7546'>the second day, what does he do but blandly fetch out a dirk</div><div class='line' id='LC7547'>from inside his robe!</div><div class='line' id='LC7548'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7549'>&quot;Great guns, my liege, where did you get that?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7550'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7551'>&quot;From a smuggler at the inn, yester eve.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7552'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7553'>&quot;What in the world possessed you to buy it?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7554'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7555'>&quot;We have escaped divers dangers by wit--thy wit--but I have</div><div class='line' id='LC7556'>bethought me that it were but prudence if I bore a weapon, too.</div><div class='line' id='LC7557'>Thine might fail thee in some pinch.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7558'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7559'>&quot;But people of our condition are not allowed to carry arms.  What</div><div class='line' id='LC7560'>would a lord say--yes, or any other person of whatever condition</div><div class='line' id='LC7561'>--if he caught an upstart peasant with a dagger on his person?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7562'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7563'>It was a lucky thing for us that nobody came along just then.</div><div class='line' id='LC7564'>I persuaded him to throw the dirk away; and it was as easy as</div><div class='line' id='LC7565'>persuading a child to give up some bright fresh new way of killing</div><div class='line' id='LC7566'>itself.  We walked along, silent and thinking.  Finally the king said:</div><div class='line' id='LC7567'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7568'>&quot;When ye know that I meditate a thing inconvenient, or that hath</div><div class='line' id='LC7569'>a peril in it, why do you not warn me to cease from that project?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7570'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7571'>It was a startling question, and a puzzler.  I didn&#39;t quite know</div><div class='line' id='LC7572'>how to take hold of it, or what to say, and so, of course, I ended</div><div class='line' id='LC7573'>by saying the natural thing:</div><div class='line' id='LC7574'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7575'>&quot;But, sire, how can I know what your thoughts are?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7576'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7577'>The king stopped dead in his tracks, and stared at me.</div><div class='line' id='LC7578'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7579'>&quot;I believed thou wert greater than Merlin; and truly in magic</div><div class='line' id='LC7580'>thou art.  But prophecy is greater than magic.  Merlin is a prophet.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7581'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7582'>I saw I had made a blunder.  I must get back my lost ground.</div><div class='line' id='LC7583'>After a deep reflection and careful planning, I said:</div><div class='line' id='LC7584'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7585'>&quot;Sire, I have been misunderstood.  I will explain.  There are two</div><div class='line' id='LC7586'>kinds of prophecy.  One is the gift to foretell things that are but</div><div class='line' id='LC7587'>a little way off, the other is the gift to foretell things that</div><div class='line' id='LC7588'>are whole ages and centuries away.  Which is the mightier gift,</div><div class='line' id='LC7589'>do you think?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7590'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7591'>&quot;Oh, the last, most surely!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7592'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7593'>&quot;True.  Does Merlin possess it?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7594'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7595'>&quot;Partly, yes.  He foretold mysteries about my birth and future</div><div class='line' id='LC7596'>kingship that were twenty years away.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7597'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7598'>&quot;Has he ever gone beyond that?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7599'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7600'>&quot;He would not claim more, I think.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7601'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7602'>&quot;It is probably his limit.  All prophets have their limit.  The limit</div><div class='line' id='LC7603'>of some of the great prophets has been a hundred years.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7604'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7605'>&quot;These are few, I ween.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7606'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7607'>&quot;There have been two still greater ones, whose limit was four</div><div class='line' id='LC7608'>hundred and six hundred years, and one whose limit compassed</div><div class='line' id='LC7609'>even seven hundred and twenty.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7610'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7611'>&quot;Gramercy, it is marvelous!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7612'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7613'>&quot;But what are these in comparison with me?  They are nothing.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7614'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7615'>&quot;What?  Canst thou truly look beyond even so vast a stretch</div><div class='line' id='LC7616'>of time as--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7617'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7618'>&quot;Seven hundred years?  My liege, as clear as the vision of an eagle</div><div class='line' id='LC7619'>does my prophetic eye penetrate and lay bare the future of this</div><div class='line' id='LC7620'>world for nearly thirteen centuries and a half!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7621'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7622'>My land, you should have seen the king&#39;s eyes spread slowly open,</div><div class='line' id='LC7623'>and lift the earth&#39;s entire atmosphere as much as an inch!  That</div><div class='line' id='LC7624'>settled Brer Merlin.  One never had any occasion to prove his</div><div class='line' id='LC7625'>facts, with these people; all he had to do was to state them.  It</div><div class='line' id='LC7626'>never occurred to anybody to doubt the statement.</div><div class='line' id='LC7627'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7628'>&quot;Now, then,&quot; I continued, &quot;I _could_ work both kinds of prophecy</div><div class='line' id='LC7629'>--the long and the short--if I chose to take the trouble to keep</div><div class='line' id='LC7630'>in practice; but I seldom exercise any but the long kind, because</div><div class='line' id='LC7631'>the other is beneath my dignity.  It is properer to Merlin&#39;s sort</div><div class='line' id='LC7632'>--stump-tail prophets, as we call them in the profession.  Of course,</div><div class='line' id='LC7633'>I whet up now and then and flirt out a minor prophecy, but not</div><div class='line' id='LC7634'>often--hardly ever, in fact.  You will remember that there was</div><div class='line' id='LC7635'>great talk, when you reached the Valley of Holiness, about my</div><div class='line' id='LC7636'>having prophesied your coming and the very hour of your arrival,</div><div class='line' id='LC7637'>two or three days beforehand.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7638'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7639'>&quot;Indeed, yes, I mind it now.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7640'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7641'>&quot;Well, I could have done it as much as forty times easier, and</div><div class='line' id='LC7642'>piled on a thousand times more detail into the bargain, if it had</div><div class='line' id='LC7643'>been five hundred years away instead of two or three days.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7644'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7645'>&quot;How amazing that it should be so!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7646'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7647'>&quot;Yes, a genuine expert can always foretell a thing that is five</div><div class='line' id='LC7648'>hundred years away easier than he can a thing that&#39;s only five</div><div class='line' id='LC7649'>hundred seconds off.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7650'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7651'>&quot;And yet in reason it should clearly be the other way; it should</div><div class='line' id='LC7652'>be five hundred times as easy to foretell the last as the first,</div><div class='line' id='LC7653'>for, indeed, it is so close by that one uninspired might almost</div><div class='line' id='LC7654'>see it.  In truth, the law of prophecy doth contradict the likelihoods,</div><div class='line' id='LC7655'>most strangely making the difficult easy, and the easy difficult.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7656'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7657'>It was a wise head.  A peasant&#39;s cap was no safe disguise for it;</div><div class='line' id='LC7658'>you could know it for a king&#39;s under a diving-bell, if you could</div><div class='line' id='LC7659'>hear it work its intellect.</div><div class='line' id='LC7660'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7661'>I had a new trade now, and plenty of business in it.  The king</div><div class='line' id='LC7662'>was as hungry to find out everything that was going to happen</div><div class='line' id='LC7663'>during the next thirteen centuries as if he were expecting to live</div><div class='line' id='LC7664'>in them.  From that time out, I prophesied myself bald-headed</div><div class='line' id='LC7665'>trying to supply the demand.  I have done some indiscreet things in</div><div class='line' id='LC7666'>my day, but this thing of playing myself for a prophet was the</div><div class='line' id='LC7667'>worst.  Still, it had its ameliorations.  A prophet doesn&#39;t have</div><div class='line' id='LC7668'>to have any brains.  They are good to have, of course, for the</div><div class='line' id='LC7669'>ordinary exigencies of life, but they are no use in professional</div><div class='line' id='LC7670'>work.  It is the restfulest vocation there is.  When the spirit of</div><div class='line' id='LC7671'>prophecy comes upon you, you merely cake your intellect and lay it</div><div class='line' id='LC7672'>off in a cool place for a rest, and unship your jaw and leave it</div><div class='line' id='LC7673'>alone; it will work itself: the result is prophecy.</div><div class='line' id='LC7674'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7675'>Every day a knight-errant or so came along, and the sight of them</div><div class='line' id='LC7676'>fired the king&#39;s martial spirit every time.  He would have forgotten</div><div class='line' id='LC7677'>himself, sure, and said something to them in a style a suspicious</div><div class='line' id='LC7678'>shade or so above his ostensible degree, and so I always got him</div><div class='line' id='LC7679'>well out of the road in time.  Then he would stand and look with</div><div class='line' id='LC7680'>all his eyes; and a proud light would flash from them, and his</div><div class='line' id='LC7681'>nostrils would inflate like a war-horse&#39;s, and I knew he was</div><div class='line' id='LC7682'>longing for a brush with them.  But about noon of the third day</div><div class='line' id='LC7683'>I had stopped in the road to take a precaution which had been</div><div class='line' id='LC7684'>suggested by the whip-stroke that had fallen to my share two days</div><div class='line' id='LC7685'>before; a precaution which I had afterward decided to leave untaken,</div><div class='line' id='LC7686'>I was so loath to institute it; but now I had just had a fresh</div><div class='line' id='LC7687'>reminder: while striding heedlessly along, with jaw spread and</div><div class='line' id='LC7688'>intellect at rest, for I was prophesying, I stubbed my toe and</div><div class='line' id='LC7689'>fell sprawling.  I was so pale I couldn&#39;t think for a moment;</div><div class='line' id='LC7690'>then I got softly and carefully up and unstrapped my knapsack.</div><div class='line' id='LC7691'>I had that dynamite bomb in it, done up in wool in a box.  It was</div><div class='line' id='LC7692'>a good thing to have along; the time would come when I could do</div><div class='line' id='LC7693'>a valuable miracle with it, maybe, but it was a nervous thing</div><div class='line' id='LC7694'>to have about me, and I didn&#39;t like to ask the king to carry it.</div><div class='line' id='LC7695'>Yet I must either throw it away or think up some safe way to get</div><div class='line' id='LC7696'>along with its society.  I got it out and slipped it into my scrip,</div><div class='line' id='LC7697'>and just then here came a couple of knights.  The king stood,</div><div class='line' id='LC7698'>stately as a statue, gazing toward them--had forgotten himself again,</div><div class='line' id='LC7699'>of course--and before I could get a word of warning out, it was</div><div class='line' id='LC7700'>time for him to skip, and well that he did it, too.  He supposed</div><div class='line' id='LC7701'>they would turn aside.  Turn aside to avoid trampling peasant dirt</div><div class='line' id='LC7702'>under foot?  When had he ever turned aside himself--or ever had</div><div class='line' id='LC7703'>the chance to do it, if a peasant saw him or any other noble knight</div><div class='line' id='LC7704'>in time to judiciously save him the trouble?  The knights paid</div><div class='line' id='LC7705'>no attention to the king at all; it was his place to look out</div><div class='line' id='LC7706'>himself, and if he hadn&#39;t skipped he would have been placidly</div><div class='line' id='LC7707'>ridden down, and laughed at besides.</div><div class='line' id='LC7708'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7709'>The king was in a flaming fury, and launched out his challenge</div><div class='line' id='LC7710'>and epithets with a most royal vigor.  The knights were some little</div><div class='line' id='LC7711'>distance by now.  They halted, greatly surprised, and turned in</div><div class='line' id='LC7712'>their saddles and looked back, as if wondering if it might be worth</div><div class='line' id='LC7713'>while to bother with such scum as we.  Then they wheeled and</div><div class='line' id='LC7714'>started for us.  Not a moment must be lost.  I started for _them_.</div><div class='line' id='LC7715'>I passed them at a rattling gait, and as I went by I flung out a</div><div class='line' id='LC7716'>hair-lifting soul-scorching thirteen-jointed insult which made</div><div class='line' id='LC7717'>the king&#39;s effort poor and cheap by comparison.  I got it out of</div><div class='line' id='LC7718'>the nineteenth century where they know how.  They had such headway</div><div class='line' id='LC7719'>that they were nearly to the king before they could check up;</div><div class='line' id='LC7720'>then, frantic with rage, they stood up their horses on their hind</div><div class='line' id='LC7721'>hoofs and whirled them around, and the next moment here they came,</div><div class='line' id='LC7722'>breast to breast.  I was seventy yards off, then, and scrambling up</div><div class='line' id='LC7723'>a great bowlder at the roadside.  When they were within thirty</div><div class='line' id='LC7724'>yards of me they let their long lances droop to a level, depressed</div><div class='line' id='LC7725'>their mailed heads, and so, with their horse-hair plumes streaming</div><div class='line' id='LC7726'>straight out behind, most gallant to see, this lightning express</div><div class='line' id='LC7727'>came tearing for me!  When they were within fifteen yards, I sent</div><div class='line' id='LC7728'>that bomb with a sure aim, and it struck the ground just under</div><div class='line' id='LC7729'>the horses&#39; noses.</div><div class='line' id='LC7730'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7731'>Yes, it was a neat thing, very neat and pretty to see.  It resembled</div><div class='line' id='LC7732'>a steamboat explosion on the Mississippi; and during the next</div><div class='line' id='LC7733'>fifteen minutes we stood under a steady drizzle of microscopic</div><div class='line' id='LC7734'>fragments of knights and hardware and horse-flesh.  I say we,</div><div class='line' id='LC7735'>for the king joined the audience, of course, as soon as he had got</div><div class='line' id='LC7736'>his breath again.  There was a hole there which would afford steady</div><div class='line' id='LC7737'>work for all the people in that region for some years to come</div><div class='line' id='LC7738'>--in trying to explain it, I mean; as for filling it up, that service</div><div class='line' id='LC7739'>would be comparatively prompt, and would fall to the lot of a</div><div class='line' id='LC7740'>select few--peasants of that seignory; and they wouldn&#39;t get</div><div class='line' id='LC7741'>anything for it, either.</div><div class='line' id='LC7742'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7743'>But I explained it to the king myself. I said it was done with a</div><div class='line' id='LC7744'>dynamite bomb.  This information did him no damage, because it</div><div class='line' id='LC7745'>left him as intelligent as he was before.  However, it was a noble</div><div class='line' id='LC7746'>miracle, in his eyes, and was another settler for Merlin.  I thought</div><div class='line' id='LC7747'>it well enough to explain that this was a miracle of so rare a sort</div><div class='line' id='LC7748'>that it couldn&#39;t be done except when the atmospheric conditions</div><div class='line' id='LC7749'>were just right.  Otherwise he would be encoring it every time we</div><div class='line' id='LC7750'>had a good subject, and that would be inconvenient, because I</div><div class='line' id='LC7751'>hadn&#39;t any more bombs along.</div><div class='line' id='LC7752'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7753'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7754'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7755'>CHAPTER XXVIII</div><div class='line' id='LC7756'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7757'>DRILLING THE KING</div><div class='line' id='LC7758'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7759'>On the morning of the fourth day, when it was just sunrise, and we</div><div class='line' id='LC7760'>had been tramping an hour in the chill dawn, I came to a resolution:</div><div class='line' id='LC7761'>the king _must_ be drilled; things could not go on so, he must be</div><div class='line' id='LC7762'>taken in hand and deliberately and conscientiously drilled, or we</div><div class='line' id='LC7763'>couldn&#39;t ever venture to enter a dwelling; the very cats would know</div><div class='line' id='LC7764'>this masquerader for a humbug and no peasant.  So I called a halt</div><div class='line' id='LC7765'>and said:</div><div class='line' id='LC7766'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7767'>&quot;Sire, as between clothes and countenance, you are all right, there</div><div class='line' id='LC7768'>is no discrepancy; but as between your clothes and your bearing,</div><div class='line' id='LC7769'>you are all wrong, there is a most noticeable discrepancy.  Your</div><div class='line' id='LC7770'>soldierly stride, your lordly port--these will not do.  You stand</div><div class='line' id='LC7771'>too straight, your looks are too high, too confident.  The cares</div><div class='line' id='LC7772'>of a kingdom do not stoop the shoulders, they do not droop the chin,</div><div class='line' id='LC7773'>they do not depress the high level of the eye-glance, they do not</div><div class='line' id='LC7774'>put doubt and fear in the heart and hang out the signs of them</div><div class='line' id='LC7775'>in slouching body and unsure step.  It is the sordid cares of</div><div class='line' id='LC7776'>the lowly born that do these things.  You must learn the trick;</div><div class='line' id='LC7777'>you must imitate the trademarks of poverty, misery, oppression,</div><div class='line' id='LC7778'>insult, and the other several and common inhumanities that sap</div><div class='line' id='LC7779'>the manliness out of a man and make him a loyal and proper and</div><div class='line' id='LC7780'>approved subject and a satisfaction to his masters, or the very</div><div class='line' id='LC7781'>infants will know you for better than your disguise, and we shall go</div><div class='line' id='LC7782'>to pieces at the first hut we stop at.  Pray try to walk like this.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7783'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7784'>The king took careful note, and then tried an imitation.</div><div class='line' id='LC7785'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7786'>&quot;Pretty fair--pretty fair.  Chin a little lower, please--there, very</div><div class='line' id='LC7787'>good.  Eyes too high; pray don&#39;t look at the horizon, look at the</div><div class='line' id='LC7788'>ground, ten steps in front of you.  Ah--that is better, that is</div><div class='line' id='LC7789'>very good.  Wait, please; you betray too much vigor, too much</div><div class='line' id='LC7790'>decision; you want more of a shamble.  Look at me, please--this is</div><div class='line' id='LC7791'>what I mean....  Now you are getting it; that is the idea--at least,</div><div class='line' id='LC7792'>it sort of approaches it....  Yes, that is pretty fair.  _But!_</div><div class='line' id='LC7793'>There is a great big something wanting, I don&#39;t quite know what</div><div class='line' id='LC7794'>it is.  Please walk thirty yards, so that I can get a perspective</div><div class='line' id='LC7795'>on the thing....  Now, then--your head&#39;s right, speed&#39;s right,</div><div class='line' id='LC7796'>shoulders right, eyes right, chin right, gait, carriage, general</div><div class='line' id='LC7797'>style right--everything&#39;s right!  And yet the fact remains, the</div><div class='line' id='LC7798'>aggregate&#39;s wrong.  The account don&#39;t balance.  Do it again,</div><div class='line' id='LC7799'>please....  _Now_ I think I begin to see what it is.  Yes, I&#39;ve</div><div class='line' id='LC7800'>struck it.  You see, the genuine spiritlessness is wanting; that&#39;s</div><div class='line' id='LC7801'>what&#39;s the trouble.  It&#39;s all _amateur_--mechanical details all</div><div class='line' id='LC7802'>right, almost to a hair; everything about the delusion perfect,</div><div class='line' id='LC7803'>except that it don&#39;t delude.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7804'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7805'>&quot;What, then, must one do, to prevail?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7806'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7807'>&quot;Let me think... I can&#39;t seem to quite get at it.  In fact, there</div><div class='line' id='LC7808'>isn&#39;t anything that can right the matter but practice.  This is</div><div class='line' id='LC7809'>a good place for it: roots and stony ground to break up your</div><div class='line' id='LC7810'>stately gait, a region not liable to interruption, only one field</div><div class='line' id='LC7811'>and one hut in sight, and they so far away that nobody could</div><div class='line' id='LC7812'>see us from there.  It will be well to move a little off the road</div><div class='line' id='LC7813'>and put in the whole day drilling you, sire.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7814'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7815'>After the drill had gone on a little while, I said:</div><div class='line' id='LC7816'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7817'>&quot;Now, sire, imagine that we are at the door of the hut yonder,</div><div class='line' id='LC7818'>and the family are before us.  Proceed, please--accost the head</div><div class='line' id='LC7819'>of the house.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7820'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7821'>The king unconsciously straightened up like a monument, and said,</div><div class='line' id='LC7822'>with frozen austerity:</div><div class='line' id='LC7823'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7824'>&quot;Varlet, bring a seat; and serve to me what cheer ye have.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7825'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7826'>&quot;Ah, your grace, that is not well done.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7827'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7828'>&quot;In what lacketh it?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7829'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7830'>&quot;These people do not call _each other_ varlets.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7831'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7832'>&quot;Nay, is that true?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7833'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7834'>&quot;Yes; only those above them call them so.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7835'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7836'>&quot;Then must I try again.  I will call him villein.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7837'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7838'>&quot;No-no; for he may be a freeman.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7839'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7840'>&quot;Ah--so.  Then peradventure I should call him goodman.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7841'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7842'>&quot;That would answer, your grace, but it would be still better if</div><div class='line' id='LC7843'>you said friend, or brother.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7844'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7845'>&quot;Brother!--to dirt like that?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7846'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7847'>&quot;Ah, but _we_ are pretending to be dirt like that, too.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7848'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7849'>&quot;It is even true.  I will say it.  Brother, bring a seat, and</div><div class='line' id='LC7850'>thereto what cheer ye have, withal.  Now &#39;tis right.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7851'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7852'>&quot;Not quite, not wholly right.  You have asked for one, not _us_</div><div class='line' id='LC7853'>--for one, not both; food for one, a seat for one.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7854'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7855'>The king looked puzzled--he wasn&#39;t a very heavy weight, intellectually.</div><div class='line' id='LC7856'>His head was an hour-glass; it could stow an idea, but it had to do</div><div class='line' id='LC7857'>it a grain at a time, not the whole idea at once.</div><div class='line' id='LC7858'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7859'>&quot;Would _you_ have a seat also--and sit?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7860'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7861'>&quot;If I did not sit, the man would perceive that we were only pretending</div><div class='line' id='LC7862'>to be equals--and playing the deception pretty poorly, too.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7863'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7864'>&quot;It is well and truly said!  How wonderful is truth, come it in</div><div class='line' id='LC7865'>whatsoever unexpected form it may!  Yes, he must bring out seats</div><div class='line' id='LC7866'>and food for both, and in serving us present not ewer and napkin</div><div class='line' id='LC7867'>with more show of respect to the one than to the other.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7868'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7869'>&quot;And there is even yet a detail that needs correcting.  He must</div><div class='line' id='LC7870'>bring nothing outside; we will go in--in among the dirt, and</div><div class='line' id='LC7871'>possibly other repulsive things,--and take the food with the</div><div class='line' id='LC7872'>household, and after the fashion of the house, and all on equal</div><div class='line' id='LC7873'>terms, except the man be of the serf class; and finally, there</div><div class='line' id='LC7874'>will be no ewer and no napkin, whether he be serf or free.  Please</div><div class='line' id='LC7875'>walk again, my liege.  There--it is better--it is the best yet;</div><div class='line' id='LC7876'>but not perfect.  The shoulders have known no ignobler burden</div><div class='line' id='LC7877'>than iron mail, and they will not stoop.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7878'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7879'>&quot;Give me, then, the bag.  I will learn the spirit that goeth</div><div class='line' id='LC7880'>with burdens that have not honor.  It is the spirit that stoopeth</div><div class='line' id='LC7881'>the shoulders, I ween, and not the weight; for armor is heavy,</div><div class='line' id='LC7882'>yet it is a proud burden, and a man standeth straight in it....</div><div class='line' id='LC7883'>Nay, but me no buts, offer me no objections.  I will have the thing.</div><div class='line' id='LC7884'>Strap it upon my back.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7885'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7886'>He was complete now with that knapsack on, and looked as little</div><div class='line' id='LC7887'>like a king as any man I had ever seen.  But it was an obstinate</div><div class='line' id='LC7888'>pair of shoulders; they could not seem to learn the trick of</div><div class='line' id='LC7889'>stooping with any sort of deceptive naturalness.  The drill went on,</div><div class='line' id='LC7890'>I prompting and correcting:</div><div class='line' id='LC7891'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7892'>&quot;Now, make believe you are in debt, and eaten up by relentless</div><div class='line' id='LC7893'>creditors; you are out of work--which is horse-shoeing, let us</div><div class='line' id='LC7894'>say--and can get none; and your wife is sick, your children are</div><div class='line' id='LC7895'>crying because they are hungry--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7896'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7897'>And so on, and so on.  I drilled him as representing in turn all</div><div class='line' id='LC7898'>sorts of people out of luck and suffering dire privations and</div><div class='line' id='LC7899'>misfortunes.  But lord, it was only just words, words--they meant</div><div class='line' id='LC7900'>nothing in the world to him, I might just as well have whistled.</div><div class='line' id='LC7901'>Words realize nothing, vivify nothing to you, unless you have</div><div class='line' id='LC7902'>suffered in your own person the thing which the words try to</div><div class='line' id='LC7903'>describe.  There are wise people who talk ever so knowingly and</div><div class='line' id='LC7904'>complacently about &quot;the working classes,&quot; and satisfy themselves</div><div class='line' id='LC7905'>that a day&#39;s hard intellectual work is very much harder than</div><div class='line' id='LC7906'>a day&#39;s hard manual toil, and is righteously entitled to much</div><div class='line' id='LC7907'>bigger pay.  Why, they really think that, you know, because they</div><div class='line' id='LC7908'>know all about the one, but haven&#39;t tried the other.  But I know</div><div class='line' id='LC7909'>all about both; and so far as I am concerned, there isn&#39;t money</div><div class='line' id='LC7910'>enough in the universe to hire me to swing a pickaxe thirty days,</div><div class='line' id='LC7911'>but I will do the hardest kind of intellectual work for just as</div><div class='line' id='LC7912'>near nothing as you can cipher it down--and I will be satisfied, too.</div><div class='line' id='LC7913'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7914'>Intellectual &quot;work&quot; is misnamed; it is a pleasure, a dissipation,</div><div class='line' id='LC7915'>and is its own highest reward.  The poorest paid architect,</div><div class='line' id='LC7916'>engineer, general, author, sculptor, painter, lecturer, advocate,</div><div class='line' id='LC7917'>legislator, actor, preacher, singer is constructively in heaven</div><div class='line' id='LC7918'>when he is at work; and as for the musician with the fiddle-bow</div><div class='line' id='LC7919'>in his hand who sits in the midst of a great orchestra with the</div><div class='line' id='LC7920'>ebbing and flowing tides of divine sound washing over him--why,</div><div class='line' id='LC7921'>certainly, he is at work, if you wish to call it that, but lord,</div><div class='line' id='LC7922'>it&#39;s a sarcasm just the same.  The law of work does seem utterly</div><div class='line' id='LC7923'>unfair--but there it is, and nothing can change it: the higher</div><div class='line' id='LC7924'>the pay in enjoyment the worker gets out of it, the higher shall</div><div class='line' id='LC7925'>be his pay in cash, also.  And it&#39;s also the very law of those</div><div class='line' id='LC7926'>transparent swindles, transmissible nobility and kingship.</div><div class='line' id='LC7927'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7928'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7929'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7930'>CHAPTER XXIX</div><div class='line' id='LC7931'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7932'>THE SMALLPOX HUT</div><div class='line' id='LC7933'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7934'>When we arrived at that hut at mid-afternoon, we saw no signs</div><div class='line' id='LC7935'>of life about it.  The field near by had been denuded of its crop</div><div class='line' id='LC7936'>some time before, and had a skinned look, so exhaustively had</div><div class='line' id='LC7937'>it been harvested and gleaned.  Fences, sheds, everything had a</div><div class='line' id='LC7938'>ruined look, and were eloquent of poverty.  No animal was around</div><div class='line' id='LC7939'>anywhere, no living thing in sight.  The stillness was awful, it</div><div class='line' id='LC7940'>was like the stillness of death.  The cabin was a one-story one,</div><div class='line' id='LC7941'>whose thatch was black with age, and ragged from lack of repair.</div><div class='line' id='LC7942'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7943'>The door stood a trifle ajar.  We approached it stealthily--on tiptoe</div><div class='line' id='LC7944'>and at half-breath--for that is the way one&#39;s feeling makes him do,</div><div class='line' id='LC7945'>at such a time.  The king knocked.  We waited.  No answer.  Knocked</div><div class='line' id='LC7946'>again.  No answer.  I pushed the door softly open and looked in.</div><div class='line' id='LC7947'>I made out some dim forms, and a woman started up from the ground</div><div class='line' id='LC7948'>and stared at me, as one does who is wakened from sleep.  Presently</div><div class='line' id='LC7949'>she found her voice:</div><div class='line' id='LC7950'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7951'>&quot;Have mercy!&quot; she pleaded.  &quot;All is taken, nothing is left.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7952'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7953'>&quot;I have not come to take anything, poor woman.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7954'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7955'>&quot;You are not a priest?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7956'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7957'>&quot;No.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7958'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7959'>&quot;Nor come not from the lord of the manor?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7960'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7961'>&quot;No, I am a stranger.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7962'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7963'>&quot;Oh, then, for the fear of God, who visits with misery and death</div><div class='line' id='LC7964'>such as be harmless, tarry not here, but fly!  This place is under</div><div class='line' id='LC7965'>his curse--and his Church&#39;s.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7966'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7967'>&quot;Let me come in and help you--you are sick and in trouble.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7968'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7969'>I was better used to the dim light now.  I could see her hollow</div><div class='line' id='LC7970'>eyes fixed upon me.  I could see how emaciated she was.</div><div class='line' id='LC7971'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7972'>&quot;I tell you the place is under the Church&#39;s ban.  Save yourself</div><div class='line' id='LC7973'>--and go, before some straggler see thee here, and report it.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7974'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7975'>&quot;Give yourself no trouble about me; I don&#39;t care anything for the</div><div class='line' id='LC7976'>Church&#39;s curse.  Let me help you.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7977'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7978'>&quot;Now all good spirits--if there be any such--bless thee for that</div><div class='line' id='LC7979'>word.  Would God I had a sup of water!--but hold, hold, forget</div><div class='line' id='LC7980'>I said it, and fly; for there is that here that even he that</div><div class='line' id='LC7981'>feareth not the Church must fear: this disease whereof we die.</div><div class='line' id='LC7982'>Leave us, thou brave, good stranger, and take with thee such</div><div class='line' id='LC7983'>whole and sincere blessing as them that be accursed can give.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7984'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7985'>But before this I had picked up a wooden bowl and was rushing</div><div class='line' id='LC7986'>past the king on my way to the brook.  It was ten yards away.</div><div class='line' id='LC7987'>When I got back and entered, the king was within, and was opening</div><div class='line' id='LC7988'>the shutter that closed the window-hole, to let in air and light.</div><div class='line' id='LC7989'>The place was full of a foul stench.  I put the bowl to the woman&#39;s</div><div class='line' id='LC7990'>lips, and as she gripped it with her eager talons the shutter came</div><div class='line' id='LC7991'>open and a strong light flooded her face.  Smallpox!</div><div class='line' id='LC7992'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7993'>I sprang to the king, and said in his ear:</div><div class='line' id='LC7994'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7995'>&quot;Out of the door on the instant, sire! the woman is dying of that</div><div class='line' id='LC7996'>disease that wasted the skirts of Camelot two years ago.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC7997'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7998'>He did not budge.</div><div class='line' id='LC7999'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8000'>&quot;Of a truth I shall remain--and likewise help.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8001'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8002'>I whispered again:</div><div class='line' id='LC8003'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8004'>&quot;King, it must not be.  You must go.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8005'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8006'>&quot;Ye mean well, and ye speak not unwisely.  But it were shame that</div><div class='line' id='LC8007'>a king should know fear, and shame that belted knight should</div><div class='line' id='LC8008'>withhold his hand where be such as need succor.  Peace, I will</div><div class='line' id='LC8009'>not go.  It is you who must go.  The Church&#39;s ban is not upon me,</div><div class='line' id='LC8010'>but it forbiddeth you to be here, and she will deal with you with</div><div class='line' id='LC8011'>a heavy hand an word come to her of your trespass.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8012'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8013'>It was a desperate place for him to be in, and might cost him his</div><div class='line' id='LC8014'>life, but it was no use to argue with him.  If he considered his</div><div class='line' id='LC8015'>knightly honor at stake here, that was the end of argument; he</div><div class='line' id='LC8016'>would stay, and nothing could prevent it; I was aware of that.</div><div class='line' id='LC8017'>And so I dropped the subject.  The woman spoke:</div><div class='line' id='LC8018'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8019'>&quot;Fair sir, of your kindness will ye climb the ladder there,</div><div class='line' id='LC8020'>and bring me news of what ye find?  Be not afraid to report,</div><div class='line' id='LC8021'>for times can come when even a mother&#39;s heart is past breaking</div><div class='line' id='LC8022'>--being already broke.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8023'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8024'>&quot;Abide,&quot; said the king, &quot;and give the woman to eat.  I will go.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8025'>And he put down the knapsack.</div><div class='line' id='LC8026'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8027'>I turned to start, but the king had already started.  He halted,</div><div class='line' id='LC8028'>and looked down upon a man who lay in a dim light, and had not</div><div class='line' id='LC8029'>noticed us thus far, or spoken.</div><div class='line' id='LC8030'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8031'>&quot;Is it your husband?&quot; the king asked.</div><div class='line' id='LC8032'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8033'>&quot;Yes.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8034'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8035'>&quot;Is he asleep?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8036'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8037'>&quot;God be thanked for that one charity, yes--these three hours.</div><div class='line' id='LC8038'>Where shall I pay to the full, my gratitude! for my heart is</div><div class='line' id='LC8039'>bursting with it for that sleep he sleepeth now.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8040'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8041'>I said:</div><div class='line' id='LC8042'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8043'>&quot;We will be careful.  We will not wake him.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8044'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8045'>&quot;Ah, no, that ye will not, for he is dead.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8046'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8047'>&quot;Dead?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8048'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8049'>&quot;Yes, what triumph it is to know it!  None can harm him, none</div><div class='line' id='LC8050'>insult him more.  He is in heaven now, and happy; or if not there,</div><div class='line' id='LC8051'>he bides in hell and is content; for in that place he will find</div><div class='line' id='LC8052'>neither abbot nor yet bishop.  We were boy and girl together; we</div><div class='line' id='LC8053'>were man and wife these five and twenty years, and never separated</div><div class='line' id='LC8054'>till this day.  Think how long that is to love and suffer together.</div><div class='line' id='LC8055'>This morning was he out of his mind, and in his fancy we were</div><div class='line' id='LC8056'>boy and girl again and wandering in the happy fields; and so in</div><div class='line' id='LC8057'>that innocent glad converse wandered he far and farther, still</div><div class='line' id='LC8058'>lightly gossiping, and entered into those other fields we know</div><div class='line' id='LC8059'>not of, and was shut away from mortal sight.  And so there was</div><div class='line' id='LC8060'>no parting, for in his fancy I went with him; he knew not but</div><div class='line' id='LC8061'>I went with him, my hand in his--my young soft hand, not this</div><div class='line' id='LC8062'>withered claw.  Ah, yes, to go, and know it not; to separate and</div><div class='line' id='LC8063'>know it not; how could one go peace--fuller than that?  It was</div><div class='line' id='LC8064'>his reward for a cruel life patiently borne.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8065'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8066'>There was a slight noise from the direction of the dim corner where</div><div class='line' id='LC8067'>the ladder was.  It was the king descending.  I could see that he</div><div class='line' id='LC8068'>was bearing something in one arm, and assisting himself with the</div><div class='line' id='LC8069'>other.  He came forward into the light; upon his breast lay a</div><div class='line' id='LC8070'>slender girl of fifteen.  She was but half conscious; she was dying</div><div class='line' id='LC8071'>of smallpox.  Here was heroism at its last and loftiest possibility,</div><div class='line' id='LC8072'>its utmost summit; this was challenging death in the open field</div><div class='line' id='LC8073'>unarmed, with all the odds against the challenger, no reward set</div><div class='line' id='LC8074'>upon the contest, and no admiring world in silks and cloth of gold</div><div class='line' id='LC8075'>to gaze and applaud; and yet the king&#39;s bearing was as serenely</div><div class='line' id='LC8076'>brave as it had always been in those cheaper contests where knight</div><div class='line' id='LC8077'>meets knight in equal fight and clothed in protecting steel.  He</div><div class='line' id='LC8078'>was great now; sublimely great.  The rude statues of his ancestors</div><div class='line' id='LC8079'>in his palace should have an addition--I would see to that; and it</div><div class='line' id='LC8080'>would not be a mailed king killing a giant or a dragon, like the</div><div class='line' id='LC8081'>rest, it would be a king in commoner&#39;s garb bearing death in his</div><div class='line' id='LC8082'>arms that a peasant mother might look her last upon her child and</div><div class='line' id='LC8083'>be comforted.</div><div class='line' id='LC8084'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8085'>He laid the girl down by her mother, who poured out endearments</div><div class='line' id='LC8086'>and caresses from an overflowing heart, and one could detect a</div><div class='line' id='LC8087'>flickering faint light of response in the child&#39;s eyes, but that</div><div class='line' id='LC8088'>was all.  The mother hung over her, kissing her, petting her, and</div><div class='line' id='LC8089'>imploring her to speak, but the lips only moved and no sound came.</div><div class='line' id='LC8090'>I snatched my liquor flask from my knapsack, but the woman forbade</div><div class='line' id='LC8091'>me, and said:</div><div class='line' id='LC8092'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8093'>&quot;No--she does not suffer; it is better so.  It might bring her back</div><div class='line' id='LC8094'>to life.  None that be so good and kind as ye are would do her</div><div class='line' id='LC8095'>that cruel hurt.  For look you--what is left to live for?  Her</div><div class='line' id='LC8096'>brothers are gone, her father is gone, her mother goeth, the</div><div class='line' id='LC8097'>Church&#39;s curse is upon her, and none may shelter or befriend her</div><div class='line' id='LC8098'>even though she lay perishing in the road.  She is desolate.  I have</div><div class='line' id='LC8099'>not asked you, good heart, if her sister be still on live, here</div><div class='line' id='LC8100'>overhead; I had no need; ye had gone back, else, and not left</div><div class='line' id='LC8101'>the poor thing forsaken--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8102'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8103'>&quot;She lieth at peace,&quot; interrupted the king, in a subdued voice.</div><div class='line' id='LC8104'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8105'>&quot;I would not change it.  How rich is this day in happiness!  Ah,</div><div class='line' id='LC8106'>my Annis, thou shalt join thy sister soon--thou&#39;rt on thy way,</div><div class='line' id='LC8107'>and these be merciful friends that will not hinder.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8108'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8109'>And so she fell to murmuring and cooing over the girl again, and</div><div class='line' id='LC8110'>softly stroking her face and hair, and kissing her and calling her</div><div class='line' id='LC8111'>by endearing names; but there was scarcely sign of response now</div><div class='line' id='LC8112'>in the glazing eyes.  I saw tears well from the king&#39;s eyes, and</div><div class='line' id='LC8113'>trickle down his face.  The woman noticed them, too, and said:</div><div class='line' id='LC8114'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8115'>&quot;Ah, I know that sign: thou&#39;st a wife at home, poor soul, and</div><div class='line' id='LC8116'>you and she have gone hungry to bed, many&#39;s the time, that the</div><div class='line' id='LC8117'>little ones might have your crust; you know what poverty is, and</div><div class='line' id='LC8118'>the daily insults of your betters, and the heavy hand of the Church</div><div class='line' id='LC8119'>and the king.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8120'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8121'>The king winced under this accidental home-shot, but kept still;</div><div class='line' id='LC8122'>he was learning his part; and he was playing it well, too, for</div><div class='line' id='LC8123'>a pretty dull beginner.  I struck up a diversion.  I offered the</div><div class='line' id='LC8124'>woman food and liquor, but she refused both.  She would allow</div><div class='line' id='LC8125'>nothing to come between her and the release of death.  Then I slipped</div><div class='line' id='LC8126'>away and brought the dead child from aloft, and laid it by her.</div><div class='line' id='LC8127'>This broke her down again, and there was another scene that was</div><div class='line' id='LC8128'>full of heartbreak.  By and by I made another diversion, and beguiled</div><div class='line' id='LC8129'>her to sketch her story.</div><div class='line' id='LC8130'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8131'>&quot;Ye know it well yourselves, having suffered it--for truly none</div><div class='line' id='LC8132'>of our condition in Britain escape it.  It is the old, weary tale.</div><div class='line' id='LC8133'>We fought and struggled and succeeded; meaning by success, that</div><div class='line' id='LC8134'>we lived and did not die; more than that is not to be claimed.
