No</div><div class='line' id='LC8135'>troubles came that we could not outlive, till this year brought</div><div class='line' id='LC8136'>them; then came they all at once, as one might say, and overwhelmed</div><div class='line' id='LC8137'>us.  Years ago the lord of the manor planted certain fruit trees on</div><div class='line' id='LC8138'>our farm; in the best part of it, too--a grievous wrong and shame--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8139'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8140'>&quot;But it was his right,&quot; interrupted the king.</div><div class='line' id='LC8141'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8142'>&quot;None denieth that, indeed; an the law mean anything, what is</div><div class='line' id='LC8143'>the lord&#39;s is his, and what is mine is his also.  Our farm was</div><div class='line' id='LC8144'>ours by lease, therefore &#39;twas likewise his, to do with it as he</div><div class='line' id='LC8145'>would.  Some little time ago, three of those trees were found hewn</div><div class='line' id='LC8146'>down.  Our three grown sons ran frightened to report the crime.</div><div class='line' id='LC8147'>Well, in his lordship&#39;s dungeon there they lie, who saith there</div><div class='line' id='LC8148'>shall they lie and rot till they confess.  They have naught to</div><div class='line' id='LC8149'>confess, being innocent, wherefore there will they remain until</div><div class='line' id='LC8150'>they die.  Ye know that right well, I ween.  Think how this left us;</div><div class='line' id='LC8151'>a man, a woman and two children, to gather a crop that was planted</div><div class='line' id='LC8152'>by so much greater force, yes, and protect it night and day from</div><div class='line' id='LC8153'>pigeons and prowling animals that be sacred and must not be hurt</div><div class='line' id='LC8154'>by any of our sort.  When my lord&#39;s crop was nearly ready for</div><div class='line' id='LC8155'>the harvest, so also was ours; when his bell rang to call us to</div><div class='line' id='LC8156'>his fields to harvest his crop for nothing, he would not allow that</div><div class='line' id='LC8157'>I and my two girls should count for our three captive sons, but</div><div class='line' id='LC8158'>for only two of them; so, for the lacking one were we daily fined.</div><div class='line' id='LC8159'>All this time our own crop was perishing through neglect; and so</div><div class='line' id='LC8160'>both the priest and his lordship fined us because their shares</div><div class='line' id='LC8161'>of it were suffering through damage.  In the end the fines ate up</div><div class='line' id='LC8162'>our crop--and they took it all; they took it all and made us harvest</div><div class='line' id='LC8163'>it for them, without pay or food, and we starving.  Then the worst</div><div class='line' id='LC8164'>came when I, being out of my mind with hunger and loss of my boys,</div><div class='line' id='LC8165'>and grief to see my husband and my little maids in rags and misery</div><div class='line' id='LC8166'>and despair, uttered a deep blasphemy--oh! a thousand of them!</div><div class='line' id='LC8167'>--against the Church and the Church&#39;s ways.  It was ten days ago.</div><div class='line' id='LC8168'>I had fallen sick with this disease, and it was to the priest</div><div class='line' id='LC8169'>I said the words, for he was come to chide me for lack of due</div><div class='line' id='LC8170'>humility under the chastening hand of God.  He carried my trespass</div><div class='line' id='LC8171'>to his betters; I was stubborn; wherefore, presently upon my head</div><div class='line' id='LC8172'>and upon all heads that were dear to me, fell the curse of Rome.</div><div class='line' id='LC8173'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8174'>&quot;Since that day we are avoided, shunned with horror.  None has</div><div class='line' id='LC8175'>come near this hut to know whether we live or not.  The rest of us</div><div class='line' id='LC8176'>were taken down.  Then I roused me and got up, as wife and mother</div><div class='line' id='LC8177'>will.  It was little they could have eaten in any case; it was</div><div class='line' id='LC8178'>less than little they had to eat.  But there was water, and I gave</div><div class='line' id='LC8179'>them that.  How they craved it! and how they blessed it!  But the</div><div class='line' id='LC8180'>end came yesterday; my strength broke down.  Yesterday was the</div><div class='line' id='LC8181'>last time I ever saw my husband and this youngest child alive.</div><div class='line' id='LC8182'>I have lain here all these hours--these ages, ye may say--listening,</div><div class='line' id='LC8183'>listening for any sound up there that--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8184'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8185'>She gave a sharp quick glance at her eldest daughter, then cried</div><div class='line' id='LC8186'>out, &quot;Oh, my darling!&quot; and feebly gathered the stiffening form</div><div class='line' id='LC8187'>to her sheltering arms.  She had recognized the death-rattle.</div><div class='line' id='LC8188'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8189'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8190'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8191'>CHAPTER XXX</div><div class='line' id='LC8192'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8193'>THE TRAGEDY OF THE MANOR-HOUSE</div><div class='line' id='LC8194'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8195'>At midnight all was over, and we sat in the presence of four</div><div class='line' id='LC8196'>corpses.  We covered them with such rags as we could find, and</div><div class='line' id='LC8197'>started away, fastening the door behind us.  Their home must be</div><div class='line' id='LC8198'>these people&#39;s grave, for they could not have Christian burial,</div><div class='line' id='LC8199'>or be admitted to consecrated ground.  They were as dogs, wild</div><div class='line' id='LC8200'>beasts, lepers, and no soul that valued its hope of eternal life</div><div class='line' id='LC8201'>would throw it away by meddling in any sort with these rebuked and</div><div class='line' id='LC8202'>smitten outcasts.</div><div class='line' id='LC8203'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8204'>We had not moved four steps when I caught a sound as of footsteps</div><div class='line' id='LC8205'>upon gravel.  My heart flew to my throat.  We must not be seen</div><div class='line' id='LC8206'>coming from that house.  I plucked at the king&#39;s robe and we drew</div><div class='line' id='LC8207'>back and took shelter behind the corner of the cabin.</div><div class='line' id='LC8208'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8209'>&quot;Now we are safe,&quot; I said, &quot;but it was a close call--so to speak.</div><div class='line' id='LC8210'>If the night had been lighter he might have seen us, no doubt,</div><div class='line' id='LC8211'>he seemed to be so near.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8212'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8213'>&quot;Mayhap it is but a beast and not a man at all.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8214'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8215'>&quot;True.  But man or beast, it will be wise to stay here a minute</div><div class='line' id='LC8216'>and let it get by and out of the way.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8217'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8218'>&quot;Hark!  It cometh hither.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8219'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8220'>True again.  The step was coming toward us--straight toward the hut.</div><div class='line' id='LC8221'>It must be a beast, then, and we might as well have saved our</div><div class='line' id='LC8222'>trepidation.  I was going to step out, but the king laid his hand</div><div class='line' id='LC8223'>upon my arm.  There was a moment of silence, then we heard a soft</div><div class='line' id='LC8224'>knock on the cabin door.  It made me shiver.  Presently the knock</div><div class='line' id='LC8225'>was repeated, and then we heard these words in a guarded voice:</div><div class='line' id='LC8226'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8227'>&quot;Mother!  Father!  Open--we have got free, and we bring news to</div><div class='line' id='LC8228'>pale your cheeks but glad your hearts; and we may not tarry, but</div><div class='line' id='LC8229'>must fly!  And--but they answer not.  Mother! father!--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8230'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8231'>I drew the king toward the other end of the hut and whispered:</div><div class='line' id='LC8232'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8233'>&quot;Come--now we can get to the road.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8234'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8235'>The king hesitated, was going to demur; but just then we heard</div><div class='line' id='LC8236'>the door give way, and knew that those desolate men were in the</div><div class='line' id='LC8237'>presence of their dead.</div><div class='line' id='LC8238'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8239'>&quot;Come, my liege! in a moment they will strike a light, and then</div><div class='line' id='LC8240'>will follow that which it would break your heart to hear.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8241'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8242'>He did not hesitate this time.  The moment we were in the road</div><div class='line' id='LC8243'>I ran; and after a moment he threw dignity aside and followed.</div><div class='line' id='LC8244'>I did not want to think of what was happening in the hut--I couldn&#39;t</div><div class='line' id='LC8245'>bear it; I wanted to drive it out of my mind; so I struck into the</div><div class='line' id='LC8246'>first subject that lay under that one in my mind:</div><div class='line' id='LC8247'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8248'>&quot;I have had the disease those people died of, and so have nothing</div><div class='line' id='LC8249'>to fear; but if you have not had it also--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8250'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8251'>He broke in upon me to say he was in trouble, and it was his</div><div class='line' id='LC8252'>conscience that was troubling him:</div><div class='line' id='LC8253'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8254'>&quot;These young men have got free, they say--but _how_?  It is not</div><div class='line' id='LC8255'>likely that their lord hath set them free.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8256'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8257'>&quot;Oh, no, I make no doubt they escaped.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8258'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8259'>&quot;That is my trouble; I have a fear that this is so, and your</div><div class='line' id='LC8260'>suspicion doth confirm it, you having the same fear.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8261'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8262'>&quot;I should not call it by that name though.  I do suspect that they</div><div class='line' id='LC8263'>escaped, but if they did, I am not sorry, certainly.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8264'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8265'>&quot;I am not sorry, I _think_--but--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8266'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8267'>&quot;What is it?  What is there for one to be troubled about?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8268'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8269'>&quot;_If_ they did escape, then are we bound in duty to lay hands upon</div><div class='line' id='LC8270'>them and deliver them again to their lord; for it is not seemly</div><div class='line' id='LC8271'>that one of his quality should suffer a so insolent and high-handed</div><div class='line' id='LC8272'>outrage from persons of their base degree.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8273'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8274'>There it was again.  He could see only one side of it.  He was</div><div class='line' id='LC8275'>born so, educated so, his veins were full of ancestral blood that</div><div class='line' id='LC8276'>was rotten with this sort of unconscious brutality, brought down</div><div class='line' id='LC8277'>by inheritance from a long procession of hearts that had each done</div><div class='line' id='LC8278'>its share toward poisoning the stream.  To imprison these men</div><div class='line' id='LC8279'>without proof, and starve their kindred, was no harm, for they were</div><div class='line' id='LC8280'>merely peasants and subject to the will and pleasure of their lord,</div><div class='line' id='LC8281'>no matter what fearful form it might take; but for these men to</div><div class='line' id='LC8282'>break out of unjust captivity was insult and outrage, and a thing</div><div class='line' id='LC8283'>not to be countenanced by any conscientious person who knew his</div><div class='line' id='LC8284'>duty to his sacred caste.</div><div class='line' id='LC8285'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8286'>I worked more than half an hour before I got him to change the</div><div class='line' id='LC8287'>subject--and even then an outside matter did it for me.  This was</div><div class='line' id='LC8288'>a something which caught our eyes as we struck the summit of a</div><div class='line' id='LC8289'>small hill--a red glow, a good way off.</div><div class='line' id='LC8290'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8291'>&quot;That&#39;s a fire,&quot; said I.</div><div class='line' id='LC8292'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8293'>Fires interested me considerably, because I was getting a good</div><div class='line' id='LC8294'>deal of an insurance business started, and was also training some</div><div class='line' id='LC8295'>horses and building some steam fire-engines, with an eye to a paid</div><div class='line' id='LC8296'>fire department by and by.  The priests opposed both my fire and</div><div class='line' id='LC8297'>life insurance, on the ground that it was an insolent attempt to</div><div class='line' id='LC8298'>hinder the decrees of God; and if you pointed out that they did not</div><div class='line' id='LC8299'>hinder the decrees in the least, but only modified the hard</div><div class='line' id='LC8300'>consequences of them if you took out policies and had luck, they</div><div class='line' id='LC8301'>retorted that that was gambling against the decrees of God, and was</div><div class='line' id='LC8302'>just as bad.  So they managed to damage those industries more</div><div class='line' id='LC8303'>or less, but I got even on my accident business.  As a rule, a knight</div><div class='line' id='LC8304'>is a lummux, and some times even a labrick, and hence open to pretty</div><div class='line' id='LC8305'>poor arguments when they come glibly from a superstition-monger,</div><div class='line' id='LC8306'>but even _he_ could see the practical side of a thing once in a while;</div><div class='line' id='LC8307'>and so of late you couldn&#39;t clean up a tournament and pile the</div><div class='line' id='LC8308'>result without finding one of my accident-tickets in every helmet.</div><div class='line' id='LC8309'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8310'>We stood there awhile, in the thick darkness and stillness, looking</div><div class='line' id='LC8311'>toward the red blur in the distance, and trying to make out the</div><div class='line' id='LC8312'>meaning of a far-away murmur that rose and fell fitfully on the</div><div class='line' id='LC8313'>night.  Sometimes it swelled up and for a moment seemed less</div><div class='line' id='LC8314'>remote; but when we were hopefully expecting it to betray its cause</div><div class='line' id='LC8315'>and nature, it dulled and sank again, carrying its mystery with it.</div><div class='line' id='LC8316'>We started down the hill in its direction, and the winding road</div><div class='line' id='LC8317'>plunged us at once into almost solid darkness--darkness that was</div><div class='line' id='LC8318'>packed and crammed in between two tall forest walls.  We groped</div><div class='line' id='LC8319'>along down for half a mile, perhaps, that murmur growing more and</div><div class='line' id='LC8320'>more distinct all the time.  The coming storm threatening more and</div><div class='line' id='LC8321'>more, with now and then a little shiver of wind, a faint show of</div><div class='line' id='LC8322'>lightning, and dull grumblings of distant thunder.  I was in the</div><div class='line' id='LC8323'>lead.  I ran against something--a soft heavy something which gave,</div><div class='line' id='LC8324'>slightly, to the impulse of my weight; at the same moment the</div><div class='line' id='LC8325'>lightning glared out, and within a foot of my face was the writhing</div><div class='line' id='LC8326'>face of a man who was hanging from the limb of a tree!  That is,</div><div class='line' id='LC8327'>it seemed to be writhing, but it was not.  It was a grewsome sight.</div><div class='line' id='LC8328'>Straightway there was an ear-splitting explosion of thunder, and</div><div class='line' id='LC8329'>the bottom of heaven fell out; the rain poured down in a deluge.</div><div class='line' id='LC8330'>No matter, we must try to cut this man down, on the chance that</div><div class='line' id='LC8331'>there might be life in him yet, mustn&#39;t we?  The lightning came</div><div class='line' id='LC8332'>quick and sharp now, and the place was alternately noonday and</div><div class='line' id='LC8333'>midnight.  One moment the man would be hanging before me in an</div><div class='line' id='LC8334'>intense light, and the next he was blotted out again in the darkness.</div><div class='line' id='LC8335'>I told the king we must cut him down.  The king at once objected.</div><div class='line' id='LC8336'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8337'>&quot;If he hanged himself, he was willing to lose him property to</div><div class='line' id='LC8338'>his lord; so let him be.  If others hanged him, belike they had</div><div class='line' id='LC8339'>the right--let him hang.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8340'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8341'>&quot;But--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8342'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8343'>&quot;But me no buts, but even leave him as he is.  And for yet another</div><div class='line' id='LC8344'>reason.  When the lightning cometh again--there, look abroad.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8345'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8346'>Two others hanging, within fifty yards of us!</div><div class='line' id='LC8347'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8348'>&quot;It is not weather meet for doing useless courtesies unto dead folk.</div><div class='line' id='LC8349'>They are past thanking you.  Come--it is unprofitable to tarry here.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8350'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8351'>There was reason in what he said, so we moved on.  Within the next</div><div class='line' id='LC8352'>mile we counted six more hanging forms by the blaze of the lightning,</div><div class='line' id='LC8353'>and altogether it was a grisly excursion.  That murmur was a murmur</div><div class='line' id='LC8354'>no longer, it was a roar; a roar of men&#39;s voices.  A man came flying</div><div class='line' id='LC8355'>by now, dimly through the darkness, and other men chasing him.</div><div class='line' id='LC8356'>They disappeared.  Presently another case of the kind occurred,</div><div class='line' id='LC8357'>and then another and another.  Then a sudden turn of the road</div><div class='line' id='LC8358'>brought us in sight of that fire--it was a large manor-house, and</div><div class='line' id='LC8359'>little or nothing was left of it--and everywhere men were flying</div><div class='line' id='LC8360'>and other men raging after them in pursuit.</div><div class='line' id='LC8361'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8362'>I warned the king that this was not a safe place for strangers.</div><div class='line' id='LC8363'>We would better get away from the light, until matters should</div><div class='line' id='LC8364'>improve.  We stepped back a little, and hid in the edge of the</div><div class='line' id='LC8365'>wood.  From this hiding-place we saw both men and women hunted</div><div class='line' id='LC8366'>by the mob.  The fearful work went on until nearly dawn.  Then,</div><div class='line' id='LC8367'>the fire being out and the storm spent, the voices and flying</div><div class='line' id='LC8368'>footsteps presently ceased, and darkness and stillness reigned again.</div><div class='line' id='LC8369'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8370'>We ventured out, and hurried cautiously away; and although we were</div><div class='line' id='LC8371'>worn out and sleepy, we kept on until we had put this place some</div><div class='line' id='LC8372'>miles behind us.  Then we asked hospitality at the hut of a charcoal</div><div class='line' id='LC8373'>burner, and got what was to be had.  A woman was up and about, but</div><div class='line' id='LC8374'>the man was still asleep, on a straw shake-down, on the clay floor.</div><div class='line' id='LC8375'>The woman seemed uneasy until I explained that we were travelers</div><div class='line' id='LC8376'>and had lost our way and been wandering in the woods all night.</div><div class='line' id='LC8377'>She became talkative, then, and asked if we had heard of the</div><div class='line' id='LC8378'>terrible goings-on at the manor-house of Abblasoure.  Yes, we had</div><div class='line' id='LC8379'>heard of them, but what we wanted now was rest and sleep.  The</div><div class='line' id='LC8380'>king broke in:</div><div class='line' id='LC8381'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8382'>&quot;Sell us the house and take yourselves away, for we be perilous</div><div class='line' id='LC8383'>company, being late come from people that died of the Spotted Death.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8384'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8385'>It was good of him, but unnecessary.  One of the commonest decorations</div><div class='line' id='LC8386'>of the nation was the waffle-iron face.  I had early noticed that</div><div class='line' id='LC8387'>the woman and her husband were both so decorated.  She made us</div><div class='line' id='LC8388'>entirely welcome, and had no fears; and plainly she was immensely</div><div class='line' id='LC8389'>impressed by the king&#39;s proposition; for, of course, it was a good</div><div class='line' id='LC8390'>deal of an event in her life to run across a person of the king&#39;s</div><div class='line' id='LC8391'>humble appearance who was ready to buy a man&#39;s house for the sake</div><div class='line' id='LC8392'>of a night&#39;s lodging.  It gave her a large respect for us, and she</div><div class='line' id='LC8393'>strained the lean possibilities of her hovel to the utmost to make</div><div class='line' id='LC8394'>us comfortable.</div><div class='line' id='LC8395'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8396'>We slept till far into the afternoon, and then got up hungry enough to</div><div class='line' id='LC8397'>make cotter fare quite palatable to the king, the more particularly</div><div class='line' id='LC8398'>as it was scant in quantity.  And also in variety; it consisted</div><div class='line' id='LC8399'>solely of onions, salt, and the national black bread made out of</div><div class='line' id='LC8400'>horse-feed.  The woman told us about the affair of the evening</div><div class='line' id='LC8401'>before.  At ten or eleven at night, when everybody was in bed,</div><div class='line' id='LC8402'>the manor-house burst into flames.  The country-side swarmed to</div><div class='line' id='LC8403'>the rescue, and the family were saved, with one exception, the</div><div class='line' id='LC8404'>master.  He did not appear.  Everybody was frantic over this loss,</div><div class='line' id='LC8405'>and two brave yeomen sacrificed their lives in ransacking the</div><div class='line' id='LC8406'>burning house seeking that valuable personage.  But after a while</div><div class='line' id='LC8407'>he was found--what was left of him--which was his corpse.  It was</div><div class='line' id='LC8408'>in a copse three hundred yards away, bound, gagged, stabbed in a</div><div class='line' id='LC8409'>dozen places.</div><div class='line' id='LC8410'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8411'>Who had done this?  Suspicion fell upon a humble family in the</div><div class='line' id='LC8412'>neighborhood who had been lately treated with peculiar harshness</div><div class='line' id='LC8413'>by the baron; and from these people the suspicion easily extended</div><div class='line' id='LC8414'>itself to their relatives and familiars.  A suspicion was enough;</div><div class='line' id='LC8415'>my lord&#39;s liveried retainers proclaimed an instant crusade against</div><div class='line' id='LC8416'>these people, and were promptly joined by the community in general.</div><div class='line' id='LC8417'>The woman&#39;s husband had been active with the mob, and had not</div><div class='line' id='LC8418'>returned home until nearly dawn.  He was gone now to find out</div><div class='line' id='LC8419'>what the general result had been.  While we were still talking he</div><div class='line' id='LC8420'>came back from his quest.  His report was revolting enough.  Eighteen</div><div class='line' id='LC8421'>persons hanged or butchered, and two yeomen and thirteen prisoners</div><div class='line' id='LC8422'>lost in the fire.</div><div class='line' id='LC8423'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8424'>&quot;And how many prisoners were there altogether in the vaults?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8425'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8426'>&quot;Thirteen.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8427'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8428'>&quot;Then every one of them was lost?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8429'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8430'>&quot;Yes, all.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8431'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8432'>&quot;But the people arrived in time to save the family; how is it they</div><div class='line' id='LC8433'>could save none of the prisoners?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8434'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8435'>The man looked puzzled, and said:</div><div class='line' id='LC8436'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8437'>&quot;Would one unlock the vaults at such a time?  Marry, some would</div><div class='line' id='LC8438'>have escaped.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8439'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8440'>&quot;Then you mean that nobody _did_ unlock them?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8441'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8442'>&quot;None went near them, either to lock or unlock.  It standeth to</div><div class='line' id='LC8443'>reason that the bolts were fast; wherefore it was only needful</div><div class='line' id='LC8444'>to establish a watch, so that if any broke the bonds he might not</div><div class='line' id='LC8445'>escape, but be taken. None were taken.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8446'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8447'>&quot;Natheless, three did escape,&quot; said the king, &quot;and ye will do well</div><div class='line' id='LC8448'>to publish it and set justice upon their track, for these murthered</div><div class='line' id='LC8449'>the baron and fired the house.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8450'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8451'>I was just expecting he would come out with that.  For a moment</div><div class='line' id='LC8452'>the man and his wife showed an eager interest in this news and</div><div class='line' id='LC8453'>an impatience to go out and spread it; then a sudden something</div><div class='line' id='LC8454'>else betrayed itself in their faces, and they began to ask questions.</div><div class='line' id='LC8455'>I answered the questions myself, and narrowly watched the effects</div><div class='line' id='LC8456'>produced.  I was soon satisfied that the knowledge of who these</div><div class='line' id='LC8457'>three prisoners were had somehow changed the atmosphere; that</div><div class='line' id='LC8458'>our hosts&#39; continued eagerness to go and spread the news was now</div><div class='line' id='LC8459'>only pretended and not real.  The king did not notice the change,</div><div class='line' id='LC8460'>and I was glad of that.  I worked the conversation around toward</div><div class='line' id='LC8461'>other details of the night&#39;s proceedings, and noted that these</div><div class='line' id='LC8462'>people were relieved to have it take that direction.</div><div class='line' id='LC8463'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8464'>The painful thing observable about all this business was the</div><div class='line' id='LC8465'>alacrity with which this oppressed community had turned their</div><div class='line' id='LC8466'>cruel hands against their own class in the interest of the common</div><div class='line' id='LC8467'>oppressor.  This man and woman seemed to feel that in a quarrel</div><div class='line' id='LC8468'>between a person of their own class and his lord, it was the natural</div><div class='line' id='LC8469'>and proper and rightful thing for that poor devil&#39;s whole caste</div><div class='line' id='LC8470'>to side with the master and fight his battle for him, without ever</div><div class='line' id='LC8471'>stopping to inquire into the rights or wrongs of the matter.  This</div><div class='line' id='LC8472'>man had been out helping to hang his neighbors, and had done his</div><div class='line' id='LC8473'>work with zeal, and yet was aware that there was nothing against</div><div class='line' id='LC8474'>them but a mere suspicion, with nothing back of it describable</div><div class='line' id='LC8475'>as evidence, still neither he nor his wife seemed to see anything</div><div class='line' id='LC8476'>horrible about it.</div><div class='line' id='LC8477'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8478'>This was depressing--to a man with the dream of a republic in his</div><div class='line' id='LC8479'>head.  It reminded me of a time thirteen centuries away, when</div><div class='line' id='LC8480'>the &quot;poor whites&quot; of our South who were always despised and</div><div class='line' id='LC8481'>frequently insulted by the slave-lords around them, and who owed</div><div class='line' id='LC8482'>their base condition simply to the presence of slavery in their</div><div class='line' id='LC8483'>midst, were yet pusillanimously ready to side with the slave-lords</div><div class='line' id='LC8484'>in all political moves for the upholding and perpetuating of</div><div class='line' id='LC8485'>slavery, and did also finally shoulder their muskets and pour out</div><div class='line' id='LC8486'>their lives in an effort to prevent the destruction of that very</div><div class='line' id='LC8487'>institution which degraded them.  And there was only one redeeming</div><div class='line' id='LC8488'>feature connected with that pitiful piece of history; and that was,</div><div class='line' id='LC8489'>that secretly the &quot;poor white&quot; did detest the slave-lord, and did</div><div class='line' id='LC8490'>feel his own shame.  That feeling was not brought to the surface,</div><div class='line' id='LC8491'>but the fact that it was there and could have been brought out,</div><div class='line' id='LC8492'>under favoring circumstances, was something--in fact, it was enough;</div><div class='line' id='LC8493'>for it showed that a man is at bottom a man, after all, even if it</div><div class='line' id='LC8494'>doesn&#39;t show on the outside.</div><div class='line' id='LC8495'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8496'>Well, as it turned out, this charcoal burner was just the twin of</div><div class='line' id='LC8497'>the Southern &quot;poor white&quot; of the far future.  The king presently</div><div class='line' id='LC8498'>showed impatience, and said:</div><div class='line' id='LC8499'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8500'>&quot;An ye prattle here all the day, justice will miscarry.  Think ye</div><div class='line' id='LC8501'>the criminals will abide in their father&#39;s house?  They are fleeing,</div><div class='line' id='LC8502'>they are not waiting.  You should look to it that a party of horse</div><div class='line' id='LC8503'>be set upon their track.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8504'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8505'>The woman paled slightly, but quite perceptibly, and the man looked</div><div class='line' id='LC8506'>flustered and irresolute.  I said:</div><div class='line' id='LC8507'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8508'>&quot;Come, friend, I will walk a little way with you, and explain which</div><div class='line' id='LC8509'>direction I think they would try to take.  If they were merely</div><div class='line' id='LC8510'>resisters of the gabelle or some kindred absurdity I would try</div><div class='line' id='LC8511'>to protect them from capture; but when men murder a person of</div><div class='line' id='LC8512'>high degree and likewise burn his house, that is another matter.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8513'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8514'>The last remark was for the king--to quiet him.  On the road</div><div class='line' id='LC8515'>the man pulled his resolution together, and began the march with</div><div class='line' id='LC8516'>a steady gait, but there was no eagerness in it.  By and by I said:</div><div class='line' id='LC8517'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8518'>&quot;What relation were these men to you--cousins?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8519'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8520'>He turned as white as his layer of charcoal would let him, and</div><div class='line' id='LC8521'>stopped, trembling.</div><div class='line' id='LC8522'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8523'>&quot;Ah, my God, how know ye that?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8524'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8525'>&quot;I didn&#39;t know it; it was a chance guess.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8526'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8527'>&quot;Poor lads, they are lost.  And good lads they were, too.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8528'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8529'>&quot;Were you actually going yonder to tell on them?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8530'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8531'>He didn&#39;t quite know how to take that; but he said, hesitatingly:</div><div class='line' id='LC8532'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8533'>&quot;Ye-s.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8534'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8535'>&quot;Then I think you are a damned scoundrel!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8536'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8537'>It made him as glad as if I had called him an angel.</div><div class='line' id='LC8538'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8539'>&quot;Say the good words again, brother! for surely ye mean that ye</div><div class='line' id='LC8540'>would not betray me an I failed of my duty.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8541'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8542'>&quot;Duty?  There is no duty in the matter, except the duty to keep</div><div class='line' id='LC8543'>still and let those men get away.  They&#39;ve done a righteous deed.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8544'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8545'>He looked pleased; pleased, and touched with apprehension at the</div><div class='line' id='LC8546'>same time.  He looked up and down the road to see that no one</div><div class='line' id='LC8547'>was coming, and then said in a cautious voice:</div><div class='line' id='LC8548'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8549'>&quot;From what land come you, brother, that you speak such perilous</div><div class='line' id='LC8550'>words, and seem not to be afraid?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8551'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8552'>&quot;They are not perilous words when spoken to one of my own caste,</div><div class='line' id='LC8553'>I take it.  You would not tell anybody I said them?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8554'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8555'>&quot;I?  I would be drawn asunder by wild horses first.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8556'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8557'>&quot;Well, then, let me say my say.  I have no fears of your repeating</div><div class='line' id='LC8558'>it.  I think devil&#39;s work has been done last night upon those</div><div class='line' id='LC8559'>innocent poor people.  That old baron got only what he deserved.</div><div class='line' id='LC8560'>If I had my way, all his kind should have the same luck.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8561'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8562'>Fear and depression vanished from the man&#39;s manner, and gratefulness</div><div class='line' id='LC8563'>and a brave animation took their place:</div><div class='line' id='LC8564'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8565'>&quot;Even though you be a spy, and your words a trap for my undoing,</div><div class='line' id='LC8566'>yet are they such refreshment that to hear them again and others</div><div class='line' id='LC8567'>like to them, I would go to the gallows happy, as having had one</div><div class='line' id='LC8568'>good feast at least in a starved life.  And I will say my say now,</div><div class='line' id='LC8569'>and ye may report it if ye be so minded.  I helped to hang my</div><div class='line' id='LC8570'>neighbors for that it were peril to my own life to show lack of</div><div class='line' id='LC8571'>zeal in the master&#39;s cause; the others helped for none other reason.</div><div class='line' id='LC8572'>All rejoice to-day that he is dead, but all do go about seemingly</div><div class='line' id='LC8573'>sorrowing, and shedding the hypocrite&#39;s tear, for in that lies</div><div class='line' id='LC8574'>safety.  I have said the words, I have said the words! the only</div><div class='line' id='LC8575'>ones that have ever tasted good in my mouth, and the reward of</div><div class='line' id='LC8576'>that taste is sufficient.  Lead on, an ye will, be it even to the</div><div class='line' id='LC8577'>scaffold, for I am ready.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8578'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8579'>There it was, you see.  A man is a man, at bottom.  Whole ages</div><div class='line' id='LC8580'>of abuse and oppression cannot crush the manhood clear out of him.</div><div class='line' id='LC8581'>Whoever thinks it a mistake is himself mistaken.  Yes, there is</div><div class='line' id='LC8582'>plenty good enough material for a republic in the most degraded</div><div class='line' id='LC8583'>people that ever existed--even the Russians; plenty of manhood</div><div class='line' id='LC8584'>in them--even in the Germans--if one could but force it out of</div><div class='line' id='LC8585'>its timid and suspicious privacy, to overthrow and trample in the</div><div class='line' id='LC8586'>mud any throne that ever was set up and any nobility that ever</div><div class='line' id='LC8587'>supported it.  We should see certain things yet, let us hope and</div><div class='line' id='LC8588'>believe.  First, a modified monarchy, till Arthur&#39;s days were done,</div><div class='line' id='LC8589'>then the destruction of the throne, nobility abolished, every</div><div class='line' id='LC8590'>member of it bound out to some useful trade, universal suffrage</div><div class='line' id='LC8591'>instituted, and the whole government placed in the hands of the</div><div class='line' id='LC8592'>men and women of the nation there to remain.  Yes, there was no</div><div class='line' id='LC8593'>occasion to give up my dream yet a while.</div><div class='line' id='LC8594'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8595'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8596'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8597'>CHAPTER XXXI</div><div class='line' id='LC8598'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8599'>MARCO</div><div class='line' id='LC8600'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8601'>We strolled along in a sufficiently indolent fashion now, and</div><div class='line' id='LC8602'>talked.  We must dispose of about the amount of time it ought</div><div class='line' id='LC8603'>to take to go to the little hamlet of Abblasoure and put justice</div><div class='line' id='LC8604'>on the track of those murderers and get back home again.  And</div><div class='line' id='LC8605'>meantime I had an auxiliary interest which had never paled yet,</div><div class='line' id='LC8606'>never lost its novelty for me since I had been in Arthur&#39;s kingdom:</div><div class='line' id='LC8607'>the behavior--born of nice and exact subdivisions of caste--of chance</div><div class='line' id='LC8608'>passers-by toward each other.  Toward the shaven monk who trudged</div><div class='line' id='LC8609'>along with his cowl tilted back and the sweat washing down his</div><div class='line' id='LC8610'>fat jowls, the coal-burner was deeply reverent; to the gentleman</div><div class='line' id='LC8611'>he was abject; with the small farmer and the free mechanic he was</div><div class='line' id='LC8612'>cordial and gossipy; and when a slave passed by with a countenance</div><div class='line' id='LC8613'>respectfully lowered, this chap&#39;s nose was in the air--he couldn&#39;t</div><div class='line' id='LC8614'>even see him.  Well, there are times when one would like to hang</div><div class='line' id='LC8615'>the whole human race and finish the farce.</div><div class='line' id='LC8616'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8617'>Presently we struck an incident.  A small mob of half-naked boys</div><div class='line' id='LC8618'>and girls came tearing out of the woods, scared and shrieking.</div><div class='line' id='LC8619'>The eldest among them were not more than twelve or fourteen years</div><div class='line' id='LC8620'>old.  They implored help, but they were so beside themselves that</div><div class='line' id='LC8621'>we couldn&#39;t make out what the matter was.  However, we plunged</div><div class='line' id='LC8622'>into the wood, they skurrying in the lead, and the trouble was</div><div class='line' id='LC8623'>quickly revealed: they had hanged a little fellow with a bark rope,</div><div class='line' id='LC8624'>and he was kicking and struggling, in the process of choking to</div><div class='line' id='LC8625'>death.  We rescued him, and fetched him around.  It was some more</div><div class='line' id='LC8626'>human nature; the admiring little folk imitating their elders;</div><div class='line' id='LC8627'>they were playing mob, and had achieved a success which promised</div><div class='line' id='LC8628'>to be a good deal more serious than they had bargained for.</div><div class='line' id='LC8629'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8630'>It was not a dull excursion for me.  I managed to put in the time</div><div class='line' id='LC8631'>very well.  I made various acquaintanceships, and in my quality</div><div class='line' id='LC8632'>of stranger was able to ask as many questions as I wanted to.</div><div class='line' id='LC8633'>A thing which naturally interested me, as a statesman, was the</div><div class='line' id='LC8634'>matter of wages.  I picked up what I could under that head during</div><div class='line' id='LC8635'>the afternoon.  A man who hasn&#39;t had much experience, and doesn&#39;t</div><div class='line' id='LC8636'>think, is apt to measure a nation&#39;s prosperity or lack of prosperity</div><div class='line' id='LC8637'>by the mere size of the prevailing wages; if the wages be high, the</div><div class='line' id='LC8638'>nation is prosperous; if low, it isn&#39;t.  Which is an error.  It</div><div class='line' id='LC8639'>isn&#39;t what sum you get, it&#39;s how much you can buy with it, that&#39;s</div><div class='line' id='LC8640'>the important thing; and it&#39;s that that tells whether your wages</div><div class='line' id='LC8641'>are high in fact or only high in name.  I could remember how it</div><div class='line' id='LC8642'>was in the time of our great civil war in the nineteenth century.</div><div class='line' id='LC8643'>In the North a carpenter got three dollars a day, gold valuation;</div><div class='line' id='LC8644'>in the South he got fifty--payable in Confederate shinplasters</div><div class='line' id='LC8645'>worth a dollar a bushel.  In the North a suit of overalls cost</div><div class='line' id='LC8646'>three dollars--a day&#39;s wages; in the South it cost seventy-five</div><div class='line' id='LC8647'>--which was two days&#39; wages.  Other things were in proportion.</div><div class='line' id='LC8648'>Consequently, wages were twice as high in the North as they were</div><div class='line' id='LC8649'>in the South, because the one wage had that much more purchasing</div><div class='line' id='LC8650'>power than the other had.</div><div class='line' id='LC8651'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8652'>Yes, I made various acquaintances in the hamlet and a thing that</div><div class='line' id='LC8653'>gratified me a good deal was to find our new coins in circulation</div><div class='line' id='LC8654'>--lots of milrays, lots of mills, lots of cents, a good many nickels,</div><div class='line' id='LC8655'>and some silver; all this among the artisans and commonalty</div><div class='line' id='LC8656'>generally; yes, and even some gold--but that was at the bank,</div><div class='line' id='LC8657'>that is to say, the goldsmith&#39;s.  I dropped in there while Marco,</div><div class='line' id='LC8658'>the son of Marco, was haggling with a shopkeeper over a quarter</div><div class='line' id='LC8659'>of a pound of salt, and asked for change for a twenty-dollar gold</div><div class='line' id='LC8660'>piece.  They furnished it--that is, after they had chewed the piece,</div><div class='line' id='LC8661'>and rung it on the counter, and tried acid on it, and asked me</div><div class='line' id='LC8662'>where I got it, and who I was, and where I was from, and where</div><div class='line' id='LC8663'>I was going to, and when I expected to get there, and perhaps</div><div class='line' id='LC8664'>a couple of hundred more questions; and when they got aground,</div><div class='line' id='LC8665'>I went right on and furnished them a lot of information voluntarily;</div><div class='line' id='LC8666'>told them I owned a dog, and his name was Watch, and my first wife</div><div class='line' id='LC8667'>was a Free Will Baptist, and her grandfather was a Prohibitionist,</div><div class='line' id='LC8668'>and I used to know a man who had two thumbs on each hand and a wart</div><div class='line' id='LC8669'>on the inside of his upper lip, and died in the hope of a glorious</div><div class='line' id='LC8670'>resurrection, and so on, and so on, and so on, till even that</div><div class='line' id='LC8671'>hungry village questioner began to look satisfied, and also a shade</div><div class='line' id='LC8672'>put out; but he had to respect a man of my financial strength,</div><div class='line' id='LC8673'>and so he didn&#39;t give me any lip, but I noticed he took it out of</div><div class='line' id='LC8674'>his underlings, which was a perfectly natural thing to do.  Yes,</div><div class='line' id='LC8675'>they changed my twenty, but I judged it strained the bank a little,</div><div class='line' id='LC8676'>which was a thing to be expected, for it was the same as walking</div><div class='line' id='LC8677'>into a paltry village store in the nineteenth century and requiring</div><div class='line' id='LC8678'>the boss of it to change a two thousand-dollar bill for you all</div><div class='line' id='LC8679'>of a sudden.  He could do it, maybe; but at the same time he</div><div class='line' id='LC8680'>would wonder how a small farmer happened to be carrying so much</div><div class='line' id='LC8681'>money around in his pocket; which was probably this goldsmith&#39;s</div><div class='line' id='LC8682'>thought, too; for he followed me to the door and stood there gazing</div><div class='line' id='LC8683'>after me with reverent admiration.</div><div class='line' id='LC8684'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8685'>Our new money was not only handsomely circulating, but its language</div><div class='line' id='LC8686'>was already glibly in use; that is to say, people had dropped</div><div class='line' id='LC8687'>the names of the former moneys, and spoke of things as being worth</div><div class='line' id='LC8688'>so many dollars or cents or mills or milrays now.  It was very</div><div class='line' id='LC8689'>gratifying.  We were progressing, that was sure.</div><div class='line' id='LC8690'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8691'>I got to know several master mechanics, but about the most interesting</div><div class='line' id='LC8692'>fellow among them was the blacksmith, Dowley.  He was a live man</div><div class='line' id='LC8693'>and a brisk talker, and had two journeymen and three apprentices,</div><div class='line' id='LC8694'>and was doing a raging business.  In fact, he was getting rich,</div><div class='line' id='LC8695'>hand over fist, and was vastly respected.  Marco was very proud of</div><div class='line' id='LC8696'>having such a man for a friend.  He had taken me there ostensibly</div><div class='line' id='LC8697'>to let me see the big establishment which bought so much of his</div><div class='line' id='LC8698'>charcoal, but really to let me see what easy and almost familiar</div><div class='line' id='LC8699'>terms he was on with this great man.  Dowley and I fraternized</div><div class='line' id='LC8700'>at once; I had had just such picked men, splendid fellows, under</div><div class='line' id='LC8701'>me in the Colt Arms Factory.  I was bound to see more of him, so</div><div class='line' id='LC8702'>I invited him to come out to Marco&#39;s Sunday, and dine with us.</div><div class='line' id='LC8703'>Marco was appalled, and held his breath; and when the grandee</div><div class='line' id='LC8704'>accepted, he was so grateful that he almost forgot to be astonished</div><div class='line' id='LC8705'>at the condescension.</div><div class='line' id='LC8706'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8707'>Marco&#39;s joy was exuberant--but only for a moment; then he grew</div><div class='line' id='LC8708'>thoughtful, then sad; and when he heard me tell Dowley I should</div><div class='line' id='LC8709'>have Dickon, the boss mason, and Smug, the boss wheelwright, out</div><div class='line' id='LC8710'>there, too, the coal-dust on his face turned to chalk, and he lost</div><div class='line' id='LC8711'>his grip.  But I knew what was the matter with him; it was the</div><div class='line' id='LC8712'>expense.  He saw ruin before him; he judged that his financial</div><div class='line' id='LC8713'>days were numbered.  However, on our way to invite the others,</div><div class='line' id='LC8714'>I said:</div><div class='line' id='LC8715'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8716'>&quot;You must allow me to have these friends come; and you must also</div><div class='line' id='LC8717'>allow me to pay the costs.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8718'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8719'>His face cleared, and he said with spirit:</div><div class='line' id='LC8720'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8721'>&quot;But not all of it, not all of it.  Ye cannot well bear a burden</div><div class='line' id='LC8722'>like to this alone.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8723'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8724'>I stopped him, and said:</div><div class='line' id='LC8725'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8726'>&quot;Now let&#39;s understand each other on the spot, old friend.  I am</div><div class='line' id='LC8727'>only a farm bailiff, it is true; but I am not poor, nevertheless.</div><div class='line' id='LC8728'>I have been very fortunate this year--you would be astonished</div><div class='line' id='LC8729'>to know how I have thriven.  I tell you the honest truth when I say</div><div class='line' id='LC8730'>I could squander away as many as a dozen feasts like this and never</div><div class='line' id='LC8731'>care _that_ for the expense!&quot; and I snapped my fingers.  I could</div><div class='line' id='LC8732'>see myself rise a foot at a time in Marco&#39;s estimation, and when</div><div class='line' id='LC8733'>I fetched out those last words I was become a very tower for style</div><div class='line' id='LC8734'>and altitude.  &quot;So you see, you must let me have my way.  You</div><div class='line' id='LC8735'>can&#39;t contribute a cent to this orgy, that&#39;s _settled_.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8736'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8737'>&quot;It&#39;s grand and good of you--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8738'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8739'>&quot;No, it isn&#39;t.  You&#39;ve opened your house to Jones and me in the</div><div class='line' id='LC8740'>most generous way; Jones was remarking upon it to-day, just before</div><div class='line' id='LC8741'>you came back from the village; for although he wouldn&#39;t be likely</div><div class='line' id='LC8742'>to say such a thing to you--because Jones isn&#39;t a talker, and is</div><div class='line' id='LC8743'>diffident in society--he has a good heart and a grateful, and</div><div class='line' id='LC8744'>knows how to appreciate it when he is well treated; yes, you and</div><div class='line' id='LC8745'>your wife have been very hospitable toward us--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8746'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8747'>&quot;Ah, brother, &#39;tis nothing--_such_ hospitality!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8748'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8749'>&quot;But it _is_ something; the best a man has, freely given, is always</div><div class='line' id='LC8750'>something, and is as good as a prince can do, and ranks right</div><div class='line' id='LC8751'>along beside it--for even a prince can but do his best.  And so</div><div class='line' id='LC8752'>we&#39;ll shop around and get up this layout now, and don&#39;t you worry</div><div class='line' id='LC8753'>about the expense.  I&#39;m one of the worst spendthrifts that ever</div><div class='line' id='LC8754'>was born.  Why, do you know, sometimes in a single week I spend</div><div class='line' id='LC8755'>--but never mind about that--you&#39;d never believe it anyway.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8756'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8757'>And so we went gadding along, dropping in here and there, pricing</div><div class='line' id='LC8758'>things, and gossiping with the shopkeepers about the riot, and now</div><div class='line' id='LC8759'>and then running across pathetic reminders of it, in the persons of</div><div class='line' id='LC8760'>shunned and tearful and houseless remnants of families whose homes</div><div class='line' id='LC8761'>had been taken from them and their parents butchered or hanged.</div><div class='line' id='LC8762'>The raiment of Marco and his wife was of coarse tow-linen and</div><div class='line' id='LC8763'>linsey-woolsey respectively, and resembled township maps, it being</div><div class='line' id='LC8764'>made up pretty exclusively of patches which had been added, township</div><div class='line' id='LC8765'>by township, in the course of five or six years, until hardly a</div><div class='line' id='LC8766'>hand&#39;s-breadth of the original garments was surviving and present.</div><div class='line' id='LC8767'>Now I wanted to fit these people out with new suits, on account of</div><div class='line' id='LC8768'>that swell company, and I didn&#39;t know just how to get at it</div><div class='line' id='LC8769'>--with delicacy, until at last it struck me that as I had already</div><div class='line' id='LC8770'>been liberal in inventing wordy gratitude for the king, it would</div><div class='line' id='LC8771'>be just the thing to back it up with evidence of a substantial</div><div class='line' id='LC8772'>sort; so I said:</div><div class='line' id='LC8773'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8774'>&quot;And Marco, there&#39;s another thing which you must permit--out of</div><div class='line' id='LC8775'>kindness for Jones--because you wouldn&#39;t want to offend him.</div><div class='line' id='LC8776'>He was very anxious to testify his appreciation in some way, but</div><div class='line' id='LC8777'>he is so diffident he couldn&#39;t venture it himself, and so he begged</div><div class='line' id='LC8778'>me to buy some little things and give them to you and Dame Phyllis</div><div class='line' id='LC8779'>and let him pay for them without your ever knowing they came from</div><div class='line' id='LC8780'>him--you know how a delicate person feels about that sort of thing</div><div class='line' id='LC8781'>--and so I said I would, and we would keep mum.  Well, his idea</div><div class='line' id='LC8782'>was, a new outfit of clothes for you both--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8783'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8784'>&quot;Oh, it is wastefulness!  It may not be, brother, it may not be.</div><div class='line' id='LC8785'>Consider the vastness of the sum--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8786'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8787'>&quot;Hang the vastness of the sum!  Try to keep quiet for a moment,</div><div class='line' id='LC8788'>and see how it would seem; a body can&#39;t get in a word edgeways,</div><div class='line' id='LC8789'>you talk so much.  You ought to cure that, Marco; it isn&#39;t good</div><div class='line' id='LC8790'>form, you know, and it will grow on you if you don&#39;t check it.</div><div class='line' id='LC8791'>Yes, we&#39;ll step in here now and price this man&#39;s stuff--and don&#39;t</div><div class='line' id='LC8792'>forget to remember to not let on to Jones that you know he had</div><div class='line' id='LC8793'>anything to do with it.  You can&#39;t think how curiously sensitive</div><div class='line' id='LC8794'>and proud he is.  He&#39;s a farmer--pretty fairly well-to-do farmer</div><div class='line' id='LC8795'>--and I&#39;m his bailiff; _but_--the imagination of that man!  Why,</div><div class='line' id='LC8796'>sometimes when he forgets himself and gets to blowing off, you&#39;d</div><div class='line' id='LC8797'>think he was one of the swells of the earth; and you might listen</div><div class='line' id='LC8798'>to him a hundred years and never take him for a farmer--especially if</div><div class='line' id='LC8799'>he talked agriculture.  He _thinks_ he&#39;s a Sheol of a farmer; thinks</div><div class='line' id='LC8800'>he&#39;s old Grayback from Wayback; but between you and me privately</div><div class='line' id='LC8801'>he don&#39;t know as much about farming as he does about running</div><div class='line' id='LC8802'>a kingdom--still, whatever he talks about, you want to drop your</div><div class='line' id='LC8803'>underjaw and listen, the same as if you had never heard such</div><div class='line' id='LC8804'>incredible wisdom in all your life before, and were afraid you</div><div class='line' id='LC8805'>might die before you got enough of it.  That will please Jones.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8806'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8807'>It tickled Marco to the marrow to hear about such an odd character;</div><div class='line' id='LC8808'>but it also prepared him for accidents; and in my experience when</div><div class='line' id='LC8809'>you travel with a king who is letting on to be something else and</div><div class='line' id='LC8810'>can&#39;t remember it more than about half the time, you can&#39;t take</div><div class='line' id='LC8811'>too many precautions.</div><div class='line' id='LC8812'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8813'>This was the best store we had come across yet; it had everything</div><div class='line' id='LC8814'>in it, in small quantities, from anvils and drygoods all the way</div><div class='line' id='LC8815'>down to fish and pinchbeck jewelry.  I concluded I would bunch</div><div class='line' id='LC8816'>my whole invoice right here, and not go pricing around any more.</div><div class='line' id='LC8817'>So I got rid of Marco, by sending him off to invite the mason and</div><div class='line' id='LC8818'>the wheelwright, which left the field free to me.  For I never care</div><div class='line' id='LC8819'>to do a thing in a quiet way; it&#39;s got to be theatrical or I don&#39;t</div><div class='line' id='LC8820'>take any interest in it.  I showed up money enough, in a careless</div><div class='line' id='LC8821'>way, to corral the shopkeeper&#39;s respect, and then I wrote down</div><div class='line' id='LC8822'>a list of the things I wanted, and handed it to him to see if he</div><div class='line' id='LC8823'>could read it.  He could, and was proud to show that he could.</div><div class='line' id='LC8824'>He said he had been educated by a priest, and could both read</div><div class='line' id='LC8825'>and write.  He ran it through, and remarked with satisfaction that</div><div class='line' id='LC8826'>it was a pretty heavy bill.  Well, and so it was, for a little</div><div class='line' id='LC8827'>concern like that.  I was not only providing a swell dinner, but</div><div class='line' id='LC8828'>some odds and ends of extras.  I ordered that the things be carted</div><div class='line' id='LC8829'>out and delivered at the dwelling of Marco, the son of Marco,</div><div class='line' id='LC8830'>by Saturday evening, and send me the bill at dinner-time Sunday.</div><div class='line' id='LC8831'>He said I could depend upon his promptness and exactitude, it was</div><div class='line' id='LC8832'>the rule of the house.  He also observed that he would throw in</div><div class='line' id='LC8833'>a couple of miller-guns for the Marcos gratis--that everybody</div><div class='line' id='LC8834'>was using them now.  He had a mighty opinion of that clever</div><div class='line' id='LC8835'>device.  I said:</div><div class='line' id='LC8836'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8837'>&quot;And please fill them up to the middle mark, too; and add that</div><div class='line' id='LC8838'>to the bill.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8839'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8840'>He would, with pleasure.  He filled them, and I took them with</div><div class='line' id='LC8841'>me.  I couldn&#39;t venture to tell him that the miller-gun was a</div><div class='line' id='LC8842'>little invention of my own, and that I had officially ordered that</div><div class='line' id='LC8843'>every shopkeeper in the kingdom keep them on hand and sell them</div><div class='line' id='LC8844'>at government price--which was the merest trifle, and the shopkeeper</div><div class='line' id='LC8845'>got that, not the government.  We furnished them for nothing.</div><div class='line' id='LC8846'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8847'>The king had hardly missed us when we got back at nightfall.  He</div><div class='line' id='LC8848'>had early dropped again into his dream of a grand invasion of Gaul</div><div class='line' id='LC8849'>with the whole strength of his kingdom at his back, and the afternoon</div><div class='line' id='LC8850'>had slipped away without his ever coming to himself again.</div><div class='line' id='LC8851'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8852'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8853'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8854'>CHAPTER XXXII</div><div class='line' id='LC8855'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8856'>DOWLEY&#39;S HUMILIATION</div><div class='line' id='LC8857'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8858'>Well, when that cargo arrived toward sunset, Saturday afternoon,</div><div class='line' id='LC8859'>I had my hands full to keep the Marcos from fainting.  They were</div><div class='line' id='LC8860'>sure Jones and I were ruined past help, and they blamed themselves</div><div class='line' id='LC8861'>as accessories to this bankruptcy.  You see, in addition to the</div><div class='line' id='LC8862'>dinner-materials, which called for a sufficiently round sum,</div><div class='line' id='LC8863'>I had bought a lot of extras for the future comfort of the family:</div><div class='line' id='LC8864'>for instance, a big lot of wheat, a delicacy as rare to the tables</div><div class='line' id='LC8865'>of their class as was ice-cream to a hermit&#39;s; also a sizeable</div><div class='line' id='LC8866'>deal dinner-table; also two entire pounds of salt, which was</div><div class='line' id='LC8867'>another piece of extravagance in those people&#39;s eyes; also crockery,</div><div class='line' id='LC8868'>stools, the clothes, a small cask of beer, and so on.  I instructed</div><div class='line' id='LC8869'>the Marcos to keep quiet about this sumptuousness, so as to give</div><div class='line' id='LC8870'>me a chance to surprise the guests and show off a little.  Concerning</div><div class='line' id='LC8871'>the new clothes, the simple couple were like children; they were up</div><div class='line' id='LC8872'>and down, all night, to see if it wasn&#39;t nearly daylight, so that</div><div class='line' id='LC8873'>they could put them on, and they were into them at last as much</div><div class='line' id='LC8874'>as an hour before dawn was due.  Then their pleasure--not to say</div><div class='line' id='LC8875'>delirium--was so fresh and novel and inspiring that the sight of it</div><div class='line' id='LC8876'>paid me well for the interruptions which my sleep had suffered.</div><div class='line' id='LC8877'>The king had slept just as usual--like the dead.  The Marcos could</div><div class='line' id='LC8878'>not thank him for their clothes, that being forbidden; but they</div><div class='line' id='LC8879'>tried every way they could think of to make him see how grateful</div><div class='line' id='LC8880'>they were.  Which all went for nothing: he didn&#39;t notice any change.</div><div class='line' id='LC8881'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8882'>It turned out to be one of those rich and rare fall days which is</div><div class='line' id='LC8883'>just a June day toned down to a degree where it is heaven to be</div><div class='line' id='LC8884'>out of doors.  Toward noon the guests arrived, and we assembled</div><div class='line' id='LC8885'>under a great tree and were soon as sociable as old acquaintances.</div><div class='line' id='LC8886'>Even the king&#39;s reserve melted a little, though it was some little</div><div class='line' id='LC8887'>trouble to him to adjust himself to the name of Jones along at</div><div class='line' id='LC8888'>first.  I had asked him to try to not forget that he was a farmer;</div><div class='line' id='LC8889'>but I had also considered it prudent to ask him to let the thing</div><div class='line' id='LC8890'>stand at that, and not elaborate it any.  Because he was just the</div><div class='line' id='LC8891'>kind of person you could depend on to spoil a little thing like</div><div class='line' id='LC8892'>that if you didn&#39;t warn him, his tongue was so handy, and his</div><div class='line' id='LC8893'>spirit so willing, and his information so uncertain.</div><div class='line' id='LC8894'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8895'>Dowley was in fine feather, and I early got him started, and then</div><div class='line' id='LC8896'>adroitly worked him around onto his own history for a text and</div><div class='line' id='LC8897'>himself for a hero, and then it was good to sit there and hear him</div><div class='line' id='LC8898'>hum.  Self-made man, you know.  They know how to talk.  They do</div><div class='line' id='LC8899'>deserve more credit than any other breed of men, yes, that is true;</div><div class='line' id='LC8900'>and they are among the very first to find it out, too.  He told how</div><div class='line' id='LC8901'>he had begun life an orphan lad without money and without friends</div><div class='line' id='LC8902'>able to help him; how he had lived as the slaves of the meanest</div><div class='line' id='LC8903'>master lived; how his day&#39;s work was from sixteen to eighteen hours</div><div class='line' id='LC8904'>long, and yielded him only enough black bread to keep him in a</div><div class='line' id='LC8905'>half-fed condition; how his faithful endeavors finally attracted</div><div class='line' id='LC8906'>the attention of a good blacksmith, who came near knocking him</div><div class='line' id='LC8907'>dead with kindness by suddenly offering, when he was totally</div><div class='line' id='LC8908'>unprepared, to take him as his bound apprentice for nine years</div><div class='line' id='LC8909'>and give him board and clothes and teach him the trade--or &quot;mystery&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8910'>as Dowley called it.  That was his first great rise, his first</div><div class='line' id='LC8911'>gorgeous stroke of fortune; and you saw that he couldn&#39;t yet speak</div><div class='line' id='LC8912'>of it without a sort of eloquent wonder and delight that such a</div><div class='line' id='LC8913'>gilded promotion should have fallen to the lot of a common human</div><div class='line' id='LC8914'>being.  He got no new clothing during his apprenticeship, but on</div><div class='line' id='LC8915'>his graduation day his master tricked him out in spang-new tow-linens</div><div class='line' id='LC8916'>and made him feel unspeakably rich and fine.</div><div class='line' id='LC8917'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8918'>&quot;I remember me of that day!&quot; the wheelwright sang out, with</div><div class='line' id='LC8919'>enthusiasm.</div><div class='line' id='LC8920'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8921'>&quot;And I likewise!&quot; cried the mason.  &quot;I would not believe they</div><div class='line' id='LC8922'>were thine own; in faith I could not.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8923'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8924'>&quot;Nor other!&quot; shouted Dowley, with sparkling eyes.  &quot;I was like</div><div class='line' id='LC8925'>to lose my character, the neighbors wending I had mayhap been</div><div class='line' id='LC8926'>stealing.  It was a great day, a great day; one forgetteth not</div><div class='line' id='LC8927'>days like that.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8928'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8929'>Yes, and his master was a fine man, and prosperous, and always</div><div class='line' id='LC8930'>had a great feast of meat twice in the year, and with it white</div><div class='line' id='LC8931'>bread, true wheaten bread; in fact, lived like a lord, so to speak.</div><div class='line' id='LC8932'>And in time Dowley succeeded to the business and married the daughter.</div><div class='line' id='LC8933'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8934'>&quot;And now consider what is come to pass,&quot; said he, impressively.</div><div class='line' id='LC8935'>&quot;Two times in every month there is fresh meat upon my table.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8936'>He made a pause here, to let that fact sink home, then added</div><div class='line' id='LC8937'>--&quot;and eight times salt meat.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8938'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8939'>&quot;It is even true,&quot; said the wheelwright, with bated breath.</div><div class='line' id='LC8940'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8941'>&quot;I know it of mine own knowledge,&quot; said the mason, in the same</div><div class='line' id='LC8942'>reverent fashion.</div><div class='line' id='LC8943'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8944'>&quot;On my table appeareth white bread every Sunday in the year,&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8945'>added the master smith, with solemnity.  &quot;I leave it to your own</div><div class='line' id='LC8946'>consciences, friends, if this is not also true?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8947'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8948'>&quot;By my head, yes,&quot; cried the mason.</div><div class='line' id='LC8949'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8950'>&quot;I can testify it--and I do,&quot; said the wheelwright.</div><div class='line' id='LC8951'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8952'>&quot;And as to furniture, ye shall say yourselves what mine equipment</div><div class='line' id='LC8953'>is.&quot;  He waved his hand in fine gesture of granting frank and</div><div class='line' id='LC8954'>unhampered freedom of speech, and added: &quot;Speak as ye are moved;</div><div class='line' id='LC8955'>speak as ye would speak; an I were not here.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8956'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8957'>&quot;Ye have five stools, and of the sweetest workmanship at that, albeit</div><div class='line' id='LC8958'>your family is but three,&quot; said the wheelwright, with deep respect.</div><div class='line' id='LC8959'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8960'>&quot;And six wooden goblets, and six platters of wood and two of pewter</div><div class='line' id='LC8961'>to eat and drink from withal,&quot; said the mason, impressively.  &quot;And</div><div class='line' id='LC8962'>I say it as knowing God is my judge, and we tarry not here alway,</div><div class='line' id='LC8963'>but must answer at the last day for the things said in the body,</div><div class='line' id='LC8964'>be they false or be they sooth.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC8965'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8966'>&quot;Now ye know what manner of man I am, brother Jones,&quot; said the</div><div class='line' id='LC8967'>smith, with a fine and friendly condescension, &quot;and doubtless ye</div><div class='line' id='LC8968'>would look to find me a man jealous of his due of respect and</div><div class='line' id='LC8969'>but sparing of outgo to strangers till their rating and quality be</div><div class='line' id='LC8970'>assured, but trouble yourself not, as concerning that; wit ye well</div><div class='line' id='LC8971'>ye shall find me a man that regardeth not these matters but is</div><div class='line' id='LC8972'>willing to receive any he as his fellow and equal that carrieth</div><div class='line' id='LC8973'>a right heart in his body, be his worldly estate howsoever modest.</div><div class='line' id='LC8974'>And in token of it, here is my hand; and I say with my own mouth</div><div class='line' id='LC8975'>we are equals--equals&quot;--and he smiled around on the company with</div><div class='line' id='LC8976'>the satisfaction of a god who is doing the handsome and gracious</div><div class='line' id='LC8977'>thing and is quite well aware of it.</div><div class='line' id='LC8978'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8979'>The king took the hand with a poorly disguised reluctance, and</div><div class='line' id='LC8980'>let go of it as willingly as a lady lets go of a fish; all of which</div><div class='line' id='LC8981'>had a good effect, for it was mistaken for an embarrassment natural</div><div class='line' id='LC8982'>to one who was being called upon by greatness.</div><div class='line' id='LC8983'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8984'>The dame brought out the table now, and set it under the tree.</div><div class='line' id='LC8985'>It caused a visible stir of surprise, it being brand new and a</div><div class='line' id='LC8986'>sumptuous article of deal.  But the surprise rose higher still</div><div class='line' id='LC8987'>when the dame, with a body oozing easy indifference at every pore,</div><div class='line' id='LC8988'>but eyes that gave it all away by absolutely flaming with vanity,</div><div class='line' id='LC8989'>slowly unfolded an actual simon-pure tablecloth and spread it.</div><div class='line' id='LC8990'>That was a notch above even the blacksmith&#39;s domestic grandeurs,</div><div class='line' id='LC8991'>and it hit him hard; you could see it.  But Marco was in Paradise;</div><div class='line' id='LC8992'>you could see that, too.  Then the dame brought two fine new</div><div class='line' id='LC8993'>stools--whew! that was a sensation; it was visible in the eyes of</div><div class='line' id='LC8994'>every guest.  Then she brought two more--as calmly as she could.</div><div class='line' id='LC8995'>Sensation again--with awed murmurs.  Again she brought two</div><div class='line' id='LC8996'>--walking on air, she was so proud.  The guests were petrified, and</div><div class='line' id='LC8997'>the mason muttered:</div><div class='line' id='LC8998'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC8999'>&quot;There is that about earthly pomps which doth ever move to reverence.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9000'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9001'>As the dame turned away, Marco couldn&#39;t help slapping on the climax</div><div class='line' id='LC9002'>while the thing was hot; so he said with what was meant for a</div><div class='line' id='LC9003'>languid composure but was a poor imitation of it:</div><div class='line' id='LC9004'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9005'>&quot;These suffice; leave the rest.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9006'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9007'>So there were more yet!  It was a fine effect.  I couldn&#39;t have</div><div class='line' id='LC9008'>played the hand better myself.</div><div class='line' id='LC9009'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9010'>From this out, the madam piled up the surprises with a rush that</div><div class='line' id='LC9011'>fired the general astonishment up to a hundred and fifty in the</div><div class='line' id='LC9012'>shade, and at the same time paralyzed expression of it down to</div><div class='line' id='LC9013'>gasped &quot;Oh&#39;s&quot; and &quot;Ah&#39;s,&quot; and mute upliftings of hands and eyes.</div><div class='line' id='LC9014'>She fetched crockery--new, and plenty of it; new wooden goblets</div><div class='line' id='LC9015'>and other table furniture; and beer, fish, chicken, a goose, eggs,</div><div class='line' id='LC9016'>roast beef, roast mutton, a ham, a small roast pig, and a wealth</div><div class='line' id='LC9017'>of genuine white wheaten bread.  Take it by and large, that spread</div><div class='line' id='LC9018'>laid everything far and away in the shade that ever that crowd had</div><div class='line' id='LC9019'>seen before.  And while they sat there just simply stupefied with</div><div class='line' id='LC9020'>wonder and awe, I sort of waved my hand as if by accident, and</div><div class='line' id='LC9021'>the storekeeper&#39;s son emerged from space and said he had come</div><div class='line' id='LC9022'>to collect.</div><div class='line' id='LC9023'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9024'>&quot;That&#39;s all right,&quot; I said, indifferently.  &quot;What is the amount?</div><div class='line' id='LC9025'>give us the items.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9026'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9027'>Then he read off this bill, while those three amazed men listened,</div><div class='line' id='LC9028'>and serene waves of satisfaction rolled over my soul and alternate</div><div class='line' id='LC9029'>waves of terror and admiration surged over Marco&#39;s:</div><div class='line' id='LC9030'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9031'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2 pounds salt . . . . . . . . . . . . . .   200</div><div class='line' id='LC9032'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8 dozen pints beer, in the wood . . . . .   800</div><div class='line' id='LC9033'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3 bushels wheat . . . . . . . . . . . . . 2,700</div><div class='line' id='LC9034'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2 pounds fish . . . . . . . . . . . . . .   100</div><div class='line' id='LC9035'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3 hens  . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .   400</div><div class='line' id='LC9036'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1 goose . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .   400</div><div class='line' id='LC9037'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3 dozen eggs  . . . . . . . . . . . . . .   150</div><div class='line' id='LC9038'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1 roast of beef . . . . . . . . . . . . .
