  450</div><div class='line' id='LC9039'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1 roast of mutton . . . . . . . . . . . .   400</div><div class='line' id='LC9040'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1 ham . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .   800</div><div class='line' id='LC9041'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1 sucking pig . . . . . . . . . . . . . .   500</div><div class='line' id='LC9042'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2 crockery dinner sets  . . . . . . . . . 6,000</div><div class='line' id='LC9043'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2 men&#39;s suits and underwear . . . . . . . 2,800</div><div class='line' id='LC9044'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1 stuff and 1 linsey-woolsey gown</div><div class='line' id='LC9045'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and underwear . . . . . . . . . . . . . 1,600</div><div class='line' id='LC9046'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8 wooden goblets  . . . . . . . . . . . .   800</div><div class='line' id='LC9047'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Various table furniture . . . . . . . . .10,000</div><div class='line' id='LC9048'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1 deal table  . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 3,000</div><div class='line' id='LC9049'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8 stools  . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 4,000</div><div class='line' id='LC9050'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2 miller guns, loaded . . . . . . . . . . 3,000</div><div class='line' id='LC9051'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9052'>He ceased.  There was a pale and awful silence.  Not a limb stirred.</div><div class='line' id='LC9053'>Not a nostril betrayed the passage of breath.</div><div class='line' id='LC9054'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9055'>&quot;Is that all?&quot; I asked, in a voice of the most perfect calmness.</div><div class='line' id='LC9056'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9057'>&quot;All, fair sir, save that certain matters of light moment are</div><div class='line' id='LC9058'>placed together under a head hight sundries.  If it would like</div><div class='line' id='LC9059'>you, I will sepa--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9060'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9061'>&quot;It is of no consequence,&quot; I said, accompanying the words with</div><div class='line' id='LC9062'>a gesture of the most utter indifference; &quot;give me the grand</div><div class='line' id='LC9063'>total, please.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9064'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9065'>The clerk leaned against the tree to stay himself, and said:</div><div class='line' id='LC9066'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9067'>&quot;Thirty-nine thousand one hundred and fifty milrays!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9068'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9069'>The wheelwright fell off his stool, the others grabbed the table</div><div class='line' id='LC9070'>to save themselves, and there was a deep and general ejaculation of:</div><div class='line' id='LC9071'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9072'>&quot;God be with us in the day of disaster!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9073'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9074'>The clerk hastened to say:</div><div class='line' id='LC9075'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9076'>&quot;My father chargeth me to say he cannot honorably require you</div><div class='line' id='LC9077'>to pay it all at this time, and therefore only prayeth you--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9078'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9079'>I paid no more heed than if it were the idle breeze, but, with an</div><div class='line' id='LC9080'>air of indifference amounting almost to weariness, got out my money</div><div class='line' id='LC9081'>and tossed four dollars on to the table.  Ah, you should have seen</div><div class='line' id='LC9082'>them stare!</div><div class='line' id='LC9083'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9084'>The clerk was astonished and charmed.  He asked me to retain</div><div class='line' id='LC9085'>one of the dollars as security, until he could go to town and</div><div class='line' id='LC9086'>--I interrupted:</div><div class='line' id='LC9087'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9088'>&quot;What, and fetch back nine cents?  Nonsense!  Take the whole.</div><div class='line' id='LC9089'>Keep the change.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9090'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9091'>There was an amazed murmur to this effect:</div><div class='line' id='LC9092'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9093'>&quot;Verily this being is _made_ of money!  He throweth it away even</div><div class='line' id='LC9094'>as if it were dirt.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9095'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9096'>The blacksmith was a crushed man.</div><div class='line' id='LC9097'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9098'>The clerk took his money and reeled away drunk with fortune.  I said</div><div class='line' id='LC9099'>to Marco and his wife:</div><div class='line' id='LC9100'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9101'>&quot;Good folk, here is a little trifle for you&quot;--handing the miller-guns</div><div class='line' id='LC9102'>as if it were a matter of no consequence, though each of them</div><div class='line' id='LC9103'>contained fifteen cents in solid cash; and while the poor creatures</div><div class='line' id='LC9104'>went to pieces with astonishment and gratitude, I turned to the</div><div class='line' id='LC9105'>others and said as calmly as one would ask the time of day:</div><div class='line' id='LC9106'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9107'>&quot;Well, if we are all ready, I judge the dinner is.  Come, fall to.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9108'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9109'>Ah, well, it was immense; yes, it was a daisy.  I don&#39;t know that</div><div class='line' id='LC9110'>I ever put a situation together better, or got happier spectacular</div><div class='line' id='LC9111'>effects out of the materials available.  The blacksmith--well, he</div><div class='line' id='LC9112'>was simply mashed.  Land! I wouldn&#39;t have felt what that man was</div><div class='line' id='LC9113'>feeling, for anything in the world.  Here he had been blowing and</div><div class='line' id='LC9114'>bragging about his grand meat-feast twice a year, and his fresh</div><div class='line' id='LC9115'>meat twice a month, and his salt meat twice a week, and his white</div><div class='line' id='LC9116'>bread every Sunday the year round--all for a family of three; the</div><div class='line' id='LC9117'>entire cost for the year not above 69.2.6 (sixty-nine cents, two</div><div class='line' id='LC9118'>mills and six milrays), and all of a sudden here comes along a man</div><div class='line' id='LC9119'>who slashes out nearly four dollars on a single blow-out; and not</div><div class='line' id='LC9120'>only that, but acts as if it made him tired to handle such small</div><div class='line' id='LC9121'>sums.  Yes, Dowley was a good deal wilted, and shrunk-up and</div><div class='line' id='LC9122'>collapsed; he had the aspect of a bladder-balloon that&#39;s been</div><div class='line' id='LC9123'>stepped on by a cow.</div><div class='line' id='LC9124'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9125'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9126'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9127'>CHAPTER XXXIII</div><div class='line' id='LC9128'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9129'>SIXTH CENTURY POLITICAL ECONOMY</div><div class='line' id='LC9130'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9131'>However, I made a dead set at him, and before the first third</div><div class='line' id='LC9132'>of the dinner was reached, I had him happy again.  It was easy</div><div class='line' id='LC9133'>to do--in a country of ranks and castes.  You see, in a country</div><div class='line' id='LC9134'>where they have ranks and castes, a man isn&#39;t ever a man, he is</div><div class='line' id='LC9135'>only part of a man, he can&#39;t ever get his full growth.  You prove</div><div class='line' id='LC9136'>your superiority over him in station, or rank, or fortune, and</div><div class='line' id='LC9137'>that&#39;s the end of it--he knuckles down.  You can&#39;t insult him</div><div class='line' id='LC9138'>after that.  No, I don&#39;t mean quite that; of course you _can_ insult</div><div class='line' id='LC9139'>him, I only mean it&#39;s difficult; and so, unless you&#39;ve got a lot</div><div class='line' id='LC9140'>of useless time on your hands it doesn&#39;t pay to try.  I had the</div><div class='line' id='LC9141'>smith&#39;s reverence now, because I was apparently immensely prosperous</div><div class='line' id='LC9142'>and rich; I could have had his adoration if I had had some little</div><div class='line' id='LC9143'>gimcrack title of nobility.  And not only his, but any commoner&#39;s</div><div class='line' id='LC9144'>in the land, though he were the mightiest production of all the ages,</div><div class='line' id='LC9145'>in intellect, worth, and character, and I bankrupt in all three.</div><div class='line' id='LC9146'>This was to remain so, as long as England should exist in the</div><div class='line' id='LC9147'>earth.  With the spirit of prophecy upon me, I could look into</div><div class='line' id='LC9148'>the future and see her erect statues and monuments to her unspeakable</div><div class='line' id='LC9149'>Georges and other royal and noble clothes-horses, and leave unhonored</div><div class='line' id='LC9150'>the creators of this world--after God--Gutenburg, Watt, Arkwright,</div><div class='line' id='LC9151'>Whitney, Morse, Stephenson, Bell.</div><div class='line' id='LC9152'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9153'>The king got his cargo aboard, and then, the talk not turning upon</div><div class='line' id='LC9154'>battle, conquest, or iron-clad duel, he dulled down to drowsiness</div><div class='line' id='LC9155'>and went off to take a nap.  Mrs. Marco cleared the table, placed</div><div class='line' id='LC9156'>the beer keg handy, and went away to eat her dinner of leavings</div><div class='line' id='LC9157'>in humble privacy, and the rest of us soon drifted into matters</div><div class='line' id='LC9158'>near and dear to the hearts of our sort--business and wages,</div><div class='line' id='LC9159'>of course.  At a first glance, things appeared to be exceeding</div><div class='line' id='LC9160'>prosperous in this little tributary kingdom--whose lord was</div><div class='line' id='LC9161'>King Bagdemagus--as compared with the state of things in my own</div><div class='line' id='LC9162'>region.  They had the &quot;protection&quot; system in full force here,</div><div class='line' id='LC9163'>whereas we were working along down toward free-trade, by easy</div><div class='line' id='LC9164'>stages, and were now about half way.  Before long, Dowley and I</div><div class='line' id='LC9165'>were doing all the talking, the others hungrily listening.  Dowley</div><div class='line' id='LC9166'>warmed to his work, snuffed an advantage in the air, and began</div><div class='line' id='LC9167'>to put questions which he considered pretty awkward ones for me,</div><div class='line' id='LC9168'>and they did have something of that look:</div><div class='line' id='LC9169'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9170'>&quot;In your country, brother, what is the wage of a master bailiff,</div><div class='line' id='LC9171'>master hind, carter, shepherd, swineherd?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9172'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9173'>&quot;Twenty-five milrays a day; that is to say, a quarter of a cent.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9174'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9175'>The smith&#39;s face beamed with joy.  He said:</div><div class='line' id='LC9176'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9177'>&quot;With us they are allowed the double of it!  And what may a mechanic</div><div class='line' id='LC9178'>get--carpenter, dauber, mason, painter, blacksmith, wheelwright,</div><div class='line' id='LC9179'>and the like?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9180'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9181'>&quot;On the average, fifty milrays; half a cent a day.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9182'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9183'>&quot;Ho-ho!  With us they are allowed a hundred!  With us any good</div><div class='line' id='LC9184'>mechanic is allowed a cent a day!  I count out the tailor, but</div><div class='line' id='LC9185'>not the others--they are all allowed a cent a day, and in driving</div><div class='line' id='LC9186'>times they get more--yes, up to a hundred and ten and even fifteen</div><div class='line' id='LC9187'>milrays a day.  I&#39;ve paid a hundred and fifteen myself, within</div><div class='line' id='LC9188'>the week.  &#39;Rah for protection--to Sheol with free-trade!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9189'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9190'>And his face shone upon the company like a sunburst.  But I didn&#39;t</div><div class='line' id='LC9191'>scare at all.  I rigged up my pile-driver, and allowed myself</div><div class='line' id='LC9192'>fifteen minutes to drive him into the earth--drive him _all_ in</div><div class='line' id='LC9193'>--drive him in till not even the curve of his skull should show</div><div class='line' id='LC9194'>above ground.  Here is the way I started in on him.  I asked:</div><div class='line' id='LC9195'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9196'>&quot;What do you pay a pound for salt?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9197'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9198'>&quot;A hundred milrays.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9199'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9200'>&quot;We pay forty.  What do you pay for beef and mutton--when you</div><div class='line' id='LC9201'>buy it?&quot;  That was a neat hit; it made the color come.</div><div class='line' id='LC9202'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9203'>&quot;It varieth somewhat, but not much; one may say seventy-five milrays</div><div class='line' id='LC9204'>the pound.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9205'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9206'>&quot;_We_ pay thirty-three.  What do you pay for eggs?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9207'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9208'>&quot;Fifty milrays the dozen.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9209'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9210'>&quot;We pay twenty.  What do you pay for beer?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9211'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9212'>&quot;It costeth us eight and one-half milrays the pint.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9213'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9214'>&quot;We get it for four; twenty-five bottles for a cent.</div><div class='line' id='LC9215'>What do you pay for wheat?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9216'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9217'>&quot;At the rate of nine hundred milrays the bushel.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9218'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9219'>&quot;We pay four hundred.  What do you pay for a man&#39;s tow-linen suit?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9220'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9221'>&quot;Thirteen cents.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9222'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9223'>&quot;We pay six.  What do you pay for a stuff gown for the wife of the</div><div class='line' id='LC9224'>laborer or the mechanic?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9225'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9226'>&quot;We pay eight cents, four mills.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9227'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9228'>&quot;Well, observe the difference: you pay eight cents and four mills,</div><div class='line' id='LC9229'>we pay only four cents.&quot;  I prepared now to sock it to him.  I said:</div><div class='line' id='LC9230'>&quot;Look here, dear friend, _what&#39;s become of your high wages you</div><div class='line' id='LC9231'>were bragging so about a few minutes ago?_&quot;--and I looked around</div><div class='line' id='LC9232'>on the company with placid satisfaction, for I had slipped up</div><div class='line' id='LC9233'>on him gradually and tied him hand and foot, you see, without his</div><div class='line' id='LC9234'>ever noticing that he was being tied at all.  &quot;What&#39;s become of</div><div class='line' id='LC9235'>those noble high wages of yours?--I seem to have knocked the</div><div class='line' id='LC9236'>stuffing all out of them, it appears to me.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9237'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9238'>But if you will believe me, he merely looked surprised, that</div><div class='line' id='LC9239'>is all! he didn&#39;t grasp the situation at all, didn&#39;t know he had</div><div class='line' id='LC9240'>walked into a trap, didn&#39;t discover that he was _in_ a trap.  I could</div><div class='line' id='LC9241'>have shot him, from sheer vexation.  With cloudy eye and a struggling</div><div class='line' id='LC9242'>intellect he fetched this out:</div><div class='line' id='LC9243'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9244'>&quot;Marry, I seem not to understand.  It is _proved_ that our wages</div><div class='line' id='LC9245'>be double thine; how then may it be that thou&#39;st knocked therefrom</div><div class='line' id='LC9246'>the stuffing?--an miscall not the wonderly word, this being the</div><div class='line' id='LC9247'>first time under grace and providence of God it hath been granted</div><div class='line' id='LC9248'>me to hear it.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9249'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9250'>Well, I was stunned; partly with this unlooked-for stupidity on</div><div class='line' id='LC9251'>his part, and partly because his fellows so manifestly sided with</div><div class='line' id='LC9252'>him and were of his mind--if you might call it mind.  My position</div><div class='line' id='LC9253'>was simple enough, plain enough; how could it ever be simplified</div><div class='line' id='LC9254'>more?  However, I must try:</div><div class='line' id='LC9255'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9256'>&quot;Why, look here, brother Dowley, don&#39;t you see?  Your wages are</div><div class='line' id='LC9257'>merely higher than ours in _name_, not in _fact_.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9258'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9259'>&quot;Hear him!  They are the _double_--ye have confessed it yourself.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9260'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9261'>&quot;Yes-yes, I don&#39;t deny that at all.  But that&#39;s got nothing to do</div><div class='line' id='LC9262'>with it; the _amount_ of the wages in mere coins, with meaningless</div><div class='line' id='LC9263'>names attached to them to know them by, has got nothing to do</div><div class='line' id='LC9264'>with it.  The thing is, how much can you _buy_ with your wages?</div><div class='line' id='LC9265'>--that&#39;s the idea.  While it is true that with you a good mechanic</div><div class='line' id='LC9266'>is allowed about three dollars and a half a year, and with us only</div><div class='line' id='LC9267'>about a dollar and seventy-five--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9268'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9269'>&quot;There--ye&#39;re confessing it again, ye&#39;re confessing it again!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9270'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9271'>&quot;Confound it, I&#39;ve never denied it, I tell you!  What I say is</div><div class='line' id='LC9272'>this.  With us _half_ a dollar buys more than a _dollar_ buys</div><div class='line' id='LC9273'>with you--and THEREFORE it stands to reason and the commonest</div><div class='line' id='LC9274'>kind of common-sense, that our wages are _higher_ than yours.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9275'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9276'>He looked dazed, and said, despairingly:</div><div class='line' id='LC9277'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9278'>&quot;Verily, I cannot make it out.  Ye&#39;ve just said ours are the</div><div class='line' id='LC9279'>higher, and with the same breath ye take it back.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9280'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9281'>&quot;Oh, great Scott, isn&#39;t it possible to get such a simple thing</div><div class='line' id='LC9282'>through your head?  Now look here--let me illustrate.  We pay</div><div class='line' id='LC9283'>four cents for a woman&#39;s stuff gown, you pay 8.4.0, which is</div><div class='line' id='LC9284'>four mills more than _double_.  What do you allow a laboring</div><div class='line' id='LC9285'>woman who works on a farm?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9286'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9287'>&quot;Two mills a day.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9288'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9289'>&quot;Very good; we allow but half as much; we pay her only a tenth</div><div class='line' id='LC9290'>of a cent a day; and--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9291'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9292'>&quot;Again ye&#39;re conf--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9293'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9294'>&quot;Wait!  Now, you see, the thing is very simple; this time you&#39;ll</div><div class='line' id='LC9295'>understand it.  For instance, it takes your woman 42 days to earn</div><div class='line' id='LC9296'>her gown, at 2 mills a day--7 weeks&#39; work; but ours earns hers</div><div class='line' id='LC9297'>in forty days--two days _short_ of 7 weeks.  Your woman has a gown,</div><div class='line' id='LC9298'>and her whole seven weeks wages are gone; ours has a gown, and</div><div class='line' id='LC9299'>two days&#39; wages left, to buy something else with.  There--_now_</div><div class='line' id='LC9300'>you understand it!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9301'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9302'>He looked--well, he merely looked dubious, it&#39;s the most I can say;</div><div class='line' id='LC9303'>so did the others.  I waited--to let the thing work.  Dowley spoke</div><div class='line' id='LC9304'>at last--and betrayed the fact that he actually hadn&#39;t gotten away</div><div class='line' id='LC9305'>from his rooted and grounded superstitions yet.  He said, with</div><div class='line' id='LC9306'>a trifle of hesitancy:</div><div class='line' id='LC9307'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9308'>&quot;But--but--ye cannot fail to grant that two mills a day is better</div><div class='line' id='LC9309'>than one.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9310'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9311'>Shucks!  Well, of course, I hated to give it up.  So I chanced</div><div class='line' id='LC9312'>another flyer:</div><div class='line' id='LC9313'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9314'>&quot;Let us suppose a case.  Suppose one of your journeymen goes out</div><div class='line' id='LC9315'>and buys the following articles:</div><div class='line' id='LC9316'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9317'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&quot;1 pound of salt;</div><div class='line' id='LC9318'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1 dozen eggs;</div><div class='line' id='LC9319'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1 dozen pints of beer;</div><div class='line' id='LC9320'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1 bushel of wheat;</div><div class='line' id='LC9321'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1 tow-linen suit;</div><div class='line' id='LC9322'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5 pounds of beef;</div><div class='line' id='LC9323'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5 pounds of mutton.</div><div class='line' id='LC9324'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9325'>&quot;The lot will cost him 32 cents.  It takes him 32 working days</div><div class='line' id='LC9326'>to earn the money--5 weeks and 2 days.  Let him come to us and</div><div class='line' id='LC9327'>work 32 days at _half_ the wages; he can buy all those things for</div><div class='line' id='LC9328'>a shade under 14 1/2 cents; they will cost him a shade under 29</div><div class='line' id='LC9329'>days&#39; work, and he will have about half a week&#39;s wages over.  Carry</div><div class='line' id='LC9330'>it through the year; he would save nearly a week&#39;s wages every</div><div class='line' id='LC9331'>two months, _your_ man nothing; thus saving five or six weeks&#39; wages</div><div class='line' id='LC9332'>in a year, your man not a cent.  _Now_ I reckon you understand that</div><div class='line' id='LC9333'>&#39;high wages&#39; and &#39;low wages&#39; are phrases that don&#39;t mean anything</div><div class='line' id='LC9334'>in the world until you find out which of them will _buy_ the most!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9335'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9336'>It was a crusher.</div><div class='line' id='LC9337'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9338'>But, alas! it didn&#39;t crush.  No, I had to give it up.  What those</div><div class='line' id='LC9339'>people valued was _high wages_; it didn&#39;t seem to be a matter of</div><div class='line' id='LC9340'>any consequence to them whether the high wages would buy anything</div><div class='line' id='LC9341'>or not.  They stood for &quot;protection,&quot; and swore by it, which was</div><div class='line' id='LC9342'>reasonable enough, because interested parties had gulled them into</div><div class='line' id='LC9343'>the notion that it was protection which had created their high</div><div class='line' id='LC9344'>wages.  I proved to them that in a quarter of a century their wages</div><div class='line' id='LC9345'>had advanced but 30 per cent., while the cost of living had gone</div><div class='line' id='LC9346'>up 100; and that with us, in a shorter time, wages had advanced</div><div class='line' id='LC9347'>40 per cent. while the cost of living had gone steadily down.  But</div><div class='line' id='LC9348'>it didn&#39;t do any good.  Nothing could unseat their strange beliefs.</div><div class='line' id='LC9349'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9350'>Well, I was smarting under a sense of defeat.  Undeserved defeat,</div><div class='line' id='LC9351'>but what of that?  That didn&#39;t soften the smart any.  And to think</div><div class='line' id='LC9352'>of the circumstances! the first statesman of the age, the capablest</div><div class='line' id='LC9353'>man, the best-informed man in the entire world, the loftiest</div><div class='line' id='LC9354'>uncrowned head that had moved through the clouds of any political</div><div class='line' id='LC9355'>firmament for centuries, sitting here apparently defeated in</div><div class='line' id='LC9356'>argument by an ignorant country blacksmith!  And I could see that</div><div class='line' id='LC9357'>those others were sorry for me--which made me blush till I could</div><div class='line' id='LC9358'>smell my whiskers scorching.  Put yourself in my place; feel as mean</div><div class='line' id='LC9359'>as I did, as ashamed as I felt--wouldn&#39;t _you_ have struck below the</div><div class='line' id='LC9360'>belt to get even?  Yes, you would; it is simply human nature.</div><div class='line' id='LC9361'>Well, that is what I did.  I am not trying to justify it; I&#39;m only</div><div class='line' id='LC9362'>saying that I was mad, and _anybody_ would have done it.</div><div class='line' id='LC9363'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9364'>Well, when I make up my mind to hit a man, I don&#39;t plan out</div><div class='line' id='LC9365'>a love-tap; no, that isn&#39;t my way; as long as I&#39;m going to hit him</div><div class='line' id='LC9366'>at all, I&#39;m going to hit him a lifter.  And I don&#39;t jump at him</div><div class='line' id='LC9367'>all of a sudden, and risk making a blundering half-way business</div><div class='line' id='LC9368'>of it; no, I get away off yonder to one side, and work up on him</div><div class='line' id='LC9369'>gradually, so that he never suspects that I&#39;m going to hit him</div><div class='line' id='LC9370'>at all; and by and by, all in a flash, he&#39;s flat on his back, and</div><div class='line' id='LC9371'>he can&#39;t tell for the life of him how it all happened.  That is</div><div class='line' id='LC9372'>the way I went for brother Dowley.  I started to talking lazy and</div><div class='line' id='LC9373'>comfortable, as if I was just talking to pass the time; and the</div><div class='line' id='LC9374'>oldest man in the world couldn&#39;t have taken the bearings of my</div><div class='line' id='LC9375'>starting place and guessed where I was going to fetch up:</div><div class='line' id='LC9376'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9377'>&quot;Boys, there&#39;s a good many curious things about law, and custom,</div><div class='line' id='LC9378'>and usage, and all that sort of thing, when you come to look at it;</div><div class='line' id='LC9379'>yes, and about the drift and progress of human opinion and movement,</div><div class='line' id='LC9380'>too.  There are written laws--they perish; but there are also</div><div class='line' id='LC9381'>unwritten laws--_they_ are eternal.  Take the unwritten law of wages:</div><div class='line' id='LC9382'>it says they&#39;ve got to advance, little by little, straight through</div><div class='line' id='LC9383'>the centuries.  And notice how it works.  We know what wages are</div><div class='line' id='LC9384'>now, here and there and yonder; we strike an average, and say that&#39;s</div><div class='line' id='LC9385'>the wages of to-day.  We know what the wages were a hundred years</div><div class='line' id='LC9386'>ago, and what they were two hundred years ago; that&#39;s as far back</div><div class='line' id='LC9387'>as we can get, but it suffices to give us the law of progress,</div><div class='line' id='LC9388'>the measure and rate of the periodical augmentation; and so, without</div><div class='line' id='LC9389'>a document to help us, we can come pretty close to determining</div><div class='line' id='LC9390'>what the wages were three and four and five hundred years ago.</div><div class='line' id='LC9391'>Good, so far.  Do we stop there?  No.  We stop looking backward;</div><div class='line' id='LC9392'>we face around and apply the law to the future.  My friends, I can</div><div class='line' id='LC9393'>tell you what people&#39;s wages are going to be at any date in the</div><div class='line' id='LC9394'>future you want to know, for hundreds and hundreds of years.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9395'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9396'>&quot;What, goodman, what!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9397'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9398'>&quot;Yes.  In seven hundred years wages will have risen to six times</div><div class='line' id='LC9399'>what they are now, here in your region, and farm hands will be</div><div class='line' id='LC9400'>allowed 3 cents a day, and mechanics 6.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9401'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9402'>&quot;I would&#39;t I might die now and live then!&quot; interrupted Smug, the</div><div class='line' id='LC9403'>wheelwright, with a fine avaricious glow in his eye.</div><div class='line' id='LC9404'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9405'>&quot;And that isn&#39;t all; they&#39;ll get their board besides--such as it is:</div><div class='line' id='LC9406'>it won&#39;t bloat them.  Two hundred and fifty years later--pay attention</div><div class='line' id='LC9407'>now--a mechanic&#39;s wages will be--mind you, this is law, not</div><div class='line' id='LC9408'>guesswork; a mechanic&#39;s wages will then be _twenty_ cents a day!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9409'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9410'>There was a general gasp of awed astonishment, Dickon the mason</div><div class='line' id='LC9411'>murmured, with raised eyes and hands:</div><div class='line' id='LC9412'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9413'>&quot;More than three weeks&#39; pay for one day&#39;s work!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9414'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9415'>&quot;Riches!--of a truth, yes, riches!&quot; muttered Marco, his breath</div><div class='line' id='LC9416'>coming quick and short, with excitement.</div><div class='line' id='LC9417'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9418'>&quot;Wages will keep on rising, little by little, little by little,</div><div class='line' id='LC9419'>as steadily as a tree grows, and at the end of three hundred and</div><div class='line' id='LC9420'>forty years more there&#39;ll be at least _one_ country where the</div><div class='line' id='LC9421'>mechanic&#39;s average wage will be _two hundred_ cents a day!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9422'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9423'>It knocked them absolutely dumb!  Not a man of them could get</div><div class='line' id='LC9424'>his breath for upwards of two minutes.  Then the coal-burner</div><div class='line' id='LC9425'>said prayerfully:</div><div class='line' id='LC9426'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9427'>&quot;Might I but live to see it!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9428'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9429'>&quot;It is the income of an earl!&quot; said Smug.</div><div class='line' id='LC9430'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9431'>&quot;An earl, say ye?&quot; said Dowley; &quot;ye could say more than that and</div><div class='line' id='LC9432'>speak no lie; there&#39;s no earl in the realm of Bagdemagus that hath</div><div class='line' id='LC9433'>an income like to that.  Income of an earl--mf! it&#39;s the income</div><div class='line' id='LC9434'>of an angel!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9435'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9436'>&quot;Now, then, that is what is going to happen as regards wages.</div><div class='line' id='LC9437'>In that remote day, that man will earn, with _one_ week&#39;s work,</div><div class='line' id='LC9438'>that bill of goods which it takes you upwards of _fifty_ weeks to</div><div class='line' id='LC9439'>earn now.  Some other pretty surprising things are going to happen,</div><div class='line' id='LC9440'>too.  Brother Dowley, who is it that determines, every spring,</div><div class='line' id='LC9441'>what the particular wage of each kind of mechanic, laborer, and</div><div class='line' id='LC9442'>servant shall be for that year?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9443'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9444'>&quot;Sometimes the courts, sometimes the town council; but most of all,</div><div class='line' id='LC9445'>the magistrate.  Ye may say, in general terms, it is the magistrate</div><div class='line' id='LC9446'>that fixes the wages.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9447'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9448'>&quot;Doesn&#39;t ask any of those poor devils to _help_ him fix their wages</div><div class='line' id='LC9449'>for them, does he?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9450'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9451'>&quot;Hm!  That _were_ an idea!  The master that&#39;s to pay him the money</div><div class='line' id='LC9452'>is the one that&#39;s rightly concerned in that matter, ye will notice.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9453'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9454'>&quot;Yes--but I thought the other man might have some little trifle</div><div class='line' id='LC9455'>at stake in it, too; and even his wife and children, poor creatures.</div><div class='line' id='LC9456'>The masters are these: nobles, rich men, the prosperous generally.</div><div class='line' id='LC9457'>These few, who do no work, determine what pay the vast hive shall</div><div class='line' id='LC9458'>have who _do_ work.  You see?  They&#39;re a &#39;combine&#39;--a trade union,</div><div class='line' id='LC9459'>to coin a new phrase--who band themselves together to force their</div><div class='line' id='LC9460'>lowly brother to take what they choose to give.  Thirteen hundred</div><div class='line' id='LC9461'>years hence--so says the unwritten law--the &#39;combine&#39; will be the</div><div class='line' id='LC9462'>other way, and then how these fine people&#39;s posterity will fume</div><div class='line' id='LC9463'>and fret and grit their teeth over the insolent tyranny of trade</div><div class='line' id='LC9464'>unions!  Yes, indeed! the magistrate will tranquilly arrange the</div><div class='line' id='LC9465'>wages from now clear away down into the nineteenth century; and</div><div class='line' id='LC9466'>then all of a sudden the wage-earner will consider that a couple</div><div class='line' id='LC9467'>of thousand years or so is enough of this one-sided sort of thing;</div><div class='line' id='LC9468'>and he will rise up and take a hand in fixing his wages himself.</div><div class='line' id='LC9469'>Ah, he will have a long and bitter account of wrong and humiliation</div><div class='line' id='LC9470'>to settle.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9471'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9472'>&quot;Do ye believe--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9473'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9474'>&quot;That he actually will help to fix his own wages?  Yes, indeed.</div><div class='line' id='LC9475'>And he will be strong and able, then.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9476'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9477'>&quot;Brave times, brave times, of a truth!&quot; sneered the prosperous smith.</div><div class='line' id='LC9478'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9479'>&quot;Oh,--and there&#39;s another detail.  In that day, a master may hire</div><div class='line' id='LC9480'>a man for only just one day, or one week, or one month at a time,</div><div class='line' id='LC9481'>if he wants to.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9482'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9483'>&quot;What?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9484'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9485'>&quot;It&#39;s true.  Moreover, a magistrate won&#39;t be able to force a man</div><div class='line' id='LC9486'>to work for a master a whole year on a stretch whether the man</div><div class='line' id='LC9487'>wants to or not.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9488'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9489'>&quot;Will there be _no_ law or sense in that day?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9490'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9491'>&quot;Both of them, Dowley.  In that day a man will be his own property,</div><div class='line' id='LC9492'>not the property of magistrate and master.  And he can leave town</div><div class='line' id='LC9493'>whenever he wants to, if the wages don&#39;t suit him!--and they can&#39;t</div><div class='line' id='LC9494'>put him in the pillory for it.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9495'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9496'>&quot;Perdition catch such an age!&quot; shouted Dowley, in strong indignation.</div><div class='line' id='LC9497'>&quot;An age of dogs, an age barren of reverence for superiors and</div><div class='line' id='LC9498'>respect for authority!  The pillory--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9499'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9500'>&quot;Oh, wait, brother; say no good word for that institution.  I think</div><div class='line' id='LC9501'>the pillory ought to be abolished.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9502'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9503'>&quot;A most strange idea.  Why?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9504'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9505'>&quot;Well, I&#39;ll tell you why.  Is a man ever put in the pillory for</div><div class='line' id='LC9506'>a capital crime?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9507'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9508'>&quot;No.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9509'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9510'>&quot;Is it right to condemn a man to a slight punishment for a small</div><div class='line' id='LC9511'>offense and then kill him?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9512'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9513'>There was no answer.  I had scored my first point!  For the first</div><div class='line' id='LC9514'>time, the smith wasn&#39;t up and ready.  The company noticed it.</div><div class='line' id='LC9515'>Good effect.</div><div class='line' id='LC9516'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9517'>&quot;You don&#39;t answer, brother.  You were about to glorify the pillory</div><div class='line' id='LC9518'>a while ago, and shed some pity on a future age that isn&#39;t going</div><div class='line' id='LC9519'>to use it.  I think the pillory ought to be abolished.  What</div><div class='line' id='LC9520'>usually happens when a poor fellow is put in the pillory for some</div><div class='line' id='LC9521'>little offense that didn&#39;t amount to anything in the world?  The</div><div class='line' id='LC9522'>mob try to have some fun with him, don&#39;t they?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9523'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9524'>&quot;Yes.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9525'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9526'>&quot;They begin by clodding him; and they laugh themselves to pieces</div><div class='line' id='LC9527'>to see him try to dodge one clod and get hit with another?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9528'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9529'>&quot;Yes.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9530'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9531'>&quot;Then they throw dead cats at him, don&#39;t they?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9532'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9533'>&quot;Yes.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9534'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9535'>&quot;Well, then, suppose he has a few personal enemies in that mob</div><div class='line' id='LC9536'>and here and there a man or a woman with a secret grudge against</div><div class='line' id='LC9537'>him--and suppose especially that he is unpopular in the community,</div><div class='line' id='LC9538'>for his pride, or his prosperity, or one thing or another--stones</div><div class='line' id='LC9539'>and bricks take the place of clods and cats presently, don&#39;t they?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9540'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9541'>&quot;There is no doubt of it.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9542'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9543'>&quot;As a rule he is crippled for life, isn&#39;t he?--jaws broken, teeth</div><div class='line' id='LC9544'>smashed out?--or legs mutilated, gangrened, presently cut off?</div><div class='line' id='LC9545'>--or an eye knocked out, maybe both eyes?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9546'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9547'>&quot;It is true, God knoweth it.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9548'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9549'>&quot;And if he is unpopular he can depend on _dying_, right there in</div><div class='line' id='LC9550'>the stocks, can&#39;t he?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9551'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9552'>&quot;He surely can!  One may not deny it.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9553'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9554'>&quot;I take it none of _you_ are unpopular--by reason of pride or</div><div class='line' id='LC9555'>insolence, or conspicuous prosperity, or any of those things that</div><div class='line' id='LC9556'>excite envy and malice among the base scum of a village?  _You_</div><div class='line' id='LC9557'>wouldn&#39;t think it much of a risk to take a chance in the stocks?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9558'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9559'>Dowley winced, visibly.  I judged he was hit.  But he didn&#39;t betray</div><div class='line' id='LC9560'>it by any spoken word.  As for the others, they spoke out plainly,</div><div class='line' id='LC9561'>and with strong feeling.  They said they had seen enough of the</div><div class='line' id='LC9562'>stocks to know what a man&#39;s chance in them was, and they would</div><div class='line' id='LC9563'>never consent to enter them if they could compromise on a quick</div><div class='line' id='LC9564'>death by hanging.</div><div class='line' id='LC9565'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9566'>&quot;Well, to change the subject--for I think I&#39;ve established my</div><div class='line' id='LC9567'>point that the stocks ought to be abolished.  I think some of our</div><div class='line' id='LC9568'>laws are pretty unfair.  For instance, if I do a thing which ought</div><div class='line' id='LC9569'>to deliver me to the stocks, and you know I did it and yet keep</div><div class='line' id='LC9570'>still and don&#39;t report me, _you_ will get the stocks if anybody</div><div class='line' id='LC9571'>informs on you.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9572'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9573'>&quot;Ah, but that would serve you but right,&quot; said Dowley, &quot;for you</div><div class='line' id='LC9574'>_must_ inform.  So saith the law.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9575'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9576'>The others coincided.</div><div class='line' id='LC9577'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9578'>&quot;Well, all right, let it go, since you vote me down.  But there&#39;s</div><div class='line' id='LC9579'>one thing which certainly isn&#39;t fair.  The magistrate fixes a</div><div class='line' id='LC9580'>mechanic&#39;s wage at one cent a day, for instance.  The law says that</div><div class='line' id='LC9581'>if any master shall venture, even under utmost press of business,</div><div class='line' id='LC9582'>to pay anything _over_ that cent a day, even for a single day, he</div><div class='line' id='LC9583'>shall be both fined and pilloried for it; and whoever knows he did</div><div class='line' id='LC9584'>it and doesn&#39;t inform, they also shall be fined and pilloried.  Now</div><div class='line' id='LC9585'>it seems to me unfair, Dowley, and a deadly peril to all of us,</div><div class='line' id='LC9586'>that because you thoughtlessly confessed, a while ago, that within</div><div class='line' id='LC9587'>a week you have paid a cent and fifteen mil--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9588'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9589'>Oh, I tell _you_ it was a smasher!  You ought to have seen them to</div><div class='line' id='LC9590'>go to pieces, the whole gang.  I had just slipped up on poor</div><div class='line' id='LC9591'>smiling and complacent Dowley so nice and easy and softly, that</div><div class='line' id='LC9592'>he never suspected anything was going to happen till the blow</div><div class='line' id='LC9593'>came crashing down and knocked him all to rags.</div><div class='line' id='LC9594'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9595'>A fine effect.  In fact, as fine as any I ever produced, with so</div><div class='line' id='LC9596'>little time to work it up in.</div><div class='line' id='LC9597'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9598'>But I saw in a moment that I had overdone the thing a little.</div><div class='line' id='LC9599'>I was expecting to scare them, but I wasn&#39;t expecting to scare</div><div class='line' id='LC9600'>them to death.  They were mighty near it, though.  You see they</div><div class='line' id='LC9601'>had been a whole lifetime learning to appreciate the pillory; and</div><div class='line' id='LC9602'>to have that thing staring them in the face, and every one of them</div><div class='line' id='LC9603'>distinctly at the mercy of me, a stranger, if I chose to go and</div><div class='line' id='LC9604'>report--well, it was awful, and they couldn&#39;t seem to recover</div><div class='line' id='LC9605'>from the shock, they couldn&#39;t seem to pull themselves together.</div><div class='line' id='LC9606'>Pale, shaky, dumb, pitiful?  Why, they weren&#39;t any better than</div><div class='line' id='LC9607'>so many dead men.  It was very uncomfortable.  Of course, I thought</div><div class='line' id='LC9608'>they would appeal to me to keep mum, and then we would shake hands,</div><div class='line' id='LC9609'>and take a drink all round, and laugh it off, and there an end.</div><div class='line' id='LC9610'>But no; you see I was an unknown person, among a cruelly oppressed</div><div class='line' id='LC9611'>and suspicious people, a people always accustomed to having advantage</div><div class='line' id='LC9612'>taken of their helplessness, and never expecting just or kind</div><div class='line' id='LC9613'>treatment from any but their own families and very closest intimates.</div><div class='line' id='LC9614'>Appeal to _me_ to be gentle, to be fair, to be generous?  Of course,</div><div class='line' id='LC9615'>they wanted to, but they couldn&#39;t dare.</div><div class='line' id='LC9616'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9617'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9618'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9619'>CHAPTER XXXIV</div><div class='line' id='LC9620'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9621'>THE YANKEE AND THE KING SOLD AS SLAVES</div><div class='line' id='LC9622'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9623'>Well, what had I better do?  Nothing in a hurry, sure.  I must</div><div class='line' id='LC9624'>get up a diversion; anything to employ me while I could think,</div><div class='line' id='LC9625'>and while these poor fellows could have a chance to come to life</div><div class='line' id='LC9626'>again.  There sat Marco, petrified in the act of trying to get</div><div class='line' id='LC9627'>the hang of his miller-gun--turned to stone, just in the attitude</div><div class='line' id='LC9628'>he was in when my pile-driver fell, the toy still gripped in his</div><div class='line' id='LC9629'>unconscious fingers.  So I took it from him and proposed to explain</div><div class='line' id='LC9630'>its mystery.  Mystery! a simple little thing like that; and yet it</div><div class='line' id='LC9631'>was mysterious enough, for that race and that age.</div><div class='line' id='LC9632'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9633'>I never saw such an awkward people, with machinery; you see, they</div><div class='line' id='LC9634'>were totally unused to it.  The miller-gun was a little double-barreled</div><div class='line' id='LC9635'>tube of toughened glass, with a neat little trick of a spring</div><div class='line' id='LC9636'>to it, which upon pressure would let a shot escape.  But the shot</div><div class='line' id='LC9637'>wouldn&#39;t hurt anybody, it would only drop into your hand.  In the</div><div class='line' id='LC9638'>gun were two sizes--wee mustard-seed shot, and another sort that</div><div class='line' id='LC9639'>were several times larger.  They were money.  The mustard-seed</div><div class='line' id='LC9640'>shot represented milrays, the larger ones mills.  So the gun was</div><div class='line' id='LC9641'>a purse; and very handy, too; you could pay out money in the dark</div><div class='line' id='LC9642'>with it, with accuracy; and you could carry it in your mouth; or</div><div class='line' id='LC9643'>in your vest pocket, if you had one.  I made them of several sizes</div><div class='line' id='LC9644'>--one size so large that it would carry the equivalent of a dollar.</div><div class='line' id='LC9645'>Using shot for money was a good thing for the government; the metal</div><div class='line' id='LC9646'>cost nothing, and the money couldn&#39;t be counterfeited, for I was</div><div class='line' id='LC9647'>the only person in the kingdom who knew how to manage a shot tower.</div><div class='line' id='LC9648'>&quot;Paying the shot&quot; soon came to be a common phrase.  Yes, and I knew</div><div class='line' id='LC9649'>it would still be passing men&#39;s lips, away down in the nineteenth</div><div class='line' id='LC9650'>century, yet none would suspect how and when it originated.</div><div class='line' id='LC9651'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9652'>The king joined us, about this time, mightily refreshed by his nap,</div><div class='line' id='LC9653'>and feeling good.  Anything could make me nervous now, I was so</div><div class='line' id='LC9654'>uneasy--for our lives were in danger; and so it worried me to</div><div class='line' id='LC9655'>detect a complacent something in the king&#39;s eye which seemed to</div><div class='line' id='LC9656'>indicate that he had been loading himself up for a performance</div><div class='line' id='LC9657'>of some kind or other; confound it, why must he go and choose</div><div class='line' id='LC9658'>such a time as this?</div><div class='line' id='LC9659'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9660'>I was right.  He began, straight off, in the most innocently</div><div class='line' id='LC9661'>artful, and transparent, and lubberly way, to lead up to the</div><div class='line' id='LC9662'>subject of agriculture.  The cold sweat broke out all over me.</div><div class='line' id='LC9663'>I wanted to whisper in his ear, &quot;Man, we are in awful danger!</div><div class='line' id='LC9664'>every moment is worth a principality till we get back these men&#39;s</div><div class='line' id='LC9665'>confidence; _don&#39;t_ waste any of this golden time.&quot;  But of course</div><div class='line' id='LC9666'>I couldn&#39;t do it.  Whisper to him?  It would look as if we were</div><div class='line' id='LC9667'>conspiring.  So I had to sit there and look calm and pleasant while</div><div class='line' id='LC9668'>the king stood over that dynamite mine and mooned along about his</div><div class='line' id='LC9669'>damned onions and things.  At first the tumult of my own thoughts,</div><div class='line' id='LC9670'>summoned by the danger-signal and swarming to the rescue from</div><div class='line' id='LC9671'>every quarter of my skull, kept up such a hurrah and confusion</div><div class='line' id='LC9672'>and fifing and drumming that I couldn&#39;t take in a word; but</div><div class='line' id='LC9673'>presently when my mob of gathering plans began to crystallize</div><div class='line' id='LC9674'>and fall into position and form line of battle, a sort of order and</div><div class='line' id='LC9675'>quiet ensued and I caught the boom of the king&#39;s batteries, as if</div><div class='line' id='LC9676'>out of remote distance:</div><div class='line' id='LC9677'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9678'>&quot;--were not the best way, methinks, albeit it is not to be denied</div><div class='line' id='LC9679'>that authorities differ as concerning this point, some contending</div><div class='line' id='LC9680'>that the onion is but an unwholesome berry when stricken early</div><div class='line' id='LC9681'>from the tree--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9682'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9683'>The audience showed signs of life, and sought each other&#39;s eyes</div><div class='line' id='LC9684'>in a surprised and troubled way.</div><div class='line' id='LC9685'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9686'>&quot;--whileas others do yet maintain, with much show of reason, that</div><div class='line' id='LC9687'>this is not of necessity the case, instancing that plums and other</div><div class='line' id='LC9688'>like cereals do be always dug in the unripe state--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9689'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9690'>The audience exhibited distinct distress; yes, and also fear.</div><div class='line' id='LC9691'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9692'>&quot;--yet are they clearly wholesome, the more especially when one</div><div class='line' id='LC9693'>doth assuage the asperities of their nature by admixture of the</div><div class='line' id='LC9694'>tranquilizing juice of the wayward cabbage--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9695'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9696'>The wild light of terror began to glow in these men&#39;s eyes, and</div><div class='line' id='LC9697'>one of them muttered, &quot;These be errors, every one--God hath surely</div><div class='line' id='LC9698'>smitten the mind of this farmer.&quot;  I was in miserable apprehension;</div><div class='line' id='LC9699'>I sat upon thorns.</div><div class='line' id='LC9700'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9701'>&quot;--and further instancing the known truth that in the case of</div><div class='line' id='LC9702'>animals, the young, which may be called the green fruit of the</div><div class='line' id='LC9703'>creature, is the better, all confessing that when a goat is ripe,</div><div class='line' id='LC9704'>his fur doth heat and sore engame his flesh, the which defect,</div><div class='line' id='LC9705'>taken in connection with his several rancid habits, and fulsome</div><div class='line' id='LC9706'>appetites, and godless attitudes of mind, and bilious quality</div><div class='line' id='LC9707'>of morals--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9708'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9709'>They rose and went for him!  With a fierce shout, &quot;The one would</div><div class='line' id='LC9710'>betray us, the other is mad!  Kill them!  Kill them!&quot; they flung</div><div class='line' id='LC9711'>themselves upon us.  What joy flamed up in the king&#39;s eye!  He</div><div class='line' id='LC9712'>might be lame in agriculture, but this kind of thing was just in</div><div class='line' id='LC9713'>his line.  He had been fasting long, he was hungry for a fight.</div><div class='line' id='LC9714'>He hit the blacksmith a crack under the jaw that lifted him clear</div><div class='line' id='LC9715'>off his feet and stretched him flat on his back.  &quot;St. George for</div><div class='line' id='LC9716'>Britain!&quot; and he downed the wheelwright.  The mason was big, but</div><div class='line' id='LC9717'>I laid him out like nothing.  The three gathered themselves up and</div><div class='line' id='LC9718'>came again; went down again; came again; and kept on repeating</div><div class='line' id='LC9719'>this, with native British pluck, until they were battered to jelly,</div><div class='line' id='LC9720'>reeling with exhaustion, and so blind that they couldn&#39;t tell us</div><div class='line' id='LC9721'>from each other; and yet they kept right on, hammering away with</div><div class='line' id='LC9722'>what might was left in them.  Hammering each other--for we stepped</div><div class='line' id='LC9723'>aside and looked on while they rolled, and struggled, and gouged,</div><div class='line' id='LC9724'>and pounded, and bit, with the strict and wordless attention to</div><div class='line' id='LC9725'>business of so many bulldogs.  We looked on without apprehension,</div><div class='line' id='LC9726'>for they were fast getting past ability to go for help against us,</div><div class='line' id='LC9727'>and the arena was far enough from the public road to be safe</div><div class='line' id='LC9728'>from intrusion.</div><div class='line' id='LC9729'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9730'>Well, while they were gradually playing out, it suddenly occurred</div><div class='line' id='LC9731'>to me to wonder what had become of Marco.  I looked around; he</div><div class='line' id='LC9732'>was nowhere to be seen.  Oh, but this was ominous!  I pulled the</div><div class='line' id='LC9733'>king&#39;s sleeve, and we glided away and rushed for the hut.  No Marco</div><div class='line' id='LC9734'>there, no Phyllis there!  They had gone to the road for help, sure.</div><div class='line' id='LC9735'>I told the king to give his heels wings, and I would explain later.</div><div class='line' id='LC9736'>We made good time across the open ground, and as we darted into</div><div class='line' id='LC9737'>the shelter of the wood I glanced back and saw a mob of excited</div><div class='line' id='LC9738'>peasants swarm into view, with Marco and his wife at their head.</div><div class='line' id='LC9739'>They were making a world of noise, but that couldn&#39;t hurt anybody;</div><div class='line' id='LC9740'>the wood was dense, and as soon as we were well into its depths</div><div class='line' id='LC9741'>we would take to a tree and let them whistle.  Ah, but then came</div><div class='line' id='LC9742'>another sound--dogs!  Yes, that was quite another matter.  It</div><div class='line' id='LC9743'>magnified our contract--we must find running water.</div><div class='line' id='LC9744'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9745'>We tore along at a good gait, and soon left the sounds far behind</div><div class='line' id='LC9746'>and modified to a murmur.  We struck a stream and darted into it.</div><div class='line' id='LC9747'>We waded swiftly down it, in the dim forest light, for as much</div><div class='line' id='LC9748'>as three hundred yards, and then came across an oak with a great</div><div class='line' id='LC9749'>bough sticking out over the water.  We climbed up on this bough,</div><div class='line' id='LC9750'>and began to work our way along it to the body of the tree; now</div><div class='line' id='LC9751'>we began to hear those sounds more plainly; so the mob had struck</div><div class='line' id='LC9752'>our trail.  For a while the sounds approached pretty fast.  And</div><div class='line' id='LC9753'>then for another while they didn&#39;t.  No doubt the dogs had found</div><div class='line' id='LC9754'>the place where we had entered the stream, and were now waltzing</div><div class='line' id='LC9755'>up and down the shores trying to pick up the trail again.</div><div class='line' id='LC9756'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9757'>When we were snugly lodged in the tree and curtained with foliage,</div><div class='line' id='LC9758'>the king was satisfied, but I was doubtful.  I believed we could</div><div class='line' id='LC9759'>crawl along a branch and get into the next tree, and I judged it</div><div class='line' id='LC9760'>worth while to try.  We tried it, and made a success of it, though</div><div class='line' id='LC9761'>the king slipped, at the junction, and came near failing to connect.</div><div class='line' id='LC9762'>We got comfortable lodgment and satisfactory concealment among</div><div class='line' id='LC9763'>the foliage, and then we had nothing to do but listen to the hunt.</div><div class='line' id='LC9764'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9765'>Presently we heard it coming--and coming on the jump, too; yes,</div><div class='line' id='LC9766'>and down both sides of the stream.  Louder--louder--next minute</div><div class='line' id='LC9767'>it swelled swiftly up into a roar of shoutings, barkings, tramplings,</div><div class='line' id='LC9768'>and swept by like a cyclone.</div><div class='line' id='LC9769'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9770'>&quot;I was afraid that the overhanging branch would suggest something</div><div class='line' id='LC9771'>to them,&quot; said I, &quot;but I don&#39;t mind the disappointment.  Come,</div><div class='line' id='LC9772'>my liege, it were well that we make good use of our time.  We&#39;ve</div><div class='line' id='LC9773'>flanked them.  Dark is coming on, presently.  If we can cross the</div><div class='line' id='LC9774'>stream and get a good start, and borrow a couple of horses from</div><div class='line' id='LC9775'>somebody&#39;s pasture to use for a few hours, we shall be safe enough.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9776'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9777'>We started down, and got nearly to the lowest limb, when we seemed</div><div class='line' id='LC9778'>to hear the hunt returning.  We stopped to listen.</div><div class='line' id='LC9779'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9780'>&quot;Yes,&quot; said I, &quot;they&#39;re baffled, they&#39;ve given it up, they&#39;re on</div><div class='line' id='LC9781'>their way home.  We will climb back to our roost again, and let</div><div class='line' id='LC9782'>them go by.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9783'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9784'>So we climbed back.  The king listened a moment and said:</div><div class='line' id='LC9785'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9786'>&quot;They still search--I wit the sign.  We did best to abide.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9787'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9788'>He was right.  He knew more about hunting than I did.  The noise</div><div class='line' id='LC9789'>approached steadily, but not with a rush.  The king said:</div><div class='line' id='LC9790'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9791'>&quot;They reason that we were advantaged by no parlous start of them,</div><div class='line' id='LC9792'>and being on foot are as yet no mighty way from where we took</div><div class='line' id='LC9793'>the water.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9794'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9795'>&quot;Yes, sire, that is about it, I am afraid, though I was hoping</div><div class='line' id='LC9796'>better things.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9797'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9798'>The noise drew nearer and nearer, and soon the van was drifting</div><div class='line' id='LC9799'>under us, on both sides of the water.  A voice called a halt from</div><div class='line' id='LC9800'>the other bank, and said:</div><div class='line' id='LC9801'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9802'>&quot;An they were so minded, they could get to yon tree by this branch</div><div class='line' id='LC9803'>that overhangs, and yet not touch ground.  Ye will do well to send</div><div class='line' id='LC9804'>a man up it.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9805'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9806'>&quot;Marry, that we will do!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9807'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9808'>I was obliged to admire my cuteness in foreseeing this very thing</div><div class='line' id='LC9809'>and swapping trees to beat it.  But, don&#39;t you know, there are</div><div class='line' id='LC9810'>some things that can beat smartness and foresight?  Awkwardness</div><div class='line' id='LC9811'>and stupidity can.  The best swordsman in the world doesn&#39;t need</div><div class='line' id='LC9812'>to fear the second best swordsman in the world; no, the person</div><div class='line' id='LC9813'>for him to be afraid of is some ignorant antagonist who has never</div><div class='line' id='LC9814'>had a sword in his hand before; he doesn&#39;t do the thing he ought</div><div class='line' id='LC9815'>to do, and so the expert isn&#39;t prepared for him; he does the thing</div><div class='line' id='LC9816'>he ought not to do; and often it catches the expert out and ends</div><div class='line' id='LC9817'>him on the spot.  Well, how could I, with all my gifts, make any</div><div class='line' id='LC9818'>valuable preparation against a near-sighted, cross-eyed, pudding-headed</div><div class='line' id='LC9819'>clown who would aim himself at the wrong tree and hit the right</div><div class='line' id='LC9820'>one?  And that is what he did.  He went for the wrong tree, which</div><div class='line' id='LC9821'>was, of course, the right one by mistake, and up he started.</div><div class='line' id='LC9822'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9823'>Matters were serious now.  We remained still, and awaited developments.</div><div class='line' id='LC9824'>The peasant toiled his difficult way up.  The king raised himself</div><div class='line' id='LC9825'>up and stood; he made a leg ready, and when the comer&#39;s head</div><div class='line' id='LC9826'>arrived in reach of it there was a dull thud, and down went the man</div><div class='line' id='LC9827'>floundering to the ground.  There was a wild outbreak of anger</div><div class='line' id='LC9828'>below, and the mob swarmed in from all around, and there we were</div><div class='line' id='LC9829'>treed, and prisoners.  Another man started up; the bridging bough</div><div class='line' id='LC9830'>was detected, and a volunteer started up the tree that furnished</div><div class='line' id='LC9831'>the bridge.  The king ordered me to play Horatius and keep the</div><div class='line' id='LC9832'>bridge.  For a while the enemy came thick and fast; but no matter,</div><div class='line' id='LC9833'>the head man of each procession always got a buffet that dislodged</div><div class='line' id='LC9834'>him as soon as he came in reach.  The king&#39;s spirits rose, his joy</div><div class='line' id='LC9835'>was limitless.  He said that if nothing occurred to mar the prospect</div><div class='line' id='LC9836'>we should have a beautiful night, for on this line of tactics we</div><div class='line' id='LC9837'>could hold the tree against the whole country-side.</div><div class='line' id='LC9838'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9839'>However, the mob soon came to that conclusion themselves; wherefore</div><div class='line' id='LC9840'>they called off the assault and began to debate other plans.</div><div class='line' id='LC9841'>They had no weapons, but there were plenty of stones, and stones</div><div class='line' id='LC9842'>might answer.  We had no objections.  A stone might possibly</div><div class='line' id='LC9843'>penetrate to us once in a while, but it wasn&#39;t very likely; we were</div><div class='line' id='LC9844'>well protected by boughs and foliage, and were not visible from</div><div class='line' id='LC9845'>any good aiming point.  If they would but waste half an hour in</div><div class='line' id='LC9846'>stone-throwing, the dark would come to our help.  We were feeling</div><div class='line' id='LC9847'>very well satisfied.  We could smile; almost laugh.</div><div class='line' id='LC9848'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9849'>But we didn&#39;t; which was just as well, for we should have been</div><div class='line' id='LC9850'>interrupted.  Before the stones had been raging through the leaves</div><div class='line' id='LC9851'>and bouncing from the boughs fifteen minutes, we began to notice</div><div class='line' id='LC9852'>a smell.  A couple of sniffs of it was enough of an explanation</div><div class='line' id='LC9853'>--it was smoke!  Our game was up at last.  We recognized that.  When</div><div class='line' id='LC9854'>smoke invites you, you have to come.  They raised their pile of</div><div class='line' id='LC9855'>dry brush and damp weeds higher and higher, and when they saw</div><div class='line' id='LC9856'>the thick cloud begin to roll up and smother the tree, they broke</div><div class='line' id='LC9857'>out in a storm of joy-clamors.  I got enough breath to say:</div><div class='line' id='LC9858'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9859'>&quot;Proceed, my liege; after you is manners.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9860'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9861'>The king gasped:</div><div class='line' id='LC9862'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9863'>&quot;Follow me down, and then back thyself against one side of the</div><div class='line' id='LC9864'>trunk, and leave me the other.  Then will we fight.  Let each pile</div><div class='line' id='LC9865'>his dead according to his own fashion and taste.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9866'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9867'>Then he descended, barking and coughing, and I followed.  I struck</div><div class='line' id='LC9868'>the ground an instant after him; we sprang to our appointed places,</div><div class='line' id='LC9869'>and began to give and take with all our might.  The powwow and</div><div class='line' id='LC9870'>racket were prodigious; it was a tempest of riot and confusion and</div><div class='line' id='LC9871'>thick-falling blows.  Suddenly some horsemen tore into the midst</div><div class='line' id='LC9872'>of the crowd, and a voice shouted:</div><div class='line' id='LC9873'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9874'>&quot;Hold--or ye are dead men!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9875'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9876'>How good it sounded!  The owner of the voice bore all the marks of</div><div class='line' id='LC9877'>a gentleman: picturesque and costly raiment, the aspect of command,</div><div class='line' id='LC9878'>a hard countenance, with complexion and features marred by dissipation.</div><div class='line' id='LC9879'>The mob fell humbly back, like so many spaniels.  The gentleman</div><div class='line' id='LC9880'>inspected us critically, then said sharply to the peasants:</div><div class='line' id='LC9881'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9882'>&quot;What are ye doing to these people?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9883'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9884'>&quot;They be madmen, worshipful sir, that have come wandering we know</div><div class='line' id='LC9885'>not whence, and--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9886'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9887'>&quot;Ye know not whence?  Do ye pretend ye know them not?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9888'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9889'>&quot;Most honored sir, we speak but the truth.  They are strangers</div><div class='line' id='LC9890'>and unknown to any in this region; and they be the most violent</div><div class='line' id='LC9891'>and bloodthirsty madmen that ever--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9892'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9893'>&quot;Peace!  Ye know not what ye say.  They are not mad.  Who are ye?</div><div class='line' id='LC9894'>And whence are ye?  Explain.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9895'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9896'>&quot;We are but peaceful strangers, sir,&quot; I said, &quot;and traveling upon</div><div class='line' id='LC9897'>our own concerns.  We are from a far country, and unacquainted</div><div class='line' id='LC9898'>here.  We have purposed no harm; and yet but for your brave</div><div class='line' id='LC9899'>interference and protection these people would have killed us.</div><div class='line' id='LC9900'>As you have divined, sir, we are not mad; neither are we violent</div><div class='line' id='LC9901'>or bloodthirsty.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9902'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9903'>The gentleman turned to his retinue and said calmly: &quot;Lash me</div><div class='line' id='LC9904'>these animals to their kennels!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9905'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9906'>The mob vanished in an instant; and after them plunged the horsemen,</div><div class='line' id='LC9907'>laying about them with their whips and pitilessly riding down such</div><div class='line' id='LC9908'>as were witless enough to keep the road instead of taking to the</div><div class='line' id='LC9909'>bush.  The shrieks and supplications presently died away in the</div><div class='line' id='LC9910'>distance, and soon the horsemen began to straggle back.  Meantime</div><div class='line' id='LC9911'>the gentleman had been questioning us more closely, but had dug</div><div class='line' id='LC9912'>no particulars out of us.  We were lavish of recognition of the</div><div class='line' id='LC9913'>service he was doing us, but we revealed nothing more than that we</div><div class='line' id='LC9914'>were friendless strangers from a far country.  When the escort were</div><div class='line' id='LC9915'>all returned, the gentleman said to one of his servants:</div><div class='line' id='LC9916'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9917'>&quot;Bring the led-horses and mount these people.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9918'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9919'>&quot;Yes, my lord.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9920'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9921'>We were placed toward the rear, among the servants.  We traveled</div><div class='line' id='LC9922'>pretty fast, and finally drew rein some time after dark at a</div><div class='line' id='LC9923'>roadside inn some ten or twelve miles from the scene of our</div><div class='line' id='LC9924'>troubles.  My lord went immediately to his room, after ordering</div><div class='line' id='LC9925'>his supper, and we saw no more of him.  At dawn in the morning</div><div class='line' id='LC9926'>we breakfasted and made ready to start.</div><div class='line' id='LC9927'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9928'>My lord&#39;s chief attendant sauntered forward at that moment with</div><div class='line' id='LC9929'>indolent grace, and said:</div><div class='line' id='LC9930'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9931'>&quot;Ye have said ye should continue upon this road, which is our</div><div class='line' id='LC9932'>direction likewise; wherefore my lord, the earl Grip, hath given</div><div class='line' id='LC9933'>commandment that ye retain the horses and ride, and that certain</div><div class='line' id='LC9934'>of us ride with ye a twenty mile to a fair town that hight Cambenet,</div><div class='line' id='LC9935'>whenso ye shall be out of peril.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9936'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9937'>We could do nothing less than express our thanks and accept the</div><div class='line' id='LC9938'>offer.  We jogged along, six in the party, at a moderate and</div><div class='line' id='LC9939'>comfortable gait, and in conversation learned that my lord Grip</div><div class='line' id='LC9940'>was a very great personage in his own region, which lay a day&#39;s</div><div class='line' id='LC9941'>journey beyond Cambenet.  We loitered to such a degree that it was</div><div class='line' id='LC9942'>near the middle of the forenoon when we entered the market square</div><div class='line' id='LC9943'>of the town.  We dismounted, and left our thanks once more for</div><div class='line' id='LC9944'>my lord, and then approached a crowd assembled in the center of</div><div class='line' id='LC9945'>the square, to see what might be the object of interest.  It was the</div><div class='line' id='LC9946'>remnant of that old peregrinating band of slaves!  So they had</div><div class='line' id='LC9947'>been dragging their chains about, all this weary time.  That poor</div><div class='line' id='LC9948'>husband was gone, and also many others; and some few purchases</div><div class='line' id='LC9949'>had been added to the gang.  The king was not interested, and</div><div class='line' id='LC9950'>wanted to move along, but I was absorbed, and full of pity.  I could</div><div class='line' id='LC9951'>not take my eyes away from these worn and wasted wrecks of humanity.</div><div class='line' id='LC9952'>There they sat, grounded upon the ground, silent, uncomplaining,</div><div class='line' id='LC9953'>with bowed heads, a pathetic sight.  And by hideous contrast, a</div><div class='line' id='LC9954'>redundant orator was making a speech to another gathering not thirty</div><div class='line' id='LC9955'>steps away, in fulsome laudation of &quot;our glorious British liberties!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9956'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9957'>I was boiling.  I had forgotten I was a plebeian, I was remembering</div><div class='line' id='LC9958'>I was a man.  Cost what it might, I would mount that rostrum and--</div><div class='line' id='LC9959'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9960'>Click! the king and I were handcuffed together!  Our companions,</div><div class='line' id='LC9961'>those servants, had done it; my lord Grip stood looking on.  The</div><div class='line' id='LC9962'>king burst out in a fury, and said:</div><div class='line' id='LC9963'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9964'>&quot;What meaneth this ill-mannered jest?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9965'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9966'>My lord merely said to his head miscreant, coolly:</div><div class='line' id='LC9967'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9968'>&quot;Put up the slaves and sell them!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9969'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9970'>_Slaves!_  The word had a new sound--and how unspeakably awful!  The</div><div class='line' id='LC9971'>king lifted his manacles and brought them down with a deadly force;</div><div class='line' id='LC9972'>but my lord was out of the way when they arrived.  A dozen of</div><div class='line' id='LC9973'>the rascal&#39;s servants sprang forward, and in a moment we were</div><div class='line' id='LC9974'>helpless, with our hands bound behind us.  We so loudly and so</div><div class='line' id='LC9975'>earnestly proclaimed ourselves freemen, that we got the interested</div><div class='line' id='LC9976'>attention of that liberty-mouthing orator and his patriotic crowd,</div><div class='line' id='LC9977'>and they gathered about us and assumed a very determined attitude.</div><div class='line' id='LC9978'>The orator said:</div><div class='line' id='LC9979'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9980'>&quot;If, indeed, ye are freemen, ye have nought to fear--the God-given</div><div class='line' id='LC9981'>liberties of Britain are about ye for your shield and shelter!</div><div class='line' id='LC9982'>(Applause.)  Ye shall soon see.
