Bring forth your proofs.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9983'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9984'>&quot;What proofs?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9985'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9986'>&quot;Proof that ye are freemen.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9987'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9988'>Ah--I remembered!  I came to myself; I said nothing.  But the</div><div class='line' id='LC9989'>king stormed out:</div><div class='line' id='LC9990'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9991'>&quot;Thou&#39;rt insane, man.  It were better, and more in reason, that</div><div class='line' id='LC9992'>this thief and scoundrel here prove that we are _not_ freemen.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC9993'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9994'>You see, he knew his own laws just as other people so often know</div><div class='line' id='LC9995'>the laws; by words, not by effects.  They take a _meaning_, and get</div><div class='line' id='LC9996'>to be very vivid, when you come to apply them to yourself.</div><div class='line' id='LC9997'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC9998'>All hands shook their heads and looked disappointed; some turned</div><div class='line' id='LC9999'>away, no longer interested.  The orator said--and this time in the</div><div class='line' id='LC10000'>tones of business, not of sentiment:</div><div class='line' id='LC10001'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10002'>&quot;An ye do not know your country&#39;s laws, it were time ye learned</div><div class='line' id='LC10003'>them.  Ye are strangers to us; ye will not deny that. Ye may be</div><div class='line' id='LC10004'>freemen, we do not deny that; but also ye may be slaves.  The law</div><div class='line' id='LC10005'>is clear: it doth not require the claimant to prove ye are slaves,</div><div class='line' id='LC10006'>it requireth you to prove ye are not.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10007'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10008'>I said:</div><div class='line' id='LC10009'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10010'>&quot;Dear sir, give us only time to send to Astolat; or give us only</div><div class='line' id='LC10011'>time to send to the Valley of Holiness--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10012'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10013'>&quot;Peace, good man, these are extraordinary requests, and you may</div><div class='line' id='LC10014'>not hope to have them granted.  It would cost much time, and would</div><div class='line' id='LC10015'>unwarrantably inconvenience your master--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10016'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10017'>&quot;_Master_, idiot!&quot; stormed the king.  &quot;I have no master, I myself</div><div class='line' id='LC10018'>am the m--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10019'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10020'>&quot;Silence, for God&#39;s sake!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10021'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10022'>I got the words out in time to stop the king.  We were in trouble</div><div class='line' id='LC10023'>enough already; it could not help us any to give these people</div><div class='line' id='LC10024'>the notion that we were lunatics.</div><div class='line' id='LC10025'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10026'>There is no use in stringing out the details.  The earl put us up</div><div class='line' id='LC10027'>and sold us at auction.  This same infernal law had existed in</div><div class='line' id='LC10028'>our own South in my own time, more than thirteen hundred years</div><div class='line' id='LC10029'>later, and under it hundreds of freemen who could not prove that</div><div class='line' id='LC10030'>they were freemen had been sold into lifelong slavery without</div><div class='line' id='LC10031'>the circumstance making any particular impression upon me; but the</div><div class='line' id='LC10032'>minute law and the auction block came into my personal experience,</div><div class='line' id='LC10033'>a thing which had been merely improper before became suddenly</div><div class='line' id='LC10034'>hellish.  Well, that&#39;s the way we are made.</div><div class='line' id='LC10035'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10036'>Yes, we were sold at auction, like swine.  In a big town and an</div><div class='line' id='LC10037'>active market we should have brought a good price; but this place</div><div class='line' id='LC10038'>was utterly stagnant and so we sold at a figure which makes me</div><div class='line' id='LC10039'>ashamed, every time I think of it.  The King of England brought</div><div class='line' id='LC10040'>seven dollars, and his prime minister nine; whereas the king was</div><div class='line' id='LC10041'>easily worth twelve dollars and I as easily worth fifteen.  But</div><div class='line' id='LC10042'>that is the way things always go; if you force a sale on a dull</div><div class='line' id='LC10043'>market, I don&#39;t care what the property is, you are going to make</div><div class='line' id='LC10044'>a poor business of it, and you can make up your mind to it.  If</div><div class='line' id='LC10045'>the earl had had wit enough to--</div><div class='line' id='LC10046'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10047'>However, there is no occasion for my working my sympathies up</div><div class='line' id='LC10048'>on his account.  Let him go, for the present; I took his number,</div><div class='line' id='LC10049'>so to speak.</div><div class='line' id='LC10050'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10051'>The slave-dealer bought us both, and hitched us onto that long</div><div class='line' id='LC10052'>chain of his, and we constituted the rear of his procession.  We</div><div class='line' id='LC10053'>took up our line of march and passed out of Cambenet at noon;</div><div class='line' id='LC10054'>and it seemed to me unaccountably strange and odd that the King</div><div class='line' id='LC10055'>of England and his chief minister, marching manacled and fettered</div><div class='line' id='LC10056'>and yoked, in a slave convoy, could move by all manner of idle men</div><div class='line' id='LC10057'>and women, and under windows where sat the sweet and the lovely,</div><div class='line' id='LC10058'>and yet never attract a curious eye, never provoke a single remark.</div><div class='line' id='LC10059'>Dear, dear, it only shows that there is nothing diviner about a king</div><div class='line' id='LC10060'>than there is about a tramp, after all.  He is just a cheap and</div><div class='line' id='LC10061'>hollow artificiality when you don&#39;t know he is a king.  But reveal</div><div class='line' id='LC10062'>his quality, and dear me it takes your very breath away to look</div><div class='line' id='LC10063'>at him.  I reckon we are all fools. Born so, no doubt.</div><div class='line' id='LC10064'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10065'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10066'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10067'>CHAPTER XXXV</div><div class='line' id='LC10068'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10069'>A PITIFUL INCIDENT</div><div class='line' id='LC10070'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10071'>It&#39;s a world of surprises.  The king brooded; this was natural.</div><div class='line' id='LC10072'>What would he brood about, should you say?  Why, about the prodigious</div><div class='line' id='LC10073'>nature of his fall, of course--from the loftiest place in the world</div><div class='line' id='LC10074'>to the lowest; from the most illustrious station in the world to</div><div class='line' id='LC10075'>the obscurest; from the grandest vocation among men to the basest.</div><div class='line' id='LC10076'>No, I take my oath that the thing that graveled him most, to start</div><div class='line' id='LC10077'>with, was not this, but the price he had fetched!  He couldn&#39;t</div><div class='line' id='LC10078'>seem to get over that seven dollars.  Well, it stunned me so, when</div><div class='line' id='LC10079'>I first found it out, that I couldn&#39;t believe it; it didn&#39;t seem</div><div class='line' id='LC10080'>natural.  But as soon as my mental sight cleared and I got a right</div><div class='line' id='LC10081'>focus on it, I saw I was mistaken; it _was_ natural.  For this</div><div class='line' id='LC10082'>reason: a king is a mere artificiality, and so a king&#39;s feelings,</div><div class='line' id='LC10083'>like the impulses of an automatic doll, are mere artificialities;</div><div class='line' id='LC10084'>but as a man, he is a reality, and his feelings, as a man, are</div><div class='line' id='LC10085'>real, not phantoms.  It shames the average man to be valued below</div><div class='line' id='LC10086'>his own estimate of his worth, and the king certainly wasn&#39;t</div><div class='line' id='LC10087'>anything more than an average man, if he was up that high.</div><div class='line' id='LC10088'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10089'>Confound him, he wearied me with arguments to show that in anything</div><div class='line' id='LC10090'>like a fair market he would have fetched twenty-five dollars,</div><div class='line' id='LC10091'>sure--a thing which was plainly nonsense, and full or the baldest</div><div class='line' id='LC10092'>conceit; I wasn&#39;t worth it myself.  But it was tender ground for</div><div class='line' id='LC10093'>me to argue on.  In fact, I had to simply shirk argument and do</div><div class='line' id='LC10094'>the diplomatic instead.  I had to throw conscience aside, and</div><div class='line' id='LC10095'>brazenly concede that he ought to have brought twenty-five dollars;</div><div class='line' id='LC10096'>whereas I was quite well aware that in all the ages, the world had</div><div class='line' id='LC10097'>never seen a king that was worth half the money, and during the</div><div class='line' id='LC10098'>next thirteen centuries wouldn&#39;t see one that was worth the fourth</div><div class='line' id='LC10099'>of it.  Yes, he tired me.  If he began to talk about the crops;</div><div class='line' id='LC10100'>or about the recent weather; or about the condition of politics;</div><div class='line' id='LC10101'>or about dogs, or cats, or morals, or theology--no matter what</div><div class='line' id='LC10102'>--I sighed, for I knew what was coming; he was going to get out of it</div><div class='line' id='LC10103'>a palliation of that tiresome seven-dollar sale.  Wherever we</div><div class='line' id='LC10104'>halted where there was a crowd, he would give me a look which</div><div class='line' id='LC10105'>said plainly: &quot;if that thing could be tried over again now, with</div><div class='line' id='LC10106'>this kind of folk, you would see a different result.&quot;  Well, when</div><div class='line' id='LC10107'>he was first sold, it secretly tickled me to see him go for seven</div><div class='line' id='LC10108'>dollars; but before he was done with his sweating and worrying</div><div class='line' id='LC10109'>I wished he had fetched a hundred.  The thing never got a chance</div><div class='line' id='LC10110'>to die, for every day, at one place or another, possible purchasers</div><div class='line' id='LC10111'>looked us over, and, as often as any other way, their comment on</div><div class='line' id='LC10112'>the king was something like this:</div><div class='line' id='LC10113'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10114'>&quot;Here&#39;s a two-dollar-and-a-half chump with a thirty-dollar style.</div><div class='line' id='LC10115'>Pity but style was marketable.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10116'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10117'>At last this sort of remark produced an evil result.  Our owner</div><div class='line' id='LC10118'>was a practical person and he perceived that this defect must be</div><div class='line' id='LC10119'>mended if he hoped to find a purchaser for the king.  So he went</div><div class='line' id='LC10120'>to work to take the style out of his sacred majesty.  I could have</div><div class='line' id='LC10121'>given the man some valuable advice, but I didn&#39;t; you mustn&#39;t</div><div class='line' id='LC10122'>volunteer advice to a slave-driver unless you want to damage</div><div class='line' id='LC10123'>the cause you are arguing for.  I had found it a sufficiently</div><div class='line' id='LC10124'>difficult job to reduce the king&#39;s style to a peasant&#39;s style,</div><div class='line' id='LC10125'>even when he was a willing and anxious pupil; now then, to undertake</div><div class='line' id='LC10126'>to reduce the king&#39;s style to a slave&#39;s style--and by force--go to!</div><div class='line' id='LC10127'>it was a stately contract.  Never mind the details--it will save me</div><div class='line' id='LC10128'>trouble to let you imagine them.  I will only remark that at the</div><div class='line' id='LC10129'>end of a week there was plenty of evidence that lash and club</div><div class='line' id='LC10130'>and fist had done their work well; the king&#39;s body was a sight</div><div class='line' id='LC10131'>to see--and to weep over; but his spirit?--why, it wasn&#39;t even</div><div class='line' id='LC10132'>phased.  Even that dull clod of a slave-driver was able to see</div><div class='line' id='LC10133'>that there can be such a thing as a slave who will remain a man</div><div class='line' id='LC10134'>till he dies; whose bones you can break, but whose manhood you</div><div class='line' id='LC10135'>can&#39;t.  This man found that from his first effort down to his</div><div class='line' id='LC10136'>latest, he couldn&#39;t ever come within reach of the king, but the</div><div class='line' id='LC10137'>king was ready to plunge for him, and did it.  So he gave up</div><div class='line' id='LC10138'>at last, and left the king in possession of his style unimpaired.</div><div class='line' id='LC10139'>The fact is, the king was a good deal more than a king, he was</div><div class='line' id='LC10140'>a man; and when a man is a man, you can&#39;t knock it out of him.</div><div class='line' id='LC10141'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10142'>We had a rough time for a month, tramping to and fro in the earth,</div><div class='line' id='LC10143'>and suffering.  And what Englishman was the most interested in</div><div class='line' id='LC10144'>the slavery question by that time?  His grace the king!  Yes; from</div><div class='line' id='LC10145'>being the most indifferent, he was become the most interested.</div><div class='line' id='LC10146'>He was become the bitterest hater of the institution I had ever</div><div class='line' id='LC10147'>heard talk.  And so I ventured to ask once more a question which</div><div class='line' id='LC10148'>I had asked years before and had gotten such a sharp answer that</div><div class='line' id='LC10149'>I had not thought it prudent to meddle in the matter further.</div><div class='line' id='LC10150'>Would he abolish slavery?</div><div class='line' id='LC10151'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10152'>His answer was as sharp as before, but it was music this time;</div><div class='line' id='LC10153'>I shouldn&#39;t ever wish to hear pleasanter, though the profanity</div><div class='line' id='LC10154'>was not good, being awkwardly put together, and with the crash-word</div><div class='line' id='LC10155'>almost in the middle instead of at the end, where, of course, it</div><div class='line' id='LC10156'>ought to have been.</div><div class='line' id='LC10157'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10158'>I was ready and willing to get free now; I hadn&#39;t wanted to get</div><div class='line' id='LC10159'>free any sooner.  No, I cannot quite say that.  I had wanted to,</div><div class='line' id='LC10160'>but I had not been willing to take desperate chances, and had</div><div class='line' id='LC10161'>always dissuaded the king from them.  But now--ah, it was a new</div><div class='line' id='LC10162'>atmosphere!  Liberty would be worth any cost that might be put</div><div class='line' id='LC10163'>upon it now.  I set about a plan, and was straightway charmed</div><div class='line' id='LC10164'>with it.  It would require time, yes, and patience, too, a great</div><div class='line' id='LC10165'>deal of both.  One could invent quicker ways, and fully as sure</div><div class='line' id='LC10166'>ones; but none that would be as picturesque as this; none that</div><div class='line' id='LC10167'>could be made so dramatic.  And so I was not going to give this</div><div class='line' id='LC10168'>one up.  It might delay us months, but no matter, I would carry</div><div class='line' id='LC10169'>it out or break something.</div><div class='line' id='LC10170'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10171'>Now and then we had an adventure.  One night we were overtaken</div><div class='line' id='LC10172'>by a snow-storm while still a mile from the village we were making</div><div class='line' id='LC10173'>for.  Almost instantly we were shut up as in a fog, the driving</div><div class='line' id='LC10174'>snow was so thick.  You couldn&#39;t see a thing, and we were soon</div><div class='line' id='LC10175'>lost.  The slave-driver lashed us desperately, for he saw ruin</div><div class='line' id='LC10176'>before him, but his lashings only made matters worse, for they</div><div class='line' id='LC10177'>drove us further from the road and from likelihood of succor.</div><div class='line' id='LC10178'>So we had to stop at last and slump down in the snow where we</div><div class='line' id='LC10179'>were.  The storm continued until toward midnight, then ceased.</div><div class='line' id='LC10180'>By this time two of our feebler men and three of our women were</div><div class='line' id='LC10181'>dead, and others past moving and threatened with death.  Our</div><div class='line' id='LC10182'>master was nearly beside himself.  He stirred up the living, and</div><div class='line' id='LC10183'>made us stand, jump, slap ourselves, to restore our circulation,</div><div class='line' id='LC10184'>and he helped as well as he could with his whip.</div><div class='line' id='LC10185'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10186'>Now came a diversion.  We heard shrieks and yells, and soon a</div><div class='line' id='LC10187'>woman came running and crying; and seeing our group, she flung</div><div class='line' id='LC10188'>herself into our midst and begged for protection.  A mob of people</div><div class='line' id='LC10189'>came tearing after her, some with torches, and they said she was a</div><div class='line' id='LC10190'>witch who had caused several cows to die by a strange disease,</div><div class='line' id='LC10191'>and practiced her arts by help of a devil in the form of a black</div><div class='line' id='LC10192'>cat.  This poor woman had been stoned until she hardly looked</div><div class='line' id='LC10193'>human, she was so battered and bloody.  The mob wanted to burn her.</div><div class='line' id='LC10194'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10195'>Well, now, what do you suppose our master did?  When we closed</div><div class='line' id='LC10196'>around this poor creature to shelter her, he saw his chance.  He</div><div class='line' id='LC10197'>said, burn her here, or they shouldn&#39;t have her at all.  Imagine</div><div class='line' id='LC10198'>that!  They were willing.  They fastened her to a post; they</div><div class='line' id='LC10199'>brought wood and piled it about her; they applied the torch while</div><div class='line' id='LC10200'>she shrieked and pleaded and strained her two young daughters</div><div class='line' id='LC10201'>to her breast; and our brute, with a heart solely for business,</div><div class='line' id='LC10202'>lashed us into position about the stake and warmed us into life</div><div class='line' id='LC10203'>and commercial value by the same fire which took away the innocent</div><div class='line' id='LC10204'>life of that poor harmless mother.  That was the sort of master we</div><div class='line' id='LC10205'>had.  I took _his_ number.  That snow-storm cost him nine of his</div><div class='line' id='LC10206'>flock; and he was more brutal to us than ever, after that, for</div><div class='line' id='LC10207'>many days together, he was so enraged over his loss.</div><div class='line' id='LC10208'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10209'>We had adventures all along.  One day we ran into a procession.</div><div class='line' id='LC10210'>And such a procession!  All the riffraff of the kingdom seemed</div><div class='line' id='LC10211'>to be comprehended in it; and all drunk at that.  In the van was</div><div class='line' id='LC10212'>a cart with a coffin in it, and on the coffin sat a comely young</div><div class='line' id='LC10213'>girl of about eighteen suckling a baby, which she squeezed to her</div><div class='line' id='LC10214'>breast in a passion of love every little while, and every little</div><div class='line' id='LC10215'>while wiped from its face the tears which her eyes rained down</div><div class='line' id='LC10216'>upon it; and always the foolish little thing smiled up at her,</div><div class='line' id='LC10217'>happy and content, kneading her breast with its dimpled fat hand,</div><div class='line' id='LC10218'>which she patted and fondled right over her breaking heart.</div><div class='line' id='LC10219'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10220'>Men and women, boys and girls, trotted along beside or after</div><div class='line' id='LC10221'>the cart, hooting, shouting profane and ribald remarks, singing</div><div class='line' id='LC10222'>snatches of foul song, skipping, dancing--a very holiday of</div><div class='line' id='LC10223'>hellions, a sickening sight.  We had struck a suburb of London,</div><div class='line' id='LC10224'>outside the walls, and this was a sample of one sort of London</div><div class='line' id='LC10225'>society.  Our master secured a good place for us near the gallows.</div><div class='line' id='LC10226'>A priest was in attendance, and he helped the girl climb up, and</div><div class='line' id='LC10227'>said comforting words to her, and made the under-sheriff provide</div><div class='line' id='LC10228'>a stool for her.  Then he stood there by her on the gallows, and</div><div class='line' id='LC10229'>for a moment looked down upon the mass of upturned faces at his</div><div class='line' id='LC10230'>feet, then out over the solid pavement of heads that stretched away</div><div class='line' id='LC10231'>on every side occupying the vacancies far and near, and then began</div><div class='line' id='LC10232'>to tell the story of the case.  And there was pity in his voice</div><div class='line' id='LC10233'>--how seldom a sound that was in that ignorant and savage land!</div><div class='line' id='LC10234'>I remember every detail of what he said, except the words he said</div><div class='line' id='LC10235'>it in; and so I change it into my own words:</div><div class='line' id='LC10236'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10237'>&quot;Law is intended to mete out justice.  Sometimes it fails. This</div><div class='line' id='LC10238'>cannot be helped.  We can only grieve, and be resigned, and pray</div><div class='line' id='LC10239'>for the soul of him who falls unfairly by the arm of the law, and</div><div class='line' id='LC10240'>that his fellows may be few.  A law sends this poor young thing</div><div class='line' id='LC10241'>to death--and it is right.  But another law had placed her where</div><div class='line' id='LC10242'>she must commit her crime or starve with her child--and before God</div><div class='line' id='LC10243'>that law is responsible for both her crime and her ignominious death!</div><div class='line' id='LC10244'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10245'>&quot;A little while ago this young thing, this child of eighteen years,</div><div class='line' id='LC10246'>was as happy a wife and mother as any in England; and her lips</div><div class='line' id='LC10247'>were blithe with song, which is the native speech of glad and</div><div class='line' id='LC10248'>innocent hearts.  Her young husband was as happy as she; for he was</div><div class='line' id='LC10249'>doing his whole duty, he worked early and late at his handicraft,</div><div class='line' id='LC10250'>his bread was honest bread well and fairly earned, he was prospering,</div><div class='line' id='LC10251'>he was furnishing shelter and sustenance to his family, he was</div><div class='line' id='LC10252'>adding his mite to the wealth of the nation.  By consent of a</div><div class='line' id='LC10253'>treacherous law, instant destruction fell upon this holy home and</div><div class='line' id='LC10254'>swept it away!  That young husband was waylaid and impressed,</div><div class='line' id='LC10255'>and sent to sea.  The wife knew nothing of it.  She sought him</div><div class='line' id='LC10256'>everywhere, she moved the hardest hearts with the supplications</div><div class='line' id='LC10257'>of her tears, the broken eloquence of her despair.  Weeks dragged</div><div class='line' id='LC10258'>by, she watching, waiting, hoping, her mind going slowly to wreck</div><div class='line' id='LC10259'>under the burden of her misery.  Little by little all her small</div><div class='line' id='LC10260'>possessions went for food.  When she could no longer pay her rent,</div><div class='line' id='LC10261'>they turned her out of doors.  She begged, while she had strength;</div><div class='line' id='LC10262'>when she was starving at last, and her milk failing, she stole a</div><div class='line' id='LC10263'>piece of linen cloth of the value of a fourth part of a cent,</div><div class='line' id='LC10264'>thinking to sell it and save her child.  But she was seen by the</div><div class='line' id='LC10265'>owner of the cloth.  She was put in jail and brought to trial.</div><div class='line' id='LC10266'>The man testified to the facts.  A plea was made for her, and her</div><div class='line' id='LC10267'>sorrowful story was told in her behalf.  She spoke, too, by</div><div class='line' id='LC10268'>permission, and said she did steal the cloth, but that her mind</div><div class='line' id='LC10269'>was so disordered of late by trouble that when she was overborne</div><div class='line' id='LC10270'>with hunger all acts, criminal or other, swam meaningless through</div><div class='line' id='LC10271'>her brain and she knew nothing rightly, except that she was so</div><div class='line' id='LC10272'>hungry!  For a moment all were touched, and there was disposition</div><div class='line' id='LC10273'>to deal mercifully with her, seeing that she was so young and</div><div class='line' id='LC10274'>friendless, and her case so piteous, and the law that robbed her</div><div class='line' id='LC10275'>of her support to blame as being the first and only cause of her</div><div class='line' id='LC10276'>transgression; but the prosecuting officer replied that whereas</div><div class='line' id='LC10277'>these things were all true, and most pitiful as well, still there</div><div class='line' id='LC10278'>was much small theft in these days, and mistimed mercy here would</div><div class='line' id='LC10279'>be a danger to property--oh, my God, is there no property in ruined</div><div class='line' id='LC10280'>homes, and orphaned babes, and broken hearts that British law</div><div class='line' id='LC10281'>holds precious!--and so he must require sentence.</div><div class='line' id='LC10282'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10283'>&quot;When the judge put on his black cap, the owner of the stolen</div><div class='line' id='LC10284'>linen rose trembling up, his lip quivering, his face as gray as</div><div class='line' id='LC10285'>ashes; and when the awful words came, he cried out, &#39;Oh, poor</div><div class='line' id='LC10286'>child, poor child, I did not know it was death!&#39; and fell as a</div><div class='line' id='LC10287'>tree falls.  When they lifted him up his reason was gone; before</div><div class='line' id='LC10288'>the sun was set, he had taken his own life.  A kindly man; a man</div><div class='line' id='LC10289'>whose heart was right, at bottom; add his murder to this that</div><div class='line' id='LC10290'>is to be now done here; and charge them both where they belong</div><div class='line' id='LC10291'>--to the rulers and the bitter laws of Britain.  The time is come, my</div><div class='line' id='LC10292'>child; let me pray over thee--not _for_ thee, dear abused poor heart</div><div class='line' id='LC10293'>and innocent, but for them that be guilty of thy ruin and death,</div><div class='line' id='LC10294'>who need it more.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10295'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10296'>After his prayer they put the noose around the young girl&#39;s neck,</div><div class='line' id='LC10297'>and they had great trouble to adjust the knot under her ear,</div><div class='line' id='LC10298'>because she was devouring the baby all the time, wildly kissing it,</div><div class='line' id='LC10299'>and snatching it to her face and her breast, and drenching it</div><div class='line' id='LC10300'>with tears, and half moaning, half shrieking all the while, and the</div><div class='line' id='LC10301'>baby crowing, and laughing, and kicking its feet with delight over</div><div class='line' id='LC10302'>what it took for romp and play.  Even the hangman couldn&#39;t stand it,</div><div class='line' id='LC10303'>but turned away.  When all was ready the priest gently pulled and</div><div class='line' id='LC10304'>tugged and forced the child out of the mother&#39;s arms, and stepped</div><div class='line' id='LC10305'>quickly out of her reach; but she clasped her hands, and made a</div><div class='line' id='LC10306'>wild spring toward him, with a shriek; but the rope--and the</div><div class='line' id='LC10307'>under-sheriff--held her short.  Then she went on her knees and</div><div class='line' id='LC10308'>stretched out her hands and cried:</div><div class='line' id='LC10309'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10310'>&quot;One more kiss--oh, my God, one more, one more,--it is the dying</div><div class='line' id='LC10311'>that begs it!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10312'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10313'>She got it; she almost smothered the little thing.  And when they</div><div class='line' id='LC10314'>got it away again, she cried out:</div><div class='line' id='LC10315'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10316'>&quot;Oh, my child, my darling, it will die!  It has no home, it has</div><div class='line' id='LC10317'>no father, no friend, no mother--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10318'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10319'>&quot;It has them all!&quot; said that good priest.  &quot;All these will I be</div><div class='line' id='LC10320'>to it till I die.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10321'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10322'>You should have seen her face then!  Gratitude?  Lord, what do</div><div class='line' id='LC10323'>you want with words to express that?  Words are only painted fire;</div><div class='line' id='LC10324'>a look is the fire itself.  She gave that look, and carried it away</div><div class='line' id='LC10325'>to the treasury of heaven, where all things that are divine belong.</div><div class='line' id='LC10326'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10327'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10328'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10329'>CHAPTER XXXVI</div><div class='line' id='LC10330'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10331'>AN ENCOUNTER IN THE DARK</div><div class='line' id='LC10332'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10333'>London--to a slave--was a sufficiently interesting place.  It was</div><div class='line' id='LC10334'>merely a great big village; and mainly mud and thatch.  The streets</div><div class='line' id='LC10335'>were muddy, crooked, unpaved.  The populace was an ever flocking</div><div class='line' id='LC10336'>and drifting swarm of rags, and splendors, of nodding plumes and</div><div class='line' id='LC10337'>shining armor.  The king had a palace there; he saw the outside</div><div class='line' id='LC10338'>of it.  It made him sigh; yes, and swear a little, in a poor</div><div class='line' id='LC10339'>juvenile sixth century way.  We saw knights and grandees whom</div><div class='line' id='LC10340'>we knew, but they didn&#39;t know us in our rags and dirt and raw</div><div class='line' id='LC10341'>welts and bruises, and wouldn&#39;t have recognized us if we had hailed</div><div class='line' id='LC10342'>them, nor stopped to answer, either, it being unlawful to speak</div><div class='line' id='LC10343'>with slaves on a chain.  Sandy passed within ten yards of me on</div><div class='line' id='LC10344'>a mule--hunting for me, I imagined.  But the thing which clean</div><div class='line' id='LC10345'>broke my heart was something which happened in front of our old</div><div class='line' id='LC10346'>barrack in a square, while we were enduring the spectacle of a man</div><div class='line' id='LC10347'>being boiled to death in oil for counterfeiting pennies.  It was</div><div class='line' id='LC10348'>the sight of a newsboy--and I couldn&#39;t get at him!  Still, I had</div><div class='line' id='LC10349'>one comfort--here was proof that Clarence was still alive and</div><div class='line' id='LC10350'>banging away.  I meant to be with him before long; the thought was</div><div class='line' id='LC10351'>full of cheer.</div><div class='line' id='LC10352'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10353'>I had one little glimpse of another thing, one day, which gave me</div><div class='line' id='LC10354'>a great uplift.  It was a wire stretching from housetop to housetop.</div><div class='line' id='LC10355'>Telegraph or telephone, sure.  I did very much wish I had a little</div><div class='line' id='LC10356'>piece of it.  It was just what I needed, in order to carry out my</div><div class='line' id='LC10357'>project of escape.  My idea was to get loose some night, along with</div><div class='line' id='LC10358'>the king, then gag and bind our master, change clothes with him,</div><div class='line' id='LC10359'>batter him into the aspect of a stranger, hitch him to the slave-chain,</div><div class='line' id='LC10360'>assume possession of the property, march to Camelot, and--</div><div class='line' id='LC10361'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10362'>But you get my idea; you see what a stunning dramatic surprise</div><div class='line' id='LC10363'>I would wind up with at the palace.  It was all feasible, if</div><div class='line' id='LC10364'>I could only get hold of a slender piece of iron which I could</div><div class='line' id='LC10365'>shape into a lock-pick.  I could then undo the lumbering padlocks</div><div class='line' id='LC10366'>with which our chains were fastened, whenever I might choose.</div><div class='line' id='LC10367'>But I never had any luck; no such thing ever happened to fall</div><div class='line' id='LC10368'>in my way.  However, my chance came at last.  A gentleman who</div><div class='line' id='LC10369'>had come twice before to dicker for me, without result, or indeed</div><div class='line' id='LC10370'>any approach to a result, came again.  I was far from expecting</div><div class='line' id='LC10371'>ever to belong to him, for the price asked for me from the time</div><div class='line' id='LC10372'>I was first enslaved was exorbitant, and always provoked either</div><div class='line' id='LC10373'>anger or derision, yet my master stuck stubbornly to it--twenty-two</div><div class='line' id='LC10374'>dollars.  He wouldn&#39;t bate a cent.  The king was greatly admired,</div><div class='line' id='LC10375'>because of his grand physique, but his kingly style was against</div><div class='line' id='LC10376'>him, and he wasn&#39;t salable; nobody wanted that kind of a slave.</div><div class='line' id='LC10377'>I considered myself safe from parting from him because of my</div><div class='line' id='LC10378'>extravagant price.  No, I was not expecting to ever belong to</div><div class='line' id='LC10379'>this gentleman whom I have spoken of, but he had something which</div><div class='line' id='LC10380'>I expected would belong to me eventually, if he would but visit</div><div class='line' id='LC10381'>us often enough.  It was a steel thing with a long pin to it, with</div><div class='line' id='LC10382'>which his long cloth outside garment was fastened together in</div><div class='line' id='LC10383'>front.  There were three of them. He had disappointed me twice,</div><div class='line' id='LC10384'>because he did not come quite close enough to me to make my project</div><div class='line' id='LC10385'>entirely safe; but this time I succeeded; I captured the lower</div><div class='line' id='LC10386'>clasp of the three, and when he missed it he thought he had lost</div><div class='line' id='LC10387'>it on the way.</div><div class='line' id='LC10388'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10389'>I had a chance to be glad about a minute, then straightway a chance</div><div class='line' id='LC10390'>to be sad again.  For when the purchase was about to fail, as usual,</div><div class='line' id='LC10391'>the master suddenly spoke up and said what would be worded thus</div><div class='line' id='LC10392'>--in modern English:</div><div class='line' id='LC10393'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10394'>&quot;I&#39;ll tell you what I&#39;ll do.  I&#39;m tired supporting these two for</div><div class='line' id='LC10395'>no good.  Give me twenty-two dollars for this one, and I&#39;ll throw</div><div class='line' id='LC10396'>the other one in.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10397'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10398'>The king couldn&#39;t get his breath, he was in such a fury.  He began</div><div class='line' id='LC10399'>to choke and gag, and meantime the master and the gentleman moved</div><div class='line' id='LC10400'>away discussing.</div><div class='line' id='LC10401'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10402'>&quot;An ye will keep the offer open--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10403'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10404'>&quot;&#39;Tis open till the morrow at this hour.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10405'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10406'>&quot;Then I will answer you at that time,&quot; said the gentleman, and</div><div class='line' id='LC10407'>disappeared, the master following him.</div><div class='line' id='LC10408'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10409'>I had a time of it to cool the king down, but I managed it.</div><div class='line' id='LC10410'>I whispered in his ear, to this effect:</div><div class='line' id='LC10411'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10412'>&quot;Your grace _will_ go for nothing, but after another fashion.  And</div><div class='line' id='LC10413'>so shall I.  To-night we shall both be free.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10414'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10415'>&quot;Ah!  How is that?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10416'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10417'>&quot;With this thing which I have stolen, I will unlock these locks</div><div class='line' id='LC10418'>and cast off these chains to-night.  When he comes about nine-thirty</div><div class='line' id='LC10419'>to inspect us for the night, we will seize him, gag him, batter</div><div class='line' id='LC10420'>him, and early in the morning we will march out of this town,</div><div class='line' id='LC10421'>proprietors of this caravan of slaves.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10422'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10423'>That was as far as I went, but the king was charmed and satisfied.</div><div class='line' id='LC10424'>That evening we waited patiently for our fellow-slaves to get</div><div class='line' id='LC10425'>to sleep and signify it by the usual sign, for you must not take</div><div class='line' id='LC10426'>many chances on those poor fellows if you can avoid it.  It is</div><div class='line' id='LC10427'>best to keep your own secrets.  No doubt they fidgeted only about</div><div class='line' id='LC10428'>as usual, but it didn&#39;t seem so to me.  It seemed to me that they</div><div class='line' id='LC10429'>were going to be forever getting down to their regular snoring.</div><div class='line' id='LC10430'>As the time dragged on I got nervously afraid we shouldn&#39;t have</div><div class='line' id='LC10431'>enough of it left for our needs; so I made several premature</div><div class='line' id='LC10432'>attempts, and merely delayed things by it; for I couldn&#39;t seem</div><div class='line' id='LC10433'>to touch a padlock, there in the dark, without starting a rattle</div><div class='line' id='LC10434'>out of it which interrupted somebody&#39;s sleep and made him turn</div><div class='line' id='LC10435'>over and wake some more of the gang.</div><div class='line' id='LC10436'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10437'>But finally I did get my last iron off, and was a free man once</div><div class='line' id='LC10438'>more.  I took a good breath of relief, and reached for the king&#39;s</div><div class='line' id='LC10439'>irons.  Too late! in comes the master, with a light in one hand</div><div class='line' id='LC10440'>and his heavy walking-staff in the other.  I snuggled close among</div><div class='line' id='LC10441'>the wallow of snorers, to conceal as nearly as possible that I was</div><div class='line' id='LC10442'>naked of irons; and I kept a sharp lookout and prepared to spring</div><div class='line' id='LC10443'>for my man the moment he should bend over me.</div><div class='line' id='LC10444'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10445'>But he didn&#39;t approach.  He stopped, gazed absently toward our</div><div class='line' id='LC10446'>dusky mass a minute, evidently thinking about something else;</div><div class='line' id='LC10447'>then set down his light, moved musingly toward the door, and before</div><div class='line' id='LC10448'>a body could imagine what he was going to do, he was out of the</div><div class='line' id='LC10449'>door and had closed it behind him.</div><div class='line' id='LC10450'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10451'>&quot;Quick!&quot; said the king.  &quot;Fetch him back!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10452'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10453'>Of course, it was the thing to do, and I was up and out in a</div><div class='line' id='LC10454'>moment.  But, dear me, there were no lamps in those days, and</div><div class='line' id='LC10455'>it was a dark night.  But I glimpsed a dim figure a few steps</div><div class='line' id='LC10456'>away.  I darted for it, threw myself upon it, and then there was</div><div class='line' id='LC10457'>a state of things and lively!  We fought and scuffled and struggled,</div><div class='line' id='LC10458'>and drew a crowd in no time.  They took an immense interest in</div><div class='line' id='LC10459'>the fight and encouraged us all they could, and, in fact, couldn&#39;t</div><div class='line' id='LC10460'>have been pleasanter or more cordial if it had been their own</div><div class='line' id='LC10461'>fight.  Then a tremendous row broke out behind us, and as much</div><div class='line' id='LC10462'>as half of our audience left us, with a rush, to invest some</div><div class='line' id='LC10463'>sympathy in that.  Lanterns began to swing in all directions;</div><div class='line' id='LC10464'>it was the watch gathering from far and near.  Presently a halberd</div><div class='line' id='LC10465'>fell across my back, as a reminder, and I knew what it meant.</div><div class='line' id='LC10466'>I was in custody.  So was my adversary.  We were marched off toward</div><div class='line' id='LC10467'>prison, one on each side of the watchman.  Here was disaster,</div><div class='line' id='LC10468'>here was a fine scheme gone to sudden destruction!  I tried to</div><div class='line' id='LC10469'>imagine what would happen when the master should discover that</div><div class='line' id='LC10470'>it was I who had been fighting him; and what would happen if they</div><div class='line' id='LC10471'>jailed us together in the general apartment for brawlers and petty</div><div class='line' id='LC10472'>law-breakers, as was the custom; and what might--</div><div class='line' id='LC10473'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10474'>Just then my antagonist turned his face around in my direction,</div><div class='line' id='LC10475'>the freckled light from the watchman&#39;s tin lantern fell on it,</div><div class='line' id='LC10476'>and, by George, he was the wrong man!</div><div class='line' id='LC10477'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10478'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10479'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10480'>CHAPTER XXXVII</div><div class='line' id='LC10481'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10482'>AN AWFUL PREDICAMENT</div><div class='line' id='LC10483'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10484'>Sleep?  It was impossible.  It would naturally have been impossible</div><div class='line' id='LC10485'>in that noisome cavern of a jail, with its mangy crowd of drunken,</div><div class='line' id='LC10486'>quarrelsome, and song-singing rapscallions.  But the thing that</div><div class='line' id='LC10487'>made sleep all the more a thing not to be dreamed of, was my</div><div class='line' id='LC10488'>racking impatience to get out of this place and find out the whole</div><div class='line' id='LC10489'>size of what might have happened yonder in the slave-quarters</div><div class='line' id='LC10490'>in consequence of that intolerable miscarriage of mine.</div><div class='line' id='LC10491'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10492'>It was a long night, but the morning got around at last.  I made</div><div class='line' id='LC10493'>a full and frank explanation to the court.  I said I was a slave,</div><div class='line' id='LC10494'>the property of the great Earl Grip, who had arrived just after</div><div class='line' id='LC10495'>dark at the Tabard inn in the village on the other side of the</div><div class='line' id='LC10496'>water, and had stopped there over night, by compulsion, he being</div><div class='line' id='LC10497'>taken deadly sick with a strange and sudden disorder.  I had been</div><div class='line' id='LC10498'>ordered to cross to the city in all haste and bring the best</div><div class='line' id='LC10499'>physician; I was doing my best; naturally I was running with all</div><div class='line' id='LC10500'>my might; the night was dark, I ran against this common person</div><div class='line' id='LC10501'>here, who seized me by the throat and began to pummel me, although</div><div class='line' id='LC10502'>I told him my errand, and implored him, for the sake of the great</div><div class='line' id='LC10503'>earl my master&#39;s mortal peril--</div><div class='line' id='LC10504'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10505'>The common person interrupted and said it was a lie; and was going</div><div class='line' id='LC10506'>to explain how I rushed upon him and attacked him without a word--</div><div class='line' id='LC10507'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10508'>&quot;Silence, sirrah!&quot; from the court.  &quot;Take him hence and give him</div><div class='line' id='LC10509'>a few stripes whereby to teach him how to treat the servant of</div><div class='line' id='LC10510'>a nobleman after a different fashion another time.  Go!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10511'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10512'>Then the court begged my pardon, and hoped I would not fail</div><div class='line' id='LC10513'>to tell his lordship it was in no wise the court&#39;s fault that this</div><div class='line' id='LC10514'>high-handed thing had happened.  I said I would make it all right,</div><div class='line' id='LC10515'>and so took my leave.  Took it just in time, too; he was starting</div><div class='line' id='LC10516'>to ask me why I didn&#39;t fetch out these facts the moment I was</div><div class='line' id='LC10517'>arrested.  I said I would if I had thought of it--which was true</div><div class='line' id='LC10518'>--but that I was so battered by that man that all my wit was knocked</div><div class='line' id='LC10519'>out of me--and so forth and so on, and got myself away, still</div><div class='line' id='LC10520'>mumbling.  I didn&#39;t wait for breakfast.  No grass grew under my</div><div class='line' id='LC10521'>feet.  I was soon at the slave quarters.  Empty--everybody gone!</div><div class='line' id='LC10522'>That is, everybody except one body--the slave-master&#39;s.  It lay</div><div class='line' id='LC10523'>there all battered to pulp; and all about were the evidences of</div><div class='line' id='LC10524'>a terrific fight.  There was a rude board coffin on a cart at</div><div class='line' id='LC10525'>the door, and workmen, assisted by the police, were thinning a</div><div class='line' id='LC10526'>road through the gaping crowd in order that they might bring it in.</div><div class='line' id='LC10527'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10528'>I picked out a man humble enough in life to condescend to talk</div><div class='line' id='LC10529'>with one so shabby as I, and got his account of the matter.</div><div class='line' id='LC10530'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10531'>&quot;There were sixteen slaves here.  They rose against their master</div><div class='line' id='LC10532'>in the night, and thou seest how it ended.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10533'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10534'>&quot;Yes.  How did it begin?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10535'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10536'>&quot;There was no witness but the slaves.  They said the slave that</div><div class='line' id='LC10537'>was most valuable got free of his bonds and escaped in some strange</div><div class='line' id='LC10538'>way--by magic arts &#39;twas thought, by reason that he had no key,</div><div class='line' id='LC10539'>and the locks were neither broke nor in any wise injured.  When</div><div class='line' id='LC10540'>the master discovered his loss, he was mad with despair, and threw</div><div class='line' id='LC10541'>himself upon his people with his heavy stick, who resisted and</div><div class='line' id='LC10542'>brake his back and in other and divers ways did give him hurts</div><div class='line' id='LC10543'>that brought him swiftly to his end.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10544'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10545'>&quot;This is dreadful.  It will go hard with the slaves, no doubt,</div><div class='line' id='LC10546'>upon the trial.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10547'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10548'>&quot;Marry, the trial is over.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10549'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10550'>&quot;Over!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10551'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10552'>&quot;Would they be a week, think you--and the matter so simple?  They</div><div class='line' id='LC10553'>were not the half of a quarter of an hour at it.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10554'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10555'>&quot;Why, I don&#39;t see how they could determine which were the guilty</div><div class='line' id='LC10556'>ones in so short a time.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10557'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10558'>&quot;_Which_ ones?  Indeed, they considered not particulars like to that.</div><div class='line' id='LC10559'>They condemned them in a body.  Wit ye not the law?--which men</div><div class='line' id='LC10560'>say the Romans left behind them here when they went--that if one</div><div class='line' id='LC10561'>slave killeth his master all the slaves of that man must die for it.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10562'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10563'>&quot;True.  I had forgotten.  And when will these die?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10564'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10565'>&quot;Belike within a four and twenty hours; albeit some say they will</div><div class='line' id='LC10566'>wait a pair of days more, if peradventure they may find the missing</div><div class='line' id='LC10567'>one meantime.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10568'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10569'>The missing one!  It made me feel uncomfortable.</div><div class='line' id='LC10570'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10571'>&quot;Is it likely they will find him?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10572'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10573'>&quot;Before the day is spent--yes.  They seek him everywhere.  They</div><div class='line' id='LC10574'>stand at the gates of the town, with certain of the slaves who</div><div class='line' id='LC10575'>will discover him to them if he cometh, and none can pass out</div><div class='line' id='LC10576'>but he will be first examined.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10577'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10578'>&quot;Might one see the place where the rest are confined?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10579'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10580'>&quot;The outside of it--yes.  The inside of it--but ye will not want</div><div class='line' id='LC10581'>to see that.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10582'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10583'>I took the address of that prison for future reference and then</div><div class='line' id='LC10584'>sauntered off.  At the first second-hand clothing shop I came to,</div><div class='line' id='LC10585'>up a back street, I got a rough rig suitable for a common seaman</div><div class='line' id='LC10586'>who might be going on a cold voyage, and bound up my face with</div><div class='line' id='LC10587'>a liberal bandage, saying I had a toothache.  This concealed my</div><div class='line' id='LC10588'>worst bruises.  It was a transformation.  I no longer resembled my</div><div class='line' id='LC10589'>former self.  Then I struck out for that wire, found it and</div><div class='line' id='LC10590'>followed it to its den.  It was a little room over a butcher&#39;s</div><div class='line' id='LC10591'>shop--which meant that business wasn&#39;t very brisk in the telegraphic</div><div class='line' id='LC10592'>line.  The young chap in charge was drowsing at his table.  I locked</div><div class='line' id='LC10593'>the door and put the vast key in my bosom.  This alarmed the young</div><div class='line' id='LC10594'>fellow, and he was going to make a noise; but I said:</div><div class='line' id='LC10595'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10596'>&quot;Save your wind; if you open your mouth you are dead, sure.  Tackle</div><div class='line' id='LC10597'>your instrument.  Lively, now!  Call Camelot.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10598'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10599'>&quot;This doth amaze me!  How should such as you know aught of such</div><div class='line' id='LC10600'>matters as--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10601'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10602'>&quot;Call Camelot!  I am a desperate man.  Call Camelot, or get away</div><div class='line' id='LC10603'>from the instrument and I will do it myself.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10604'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10605'>&quot;What--you?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10606'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10607'>&quot;Yes--certainly.  Stop gabbling.  Call the palace.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10608'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10609'>He made the call.</div><div class='line' id='LC10610'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10611'>&quot;Now, then, call Clarence.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10612'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10613'>&quot;Clarence _who_?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10614'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10615'>&quot;Never mind Clarence who.  Say you want Clarence; you&#39;ll get</div><div class='line' id='LC10616'>an answer.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10617'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10618'>He did so.  We waited five nerve-straining minutes--ten minutes</div><div class='line' id='LC10619'>--how long it did seem!--and then came a click that was as familiar</div><div class='line' id='LC10620'>to me as a human voice; for Clarence had been my own pupil.</div><div class='line' id='LC10621'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10622'>&quot;Now, my lad, vacate!  They would have known _my_ touch, maybe,</div><div class='line' id='LC10623'>and so your call was surest; but I&#39;m all right now.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10624'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10625'>He vacated the place and cocked his ear to listen--but it didn&#39;t</div><div class='line' id='LC10626'>win.  I used a cipher.  I didn&#39;t waste any time in sociabilities</div><div class='line' id='LC10627'>with Clarence, but squared away for business, straight-off--thus:</div><div class='line' id='LC10628'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10629'>&quot;The king is here and in danger.  We were captured and brought</div><div class='line' id='LC10630'>here as slaves.  We should not be able to prove our identity</div><div class='line' id='LC10631'>--and the fact is, I am not in a position to try.  Send a telegram</div><div class='line' id='LC10632'>for the palace here which will carry conviction with it.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10633'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10634'>His answer came straight back:</div><div class='line' id='LC10635'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10636'>&quot;They don&#39;t know anything about the telegraph; they haven&#39;t had</div><div class='line' id='LC10637'>any experience yet, the line to London is so new.  Better not</div><div class='line' id='LC10638'>venture that.  They might hang you.  Think up something else.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10639'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10640'>Might hang us!  Little he knew how closely he was crowding the</div><div class='line' id='LC10641'>facts.  I couldn&#39;t think up anything for the moment.  Then an idea</div><div class='line' id='LC10642'>struck me, and I started it along:</div><div class='line' id='LC10643'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10644'>&quot;Send five hundred picked knights with Launcelot in the lead; and</div><div class='line' id='LC10645'>send them on the jump.  Let them enter by the southwest gate, and</div><div class='line' id='LC10646'>look out for the man with a white cloth around his right arm.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10647'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10648'>The answer was prompt:</div><div class='line' id='LC10649'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10650'>&quot;They shall start in half an hour.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10651'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10652'>&quot;All right, Clarence; now tell this lad here that I&#39;m a friend</div><div class='line' id='LC10653'>of yours and a dead-head; and that he must be discreet and say</div><div class='line' id='LC10654'>nothing about this visit of mine.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10655'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10656'>The instrument began to talk to the youth and I hurried away.</div><div class='line' id='LC10657'>I fell to ciphering.  In half an hour it would be nine o&#39;clock.</div><div class='line' id='LC10658'>Knights and horses in heavy armor couldn&#39;t travel very fast.</div><div class='line' id='LC10659'>These would make the best time they could, and now that the ground</div><div class='line' id='LC10660'>was in good condition, and no snow or mud, they would probably</div><div class='line' id='LC10661'>make a seven-mile gait; they would have to change horses a couple</div><div class='line' id='LC10662'>of times; they would arrive about six, or a little after; it would</div><div class='line' id='LC10663'>still be plenty light enough; they would see the white cloth which</div><div class='line' id='LC10664'>I should tie around my right arm, and I would take command.  We</div><div class='line' id='LC10665'>would surround that prison and have the king out in no time.</div><div class='line' id='LC10666'>It would be showy and picturesque enough, all things considered,</div><div class='line' id='LC10667'>though I would have preferred noonday, on account of the more</div><div class='line' id='LC10668'>theatrical aspect the thing would have.</div><div class='line' id='LC10669'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10670'>Now, then, in order to increase the strings to my bow, I thought</div><div class='line' id='LC10671'>I would look up some of those people whom I had formerly recognized,</div><div class='line' id='LC10672'>and make myself known.  That would help us out of our scrape,</div><div class='line' id='LC10673'>without the knights.  But I must proceed cautiously, for it was</div><div class='line' id='LC10674'>a risky business.  I must get into sumptuous raiment, and it</div><div class='line' id='LC10675'>wouldn&#39;t do to run and jump into it.  No, I must work up to it</div><div class='line' id='LC10676'>by degrees, buying suit after suit of clothes, in shops wide apart,</div><div class='line' id='LC10677'>and getting a little finer article with each change, until I should</div><div class='line' id='LC10678'>finally reach silk and velvet, and be ready for my project.  So</div><div class='line' id='LC10679'>I started.</div><div class='line' id='LC10680'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10681'>But the scheme fell through like scat!  The first corner I turned,</div><div class='line' id='LC10682'>I came plump upon one of our slaves, snooping around with a watchman.</div><div class='line' id='LC10683'>I coughed at the moment, and he gave me a sudden look that bit right</div><div class='line' id='LC10684'>into my marrow.  I judge he thought he had heard that cough before.</div><div class='line' id='LC10685'>I turned immediately into a shop and worked along down the counter,</div><div class='line' id='LC10686'>pricing things and watching out of the corner of my eye.  Those</div><div class='line' id='LC10687'>people had stopped, and were talking together and looking in at</div><div class='line' id='LC10688'>the door.  I made up my mind to get out the back way, if there</div><div class='line' id='LC10689'>was a back way, and I asked the shopwoman if I could step out</div><div class='line' id='LC10690'>there and look for the escaped slave, who was believed to be in</div><div class='line' id='LC10691'>hiding back there somewhere, and said I was an officer in disguise,</div><div class='line' id='LC10692'>and my pard was yonder at the door with one of the murderers in</div><div class='line' id='LC10693'>charge, and would she be good enough to step there and tell him</div><div class='line' id='LC10694'>he needn&#39;t wait, but had better go at once to the further end of</div><div class='line' id='LC10695'>the back alley and be ready to head him off when I rousted him out.</div><div class='line' id='LC10696'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10697'>She was blazing with eagerness to see one of those already celebrated</div><div class='line' id='LC10698'>murderers, and she started on the errand at once.  I slipped out</div><div class='line' id='LC10699'>the back way, locked the door behind me, put the key in my pocket</div><div class='line' id='LC10700'>and started off, chuckling to myself and comfortable.</div><div class='line' id='LC10701'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10702'>Well, I had gone and spoiled it again, made another mistake.</div><div class='line' id='LC10703'>A double one, in fact.  There were plenty of ways to get rid of</div><div class='line' id='LC10704'>that officer by some simple and plausible device, but no, I must</div><div class='line' id='LC10705'>pick out a picturesque one; it is the crying defect of my character.</div><div class='line' id='LC10706'>And then, I had ordered my procedure upon what the officer, being</div><div class='line' id='LC10707'>human, would _naturally_ do; whereas when you are least expecting it,</div><div class='line' id='LC10708'>a man will now and then go and do the very thing which it&#39;s _not_</div><div class='line' id='LC10709'>natural for him to do.  The natural thing for the officer to do,</div><div class='line' id='LC10710'>in this case, was to follow straight on my heels; he would find</div><div class='line' id='LC10711'>a stout oaken door, securely locked, between him and me; before</div><div class='line' id='LC10712'>he could break it down, I should be far away and engaged in slipping</div><div class='line' id='LC10713'>into a succession of baffling disguises which would soon get me</div><div class='line' id='LC10714'>into a sort of raiment which was a surer protection from meddling</div><div class='line' id='LC10715'>law-dogs in Britain than any amount of mere innocence and purity</div><div class='line' id='LC10716'>of character.  But instead of doing the natural thing, the officer</div><div class='line' id='LC10717'>took me at my word, and followed my instructions.  And so, as I</div><div class='line' id='LC10718'>came trotting out of that cul de sac, full of satisfaction with my</div><div class='line' id='LC10719'>own cleverness, he turned the corner and I walked right into his</div><div class='line' id='LC10720'>handcuffs.  If I had known it was a cul de sac--however, there</div><div class='line' id='LC10721'>isn&#39;t any excusing a blunder like that, let it go.  Charge it up</div><div class='line' id='LC10722'>to profit and loss.</div><div class='line' id='LC10723'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10724'>Of course, I was indignant, and swore I had just come ashore from</div><div class='line' id='LC10725'>a long voyage, and all that sort of thing--just to see, you know,</div><div class='line' id='LC10726'>if it would deceive that slave.  But it didn&#39;t.  He knew me.  Then</div><div class='line' id='LC10727'>I reproached him for betraying me.  He was more surprised than</div><div class='line' id='LC10728'>hurt.  He stretched his eyes wide, and said:</div><div class='line' id='LC10729'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10730'>&quot;What, wouldst have me let thee, of all men, escape and not hang</div><div class='line' id='LC10731'>with us, when thou&#39;rt the very _cause_ of our hanging?  Go to!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10732'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10733'>&quot;Go to&quot; was their way of saying &quot;I should smile!&quot; or &quot;I like that!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10734'>Queer talkers, those people.</div><div class='line' id='LC10735'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10736'>Well, there was a sort of bastard justice in his view of the case,</div><div class='line' id='LC10737'>and so I dropped the matter.  When you can&#39;t cure a disaster by</div><div class='line' id='LC10738'>argument, what is the use to argue?  It isn&#39;t my way.  So I only said:</div><div class='line' id='LC10739'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10740'>&quot;You&#39;re not going to be hanged.  None of us are.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10741'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10742'>Both men laughed, and the slave said:</div><div class='line' id='LC10743'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10744'>&quot;Ye have not ranked as a fool--before.  You might better keep</div><div class='line' id='LC10745'>your reputation, seeing the strain would not be for long.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10746'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10747'>&quot;It will stand it, I reckon.  Before to-morrow we shall be out</div><div class='line' id='LC10748'>of prison, and free to go where we will, besides.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10749'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10750'>The witty officer lifted at his left ear with his thumb, made</div><div class='line' id='LC10751'>a rasping noise in his throat, and said:</div><div class='line' id='LC10752'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10753'>&quot;Out of prison--yes--ye say true.  And free likewise to go where</div><div class='line' id='LC10754'>ye will, so ye wander not out of his grace the Devil&#39;s sultry realm.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10755'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10756'>I kept my temper, and said, indifferently:</div><div class='line' id='LC10757'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10758'>&quot;Now I suppose you really think we are going to hang within</div><div class='line' id='LC10759'>a day or two.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10760'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10761'>&quot;I thought it not many minutes ago, for so the thing was decided</div><div class='line' id='LC10762'>and proclaimed.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10763'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10764'>&quot;Ah, then you&#39;ve changed your mind, is that it?&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10765'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10766'>&quot;Even that.  I only _thought_, then; I _know_, now.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10767'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10768'>I felt sarcastical, so I said:</div><div class='line' id='LC10769'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10770'>&quot;Oh, sapient servant of the law, condescend to tell us, then,</div><div class='line' id='LC10771'>what you _know_.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10772'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10773'>&quot;That ye will all be hanged _to-day_, at mid-afternoon!  Oho! that</div><div class='line' id='LC10774'>shot hit home!  Lean upon me.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10775'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10776'>The fact is I did need to lean upon somebody.  My knights couldn&#39;t</div><div class='line' id='LC10777'>arrive in time.  They would be as much as three hours too late.</div><div class='line' id='LC10778'>Nothing in the world could save the King of England; nor me, which</div><div class='line' id='LC10779'>was more important.  More important, not merely to me, but to</div><div class='line' id='LC10780'>the nation--the only nation on earth standing ready to blossom</div><div class='line' id='LC10781'>into civilization.  I was sick.  I said no more, there wasn&#39;t</div><div class='line' id='LC10782'>anything to say.  I knew what the man meant; that if the missing</div><div class='line' id='LC10783'>slave was found, the postponement would be revoked, the execution</div><div class='line' id='LC10784'>take place to-day.  Well, the missing slave was found.</div><div class='line' id='LC10785'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10786'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10787'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10788'>CHAPTER XXXVIII</div><div class='line' id='LC10789'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10790'>SIR LAUNCELOT AND KNIGHTS TO THE RESCUE</div><div class='line' id='LC10791'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10792'>Nearing four in the afternoon.  The scene was just outside the</div><div class='line' id='LC10793'>walls of London.  A cool, comfortable, superb day, with a brilliant</div><div class='line' id='LC10794'>sun; the kind of day to make one want to live, not die.  The</div><div class='line' id='LC10795'>multitude was prodigious and far-reaching; and yet we fifteen</div><div class='line' id='LC10796'>poor devils hadn&#39;t a friend in it.  There was something painful</div><div class='line' id='LC10797'>in that thought, look at it how you might.  There we sat, on our</div><div class='line' id='LC10798'>tall scaffold, the butt of the hate and mockery of all those</div><div class='line' id='LC10799'>enemies.  We were being made a holiday spectacle.  They had built</div><div class='line' id='LC10800'>a sort of grand stand for the nobility and gentry, and these were</div><div class='line' id='LC10801'>there in full force, with their ladies.  We recognized a good</div><div class='line' id='LC10802'>many of them.</div><div class='line' id='LC10803'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10804'>The crowd got a brief and unexpected dash of diversion out of</div><div class='line' id='LC10805'>the king.  The moment we were freed of our bonds he sprang up,</div><div class='line' id='LC10806'>in his fantastic rags, with face bruised out of all recognition, and</div><div class='line' id='LC10807'>proclaimed himself Arthur, King of Britain, and denounced the</div><div class='line' id='LC10808'>awful penalties of treason upon every soul there present if hair</div><div class='line' id='LC10809'>of his sacred head were touched.  It startled and surprised him</div><div class='line' id='LC10810'>to hear them break into a vast roar of laughter.  It wounded his</div><div class='line' id='LC10811'>dignity, and he locked himself up in silence.  Then, although</div><div class='line' id='LC10812'>the crowd begged him to go on, and tried to provoke him to it</div><div class='line' id='LC10813'>by catcalls, jeers, and shouts of:</div><div class='line' id='LC10814'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10815'>&quot;Let him speak!  The king!  The king! his humble subjects hunger</div><div class='line' id='LC10816'>and thirst for words of wisdom out of the mouth of their master</div><div class='line' id='LC10817'>his Serene and Sacred Raggedness!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10818'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10819'>But it went for nothing.  He put on all his majesty and sat under</div><div class='line' id='LC10820'>this rain of contempt and insult unmoved.  He certainly was great</div><div class='line' id='LC10821'>in his way.  Absently, I had taken off my white bandage and wound</div><div class='line' id='LC10822'>it about my right arm.  When the crowd noticed this, they began</div><div class='line' id='LC10823'>upon me.  They said:</div><div class='line' id='LC10824'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10825'>&quot;Doubtless this sailor-man is his minister--observe his costly</div><div class='line' id='LC10826'>badge of office!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10827'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10828'>I let them go on until they got tired, and then I said:</div><div class='line' id='LC10829'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10830'>&quot;Yes, I am his minister, The Boss; and to-morrow you will hear</div><div class='line' id='LC10831'>that from Camelot which--&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10832'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10833'>I got no further.  They drowned me out with joyous derision.  But</div><div class='line' id='LC10834'>presently there was silence; for the sheriffs of London, in their</div><div class='line' id='LC10835'>official robes, with their subordinates, began to make a stir which</div><div class='line' id='LC10836'>indicated that business was about to begin.  In the hush which</div><div class='line' id='LC10837'>followed, our crime was recited, the death warrant read, then</div><div class='line' id='LC10838'>everybody uncovered while a priest uttered a prayer.</div><div class='line' id='LC10839'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10840'>Then a slave was blindfolded; the hangman unslung his rope.  There</div><div class='line' id='LC10841'>lay the smooth road below us, we upon one side of it, the banked</div><div class='line' id='LC10842'>multitude wailing its other side--a good clear road, and kept free</div><div class='line' id='LC10843'>by the police--how good it would be to see my five hundred horsemen</div><div class='line' id='LC10844'>come tearing down it!  But no, it was out of the possibilities.</div><div class='line' id='LC10845'>I followed its receding thread out into the distance--not a horseman</div><div class='line' id='LC10846'>on it, or sign of one.</div><div class='line' id='LC10847'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10848'>There was a jerk, and the slave hung dangling; dangling and hideously</div><div class='line' id='LC10849'>squirming, for his limbs were not tied.</div><div class='line' id='LC10850'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10851'>A second rope was unslung, in a moment another slave was dangling.</div><div class='line' id='LC10852'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10853'>In a minute a third slave was struggling in the air.  It was</div><div class='line' id='LC10854'>dreadful.  I turned away my head a moment, and when I turned back</div><div class='line' id='LC10855'>I missed the king!  They were blindfolding him!  I was paralyzed;</div><div class='line' id='LC10856'>I couldn&#39;t move, I was choking, my tongue was petrified.  They</div><div class='line' id='LC10857'>finished blindfolding him, they led him under the rope.  I couldn&#39;t</div><div class='line' id='LC10858'>shake off that clinging impotence.  But when I saw them put the</div><div class='line' id='LC10859'>noose around his neck, then everything let go in me and I made</div><div class='line' id='LC10860'>a spring to the rescue--and as I made it I shot one more glance</div><div class='line' id='LC10861'>abroad--by George! here they came, a-tilting!--five hundred mailed</div><div class='line' id='LC10862'>and belted knights on bicycles!</div><div class='line' id='LC10863'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10864'>The grandest sight that ever was seen.  Lord, how the plumes</div><div class='line' id='LC10865'>streamed, how the sun flamed and flashed from the endless procession</div><div class='line' id='LC10866'>of webby wheels!</div><div class='line' id='LC10867'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10868'>I waved my right arm as Launcelot swept in--he recognized my rag</div><div class='line' id='LC10869'>--I tore away noose and bandage, and shouted:</div><div class='line' id='LC10870'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10871'>&quot;On your knees, every rascal of you, and salute the king!  Who</div><div class='line' id='LC10872'>fails shall sup in hell to-night!&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10873'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10874'>I always use that high style when I&#39;m climaxing an effect.  Well,</div><div class='line' id='LC10875'>it was noble to see Launcelot and the boys swarm up onto that</div><div class='line' id='LC10876'>scaffold and heave sheriffs and such overboard.  And it was fine</div><div class='line' id='LC10877'>to see that astonished multitude go down on their knees and beg</div><div class='line' id='LC10878'>their lives of the king they had just been deriding and insulting.</div><div class='line' id='LC10879'>And as he stood apart there, receiving this homage in rags,</div><div class='line' id='LC10880'>I thought to myself, well, really there is something peculiarly</div><div class='line' id='LC10881'>grand about the gait and bearing of a king, after all.</div><div class='line' id='LC10882'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10883'>I was immensely satisfied.  Take the whole situation all around,</div><div class='line' id='LC10884'>it was one of the gaudiest effects I ever instigated.</div><div class='line' id='LC10885'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10886'>And presently up comes Clarence, his own self! and winks, and</div><div class='line' id='LC10887'>says, very modernly:</div><div class='line' id='LC10888'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10889'>&quot;Good deal of a surprise, wasn&#39;t it?  I knew you&#39;d like it.  I&#39;ve</div><div class='line' id='LC10890'>had the boys practicing this long time, privately; and just hungry</div><div class='line' id='LC10891'>for a chance to show off.&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC10892'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10893'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10894'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10895'>CHAPTER XXXIX</div><div class='line' id='LC10896'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10897'>THE YANKEE&#39;S FIGHT WITH THE KNIGHTS</div><div class='line' id='LC10898'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC10899'>Home again, at Camelot.  A morning or two later I found the paper,</div><div class='line' id='LC10900'>damp from the press, by my plate at the breakfast table.  I turned</div><div class='line' id='LC10901'>to the advertising columns, knowing I should find something of</div><div class='line' id='LC10902'>personal interest to me there.
